loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 68 years old and widowed with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sacks of charcoal, sugar, soap, oil, soy sauce, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and raising chickens.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sacks of charcoal, sugar, soap, oil, soy sauce, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Laysrun

texts.en:
Laysrun, 34, is a married woman who lives in a small community of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has two dependent children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland which is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers. On average, she can generate an earning of USD 5 per day.

Recently, she came up with new business idea as a supplementary income. She wants to raise chicks and sell them when they are big enough to sell. 

Because of insufficient capital investment, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy chicks to raise and sell. She hopes that this loan will help her new family business get successful, as well as generate income for her family. She would like to say thanks to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy chicks

loans.name: Ethyl

texts.en:
Ethyl is an industrious mother from Dulag, Leyte, Philippines. She has four children, ages 11, 8, 5 and 2 years old. 

She engages in a food vending business. She sells puto (rice cake). She has been making and selling rice cakes for 10 years now. Ethyl has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase a steamer, and ingredients like rice flour, sugar and leavening agent. 

Ethyl hopes to expand her food vending business to be able to provide her growing children with a quality education as well as better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a steamer, and ingredients like rice flour, sugar and leavening agent.

loans.name: Binya

texts.en:
Binya is a maize farmer from Kyasge village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Binya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Binya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Binya said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses like child school fees, food, and farm loan repayment

loans.name: Tweyambe Hakabanda Group

texts.en: John, a married man with four children, started butchery in 2008 along with farming as his source of income in Kagadi, Uganda. Because he is hard working, he desires to grow his business despite challenges of lack of enough capital. John intends to use credit to buy animals to slaughter. He is a member of Tweyambe Hakabanda where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy pigs for slaughtering to sell.

loans.name: Tweimukye Bukumi Group

texts.en: John is a Ugandan man, hardworking, age 56 years with nine children. He lives in Kagadi where he has been operating a retail shop and farming since 1977 for increased incomes. He hopes to educate his children. John is challenged by competition from similar businesses. He is asking for a loan to buy sugar, salt and cooking oil to add to his business. He is a member of Bukumi Tweimukye where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and cooking oil

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 30 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years, and also earns an income from direct selling of Tupperware products.

Evelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en: An old woman living in Kampong Speu province, Khorn is 64-years-old. Because of her living, she grows rice as her single source of income. She can earn income of about 20,000 KHR per day. For Khorn, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of seven to get new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family can have clean water to use and her business grows as well.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is a 39-year-old resident of Kulob town. The inhabitants of Kulob are very welcoming and cheerful people. Gulnona is no exception. She loves visitors; Gulnora is a good hostess, friendly, pleasant in communication, and just a beloved mother. 

Gulnora is married. Currently, her husband is in the Russian Federation to earn income. They have three children. The eldest son is 19; he is a student. The youngest son is 9 years old. The daughter is 14 years old. Gulnora's younger children are high school students. 

Gulnora works as a nurse in a children's hospital. She found a job in the specialty area that she liked. Also in her free time, Gulnora takes orders for tailoring and sewing women's national dresses to sell. She has been involved in this activity for over three years. 

Now Gulnora asks for a loan to buy fabrics. She intends to continue sewing and selling national dresses.

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.en:
Mehriniso was born in 1982. She is a married parent of two children. Mehriniso lives with her husband and children together in her own house, which is located in the country. Her husband is a farmer, and he grows potatoes and carrots. 

Mehriniso also wants to start a business, and in this way earn a living. Mehriniso can sew women's dresses. She learned sewing from a sewer some years ago. Now she wants to use her ability and become a business lady. Mehriniso took part in a course, ‘To Get Ahead’, with a woman's organization, and got a certificate. 

She is asking for a loan of 600 Somoni to buy a sewing machine for starting a new business. This loan will help her to improve her living condition and live happily with her family. She thanks Kiva lenders for support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for starting a new business

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a 27-year-old merchant from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has three children, ages 7, 5 and 1. 

Mary Joy operates a small sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. For more than five years, this venture has given Mary Joy the income that she needs. 

Mary Joy is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments. With this, she will be able to improve the stock in her store, thus attracting more buyers. 

In the future, Mary Joy dreams of making her business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a maize farmer from Kanakargo village. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Esther would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Esther can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Esther said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To access a loan to meet urgent expenses like child school fees, food, and farm loan repayment

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 21 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Lorena has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for four years, and also earns an income from motorcycle transport services.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, 47, lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of six children; four are single and two are married. In the last thirty years, she has been involved in agricultural business. Owning farmland, she grows rice and sells the crops to local dealers and sometimes she sells directly to customers at the market. On average, she can earn USD 2.00 a day. 

Touch is living in a very old house, some of whose parts need to renovated. Due to lacking funds, she is now applying for a KIVA loan through HKL to pay for her house renovation. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Muhira

texts.en: Muhira is married and has 3 children. She has always wanted to provide them with a good quality of life, and that’s why she decided to start new business with animal husbandry in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. She studied at the "To Get Ahead" course for women and got enough business skills. Her husband will help her with her business. She will be a very successful businesswoman. as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 600 TJS to buy cattle to organize her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to organize a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing and various other products

loans.name: Kabalye I Ryekuber Group

texts.en:
Bruno does produce buying and selling in Masindi-Uganda. He is a married man with seven children and two are able to acquire an education. He intends to use the loan to buy beans and groundnuts to sell. He started produce buying and selling in 2001 so as to generate more income to support his family. 

Bruno desires to buy land for his children however price fluctuations hinder his business.

Bruno is a member of Kabalye I Ryekuber Group where members guarantee each other to acquire a loan.

loans.use: to buy beans and groundnuts to sell so he can buy land for his children.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Carlos, de 65 años, inicio con su oficio de construcción y reformas de viviendas en el municipio de Medellín, negocio que inicio con el afán de sostener a su familia y poder salir adelante.

Con su familia, encontró una motivación para trabajar incansablemente y así ofrecerle lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas variadas y de mano para prestar un servicio de mejor calidad y poder trabajar de una manera mas cómoda.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener a su esposa brindándole una calidad de vida mejor y una optima estabilidad económica.

Apoya a Carlos con un préstamo para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Carlos is 65 years old. He started his work constructing and renovating buildings in the municipality of Medellín, a business he started with the urge to support his family and be able to get ahead. In his family he found the motivation to work ceaselessly and thus offer them the best for their lives and development.

He is requesting a loan to buy a variety of hand-tools to provide better service and be able to work more efficiently. With the loan he will be able to support his wife, providing her with a higher quality of living and an optimum economic stability. Support Carlos with this loan so that he can continue with his business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of handtools.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Delfina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling fresh fish and raising pigs. Delfina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. 

Delfina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is an active 20-year-old woman. She is from J.Rumi district. 

Nargis is simultaneously studying and working. She has worked in a microcredit deposit organization for a year. Nargis is also a student. She is studying in absentia at Finance and Economics Institute in the specialty "accounting, analysis and audit in banks." She is a diligent student. 

Nargis is single and lives with her parents. She is an independent woman and pays for her education herself. 

At the moment, she needs $700  to pay a tuition fee. Nargis asks this necessary amount for a loan. She promises to repay the loan on time at the expense of her work.

loans.use: to pay for tuition at the university.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 34-year-old married male with six children; five go to school. Robert used the previous loan to buy clothes for making school uniforms. This has enabled him to pay off his loan and keep his business running.

Robert started the business to pay school fees for all his children, and he is acquiring a loan to buy more uniform materials to make uniforms to sell. He hopes to construct a commercial house, although competition and high rental costs are challenges he faces.

loans.use: to buy uniform materials to make uniforms to sell.

loans.name: Nourdine

texts.fr: Nourdine âgé de 39ans est père de 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés. Il revend des postes téléviseurs à KPALIME et s'approvisionne dans la zone portuaire. Son premier crédit lui permettra d'acheter des postes téléviseurs afin de satisfaire les clients.Il souhaite construire sa boutique et assurer l'épanouissement social de la famille.
texts.en:
Nourdine is 39 years old and father to four children, three of his children currently attend school.  He sells television sets in Kpalime, which he buys from the port area.

This will be Nourdine's first loan and it will enable him to buy television sets so he can respond to the demands of his customers.  He would like to build himself a shop and secure a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy television sets for resale.

loans.name: Arnovis Enrique

texts.es:
Al hablar de Arnovis se puede evidenciar que es un hombre muy trabajador y servicial que todo lo que hace es en bien de su familia y bienestar de la misma.

El vive en una humilde casa en el municipio de Sincelejo donde convive con su esposa y su hijo por los cuales ha luchado para darles una vida digna y una educación de calidad.

El se gana la vida con la venta de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes, pesticidas, entre otros alrededor del municipio y tiene plena fe en su negocio.

Es un individuo trabajador, constante y muy amante de su hijo.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de insumos agropecuarios para abastecer su negocio y así capitalizar su negocio para tener un amplio inventario disponible para vender a sus clientes al por mayor.

El tiene la esperanza de poder encontrar ayuda en las personas de corazón solidario.
texts.en:
If you talk about Arnovis it is evident that he is a hard-working and helpful man who does everything for his family and their well-being. He lives in a humble house in the municipality of Sincelejo with his wife and his son. He strives to provide them a dignified life and quality education.

He makes his living selling agricultural supplies like fertilizers, pesticide, amongst others around his municipality. He has a lot of faith in his business. He is a hard-working individual consistent and very loving of his son.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy a supply of agricultural supplies to stock his business and doing this capitalize his business to have a large inventory ready to sell to his clients wholesale. He hopes to be able to find support from people with sympathetic hearts.

loans.use: to buy a supply of agricultural inputs to stock his business and capitalize his business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una molino nixtamal ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, posee muchos clientes especialmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas ya que ahí llegan a moler el maíz, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de la casa, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella solicita un crédito para comprar lo necesario para el molino como fajas, discos, cuchillas, etc. y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young lady whose face is pixelated because she is 28 and lives in a high-risk area has been grinding nixtamal (treated corn) in her home for 3 years.  She has a wide clientele, particularly women who make tortillas and who bring their corn here to be ground, and her earnings cover some of her household expenses. She lives with her husband in their own home.  She is applying for a loan to buy what she needs for her milling machine (belts, discs, blades, etc.) and thereby boost her income.

loans.use: comprar fajas, discos, cuchillas, etc.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba was born in 1978. She is a hardworking and smart woman. Mahbuba is a careful mother of four children. She lives together with her children and husband, happily but poorly. 

Mahbuba is going to start a business and in this way to improve their living condition. She plans to start a business of animal husbandry. Mahbuba is going to buy six sheep, feed them for some months and sell them in a local market. 

Mahbuba took part in a course from a women's organization called "To Get Ahead" and got a certificate. She is ready to start business because she created a business plan and she has a cowshed, but she has not money to buy six sheep. 

She is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy six sheep. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy six sheep for a new business.

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Sean, 45, lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has five children in total, three are single and two are married. 

In the last 30 years, he has been involved in agri-business. He owns farmland, and he grows rice and sells the crops to the local dealers and sometimes he sells directly to customers at the market. On average, he can an earning USD 2 a day.
 
Sean is living in a very old house and wants to buy a new house. Due to the lack of funds, he is now applying for a Kiva loan through HKL to buy a new house. He thanks all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy a new house.

loans.name: Kiswendsida Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAM représente le groupe KISWENDSIDA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 08ans. 04vont à l’école.Elle a 05personnes en charge.
Elle est restauratrice depuis  03ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02sacs de riz et 01bidon d’huile.
Mme veut épargner ses  bénéfices. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un restaurant et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariam is the representative of the Kiswendsida Group.  She is doing very well.  She is married and has four children.  The eldest child is twenty years old and the youngest is eight years old.  Four of her children currently attend school.  Mariam is responsible for a total of five people.

Mariam has run a restaurant business for three years now.  She buys her supplies from the local market.  She plans to use her loan to buy two sacks of rice and a drum of oil.  Her profits will be saved because she hopes to be able to open her own restaurant in the future.  Mariam would also like to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of rice and 1 drum of oil for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Fructuosa

texts.en:
Fructuosa is a 65-year-old married woman from Dulag, Leyte. She and her husband have a 16 year old daughter.  Her husband is a fish vendor.

She prepares and sells home meals like fish fillet, stewed vegetables, fried chicken  and meat steak. She has been in the food vending business for almost ten years.

Fructuosa requests 10,000 PHP to buy meat, seasonings, vegetables, rice and cooking oil. 

 Fructuosa would like to expand her business to be have a stable source of income and set aside some savings for old age.

loans.use: to buy meat, seasonings, vegetables, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an ambulant household material vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials to sell for her ambulant business.

Elena has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials to sell so as to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a dried fish making business for 15 years. 

She requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.  Elena earns additional income raising pigs.

Elena has sustained her business through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Salveri

texts.en:
Salveri, a 33-year-old married father of two, lives in Kasese, Uganda. For the past six years, Salveri has been operating a retail shop and also earning a salary as a teacher. Since his business is located on a busy street, he has guaranteed customers. He has been able to improve his business and increase his profits from it and buy land due the support given to him by Kiva. 

Through hard work, Salveri is determined to change his financial status and acquire more assets such as land and buildings, despite the challenges of a low salary and price fluctuations. He is now requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, and bricks to build his commercial building.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks to construct his commercial building.

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Jorge es un zapatero experimentado y con gran capacidad de trabajo, tiene un pequeño taller en el que presta servicios de fabricación y reforma de calzado en el municipio de Medellín.

Con este oficio ha intentado salir adelante y ha intentado ganarse la vida.
Trabaja todos los días en un periodo de 12 horas aproximadamente.

Acude a un apoyo económico para comprar insumos como suelas, pegas, cuero y telas para la elaboración de calzado y así poder abastecer su inventario y su capital.

Desde siempre se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre muy emprendedor y laborioso.

Ayuda a Jorge con su negocio y presta a su negocio!
texts.en: Jorge is an experienced and hardworking shoemaker who runs a small workshop in Medellín where he makes and mends footwear. His work has enable him to try to earn a living and make progress. Her works for about 12 hours a day. He is applying for financial support to help him buy supplies such as soles, glue, leather and fabric for making footwear so he will then have enough stock and capital. He has always been known as a very enterprising and hardworking man.  Please help Jorge and his business by lending him some money!

loans.use: to buy supplies such as soles, glue, leather and fabric.

loans.name: Wedan Group

texts.fr:
Mme EDITH est responsable du groupe WEDAN. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 24ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. 03 vont à l'école et elle a 09personnes en charge.
Mme vend de céréales et des pagnes depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne en ville et dans les provinces.
Elle veut s'acheter 10pièces de pagnes, 10sacs de maïs et 10sacs de mil.
Elle veut renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne agrandir son champ d'activité et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Edith is the representative for the Wedan Group.  She is married and has five children.  The eldest child is 24 years old and the youngest is 7 years old.  Three of her children currently attend school, and she is responsible for a total of nine people.

Edith has been selling pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for 11 years now.  She buys her supplies in the town and the local area.  She plans to use her loan to buy 10 pagnes, 10 sacks of maize and 10 sacks of millet.  Her profits will be used to strengthen her business.  In the future, Edith would like to expand the range of goods she offers and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 10 pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing), 10 sacks of maize and 10 sacks of millet for resale.

loans.name: Phebice

texts.en:
Phebice is a 50-year-old single woman with five children who lives in Kasese,Uganda. 

Phebice has been a midwife in health service for twenty five years. She was inspired by other nurses to join the profession. Phebice would like to  finish her house but is faced with high transportation costs from work to home. She is a hard working woman who will use the loan  to buy cement and sand to plaster her house.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to plaster her house.

loans.name: Mario Humberto

texts.es: Mario de 47 años de edad se dedica a la venta de gorras, cinchos, bolsones, carteras, etc. desde hace 10 años su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal, posee muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, Mario vive en casa propia con su esposa, el esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería por mayor y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Mario is 47 years old. He has worked selling caps, belts, bags, purses, etc. for 10 years. His business is located at the Municipal market. He has many customers because of his variety of products and good prices. Mario lives in his own house with his wife. He is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale prices, and in this way have more income.

loans.use: to buy caps, belts, bags, purses, etc. at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Savrigul

texts.en:
Savrigul is a hardworking woman who is going to start a new business in order to get ahead in life. Savrigul comes from Tajikistan. She lives in a rural area with her husband and 3 children. 

Savrigul had not had a source of income for many years . She plans to start a new business  to provide a source of income. Savrigul is  a seamstress with a little experience is sewing who will improve her experience. She will work from her house.  Savrigul took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ and earned a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 600 TJS to buy a sewing machine. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom, 63, lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children, one is single and two are married.

In the last fifteen years, she has had an agri-business to grow rice and sell the crops to local dealers.  She sometimes sells directly to customers at the market. On average, she can earn 5.00 USD a day. 

In addition to farming, she has a sewing business to make simple clothes to sell. She requests a KIVA loan to buy a sewing machine. She hopes that this sewing machine will help her to earn more income. 

She would thank to all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 41-year-old married woman with four children, three attend school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business and requests 1,300 PHP through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

Evelyn has previously borrowed 2 times  from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married woman with five children who works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business and earns additional income growing rice. Erlinda requests 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy meat, spices, and vegetables for her restaurant business.

Erlinda has sustained her business  through 22 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy meat, spices, and vegetables.

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita is 48 years old and married with three children.  She works hard to provide for her family and runs a general store. She requests 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy dozens of eggs, diapers, oil, shampoo, and groceries to sell.

Jelita has borrowed and repaid 10 previous loans from NWTF. She has run the general store for 8 years and earns additional income from loading pre-paid mobile phones.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy eggs, diapers, oil, shampoo, and groceries.

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
Lorelyn, married,  works hard to support her family through income earned in her fish vending business.

She requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.  She has been in this business for 9 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Gouwend Manegre Group

texts.fr:
Mme CHRISTINE est responsable du groupe GOUWEND MANEGRE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 23ans  et le moins  âgé de03ans. 01  va  à l’école.  Elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme est dolotière  depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. 
 Mme veut s’acheter 02sacs de mil germé et une rangée de bois pour la préparation du dolo (bière de mil). 
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Ambitionne toujours agrandir son activité  et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Christine is the representative of the Gouwend Manegre Group. She is in good health. She is a married mother to six children. Her eldest is 23 and the youngest three years old. One of them goes to school. She has four people living under her care. Christine has been making and selling dolo (millet beer) for five years. She buys her supplies in the surrounding villages. She wants to buy two sacks of germinated millet and a stack of wood for the preparation of dolo (millet beer). She wants to reinvest her profits back into her business. Her ambition is to continue to grow her business and to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of germinated millet and a stack of wood for the preparation of dolo (millet beer)

loans.name: Afranio De Jesus

texts.es:
Afranio con 46 años de edad ha tenido gran experiencia en la fabricación de bolsos artesanales gracias a su aprendizaje empirico y la ayuda de sus tioas.

En su negocio fabrica distintos estilos de bolsos y cinturones en fibras naturales.

Con este negocio se ha ganado la vida durante toda su vida he intenta sacar adelante a sus tres hijos menores.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos y materia prima como cáñamo y agujas.
Con estos elementos podrá continuar con su actividad y podrá capitalizar su negocio.
texts.en: Afranio, 46 years old, has had great experience producing handmade purses thanks to his practical training and the help of his aunts. In his business he makes different styles of purses and belts in natural fibers. With this business he has earned money all his life, and keeps trying to raise his three young children. He is requesting a loan to buy inputs and raw material such as hemp and needles. With these elements he will be able to continue with his job and capitalize his business.

loans.use: to buy inputs and raw material such as hemp and needles.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra works hard to support her family. Myra is married and has a buying and selling of gasoline business in the Philippines.

She requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Myra has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Myra would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Olaya Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Olaya despierta cada mañana para brindarles calidad en el servicio de molino a sus clientes. Tiene 53 años de edad está casada y tiene cuatro hijos solo uno de ellos a su cargo. Hace 19 años comenzó en la actividad con el apoyo de su tío para establecer el negocio, ella también cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de su esposo. Requiere el préstamo para realizar mejoras y mantenimiento a los molinos que tiene en funcionamiento. El crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá brindar un mejor servicio y sin inconvenientes. Sus planes futuros son mejorar su vivienda y así poner parte de su casa en alquiler.
texts.en:
Olaya, 53, is married and has four children, only one of them in her care.  She awakens every morning to give her customers quality service in her mill.  She started this job 19 years ago with her uncle's support in establishing the business.  She also has the help of her children and her husband.

Olaya needs the loan to make improvements and perform maintenance on the mills she operates.  The loan will be a big help to her because she'll be able to give better service without any problems.

Her plans for the future are to improve her house and rent out part of it.

loans.use: to make improvements and perform maintenance on her mills

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampong Speu province, Thorn is 31 years old. She is a mother of two children; one is in school, and one is too young. She earns income to improve her living conditions via rice cropping, and it earns her about 22,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

In a group of seven members, she is a group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family has clean water to use.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 43-year-old merchant from Dulag, Leyte. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like noodles, bread, coffee, sugar, shampoo, soap and soft drinks. She has been in that kind of business for more than 10 years. In addition to that, Gina is also a fish vendor. 

She and her husband have six children. Her youngest child is 6 years old. 

Gina has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy stock for the store like rice and soft drinks, and to use as additional capital to purchase fresh fish. 

Gina would like to expand both of her businesses to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock for the store like rice and soft drinks, and to purchase fresh fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, rebar, metal roofing, etc.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 50 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Myrna is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Myrna has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from selling piglets.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leta

texts.pt:
A senhora  Leta de 49 anos de idade é comerciante e proprietaria de uma escolinha na sua casa, casada mae de 2 filhos todos ja maiores de idade sustenta tambem uma neta que vive com ela vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar bebidas, arroz, feijao, acucar, sabao, omo, oleo, massas, bolachas para reforcar o seu negocio.
Tem como projectos e sonhos crescer no seu negocio respondendo todas as necessidades de seus clientes e terminar a construcao de sua casa e construcao de uma eacolinha ampla uma vez que o numero de criancas na escolinha tende a crescer.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e faz xitique como forma de guardar o seu dinheiro, e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en: Leta is a 49-year-old business-woman who also owns and runs a small school in her home. She is a married mother of 2 grown-up children and also supports her grand-daughter, who lives with her. With the loan, Leta will buy drinks, rice, beans, sugar, soap, washing powder, cooking oil, ground maize and biscuits to boost her business. Her aims and dreams involve expanding her business, responding to her clients' needs and finishing the building work on her home as well as building a larger school, as the number of children in attendance is increasing. She says that the greatest challenges she has faced relate to finances and she is part of a xitique initiative (an informal saving and credit arrangement based on mutual trust) as a means of saving money. She intends on applying for further loans in order to realize her plans.

loans.use: to buy drinks, rice, beans, sugar, soap, washing powder, cooking oil, ground maize and biscuits

loans.name: Maria Amelia

texts.es: Maria de 54 años de edad se dedica  a la venta de arreglos florales artificiales y productos de uso personal desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de variedad de flores, canastos, perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, lociones, etc. todo por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
María, 54, has earned a living for 10 years selling artificial flower arrangements and personal care products.  She has a lot of customers because of the quality of her products and her affordable prices.  She's able to pay for some of her household expenses with her sales.  She lives in her own house with her life partner.

María's requesting a loan to make a wholesale purchase of a variety of flowers, baskets, perfume, creams, lotions, deodorants, etc., so she can keep on making sales and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale a variety of flowers, baskets, perfumes, creams, lotions, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his horticultural farm

loans.name: Sinath

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Sinath, 49, is an experienced and active farmer. At home, she is a lovely mother of one dependent child. She is the owner of a small cassava field. By operating a farming business, she can earn around USD 2.50 a day to support her family's daily expenses. So far, she has been involved in this career for 14 years.

To keep her cassava growing well with more crops, Sinath is going to use natural fertilizers on her farmland. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to get a KIVA loan via KHL to buy fertilizers to use in her farming process. With the support from this loan, she hopes that it can make her cassava growing better and produce more crops for her. She thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en: Umeda lives in a rural area. She has 3 children. Umeda’s husband is a farmer. She is going to start a new business with animal husbandry in order to find a source of income and improve living conditions. Umeda has a cowshed at her house. She will buy sheep, feed for some months and sell in a local market. She is asking for a loan of 600 Somoni to buy sheep for organizing her new business. Umeda, in advance, thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy sheep for organizing new business

loans.name: Emmanuela Group

texts.fr:
Mme M. ISABELLE  est responsable du groupe EMMANUELA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a13ans  et le moins  âgé de 01an 07mois. 03  vont  à l’école.  
Mme gère un kiosque  depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. 
 Mme veut s’acheter 01sac de riz, 02bidons d'huile et 20 caisses de boisson. 
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Ambitionne agrandir son activité  et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: M. Isabelle is the representative for the Emmanuela Group. She is doing very well. She is married and has four children. The eldest child is 13 years old and the youngest is one year and seven months old. Three of her children currently attend school. M. Isabelle has been running a stall for six years. She buys her supplies at the local market. She wishes to purchase one sack of rice, two containers of oil and 20 cases of drinks. Her earnings will be reinvested back into her business. M. Isabelle would like to grow her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase one sack of rice, two containers of oil and 20 cases of drinks

loans.name: Laura

texts.pt:
Tem 50 anos de idade, esta a repetir o credito pela terceira vez, vive maritalmente, é professora em exercício a mais de 20 anos, tem 3 filhos todos maiores de idade 2 dois quais já independentes e apenas 1 ainda na sua responsabilidade, para alem de trabalhar tem barraca onde faz negocio em sua casa.
Com o credito pretende comprar cimento, pedra, chapas de zinco para dar continuidade com a  construcao de casas para dar de aluguer, são por enquanto, 3 quartos e todos já com inquilinos.
O seu maior sonho é ampliar mais a construção de casas para aluguer e desenvolver um pouco mais o seu negocio.
Diz não ter grandes desafios, os poucos que tem consegue geri-los
texts.en:
The borrower is 50 years old and this will be her 3rd loan. She lives with her husband and she has been an army-employed teacher for more than 20 years. She has 3 children: 2 of whom are grown up and 1 more that is still in her care. As well as her teaching job, she also runs a stall from where she can do business in her home.
With this loan she wants to buy cement, stone and zinc sheeting in order to continue building houses to rent out. Currently she has 3 houses which all have tenants. Her dream is build more homes to rent out and to further develop her business. She says that she doesn't face any great challenges, the few that she does face she has been able to manage well.

loans.use: to buy cement, stone and zinc sheeting to continue building houses.

loans.name: Kenny Efrain

texts.es:
El socio Kenny Efrain  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de textiles, el socio vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, el socio vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Kenny Efrain continues to work selling textiles. He sells various knit items. He sells sweaters, blankets and knit and woven products. He works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm and has now been doing this work for 8 years. It's going very well for him. His dream is to expand his business selling knit and woven items.

Kenny is requesting the loan to buy sweaters, other knit and woven items. He is glad for the loan and promises to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, other knit and woven items.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Prisca. She is 59 years old, married and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIHEA) in 2013. She does maize, beans and goat farming. With the training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIHEA) she has been able to commercialize her farming, thus earning more profit. 

Prisca is borrowing a loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer. This will enable her increase her production, hence meeting the rising demand for her commodities. She will earn more income which will supplement her husband's income and greatly support her family's basic needs. 

Prisca is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and planting seeds.

loans.name: Miguel Ivan

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre felizmente casado y con un hijo de dos años quien es el principal motor de su vida para salir adelante, por su familia es que  lucha día adía para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Con mucho esfuerzo pudo adquirir un vehículo, un auto, él lo alquila y también en algunas ocasiones hace servicios de taxi. Es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, gracias a la educación de calidad recibidas por sus padres ha crecido como una persona d bien y esos mismos valores son los que cada día inculca a su hijo.
Miguel piensa utilizar este crédito para poder hacer las instalaciones y poner GPS a su carro, de esta manera podrá monitorearlo y evitar inconvenientes. Más adelante espera seguir saliendo adelante y poder obtener otro vehículo.
texts.en:
Miguel is a happily married man with a 2 year old child who is the principal engine in his life pushing him to get ahead. He fights for his family day to day in order to provide them with a better future. 
Through a lot of effort he has been able to acquire a vehicle, a car, which he rents and also uses to perform taxi services on occasion. He is a very responsible, hard working person. Thanks to the quality education his parents gave him, he has grown up as a person of good and he inculcates these same values on his son every day.
Miguel plans to utilize the loan to install a GPS on his car, this way he will be able to monitor it and avoid drawbacks. In the future he hopes to continue getting ahead and be able to obtain another vehicle.

loans.use: install a GPS in his car for better security

loans.name: Alejandrina Benita

texts.es:
La socia Alejandrina Benita se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de gaseosas y cervezas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender las gaseosas y cervezas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar gaseosas y cervezas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner, Alejandrina Benita, continues to focus on her business selling soft drinks and beer. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. She has been in this business now for several years and does quite well for herself. Her dream is to have a locale that she can sell her soft drinks and beer out of. She is requesting this credit to purchase soft drinks and beer. 
She is happy for the loan and she is committed to fulfilling all the repayments.

loans.use: purchase soft drinks and beer

loans.name: Ezakiel

texts.en:
Ezakiel is a small-scale farmer from the remote village of Barsombe in the North Rift region of Kenya. The soil in this area is extremely fertile for agriculture. Ezakiel owns a five acre piece of farmland that hosts his home, where he lives with his wife Mary and two children. 

Ezakiel started farming in 1987. He enjoys having several income sources which include milk, eggs, meat and cash crops. 

To further boost his income, Ezakiel is seeking a KES 68,275 loan to purchase a dairy cow. The milk produced by the new cow will stack up and boost the farm's overall milk production quantity. 

Additional income from the investment will go to his family's basic needs and his children's educational expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita is a 19-year-old student at a university in a city, from Tbong Khmum province of Cambodia. 

Due to a lack of financial support, she would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees. This loan will provide her with a skill to find a job, to build her future. 

After graduation, Nita is going to find a job with a reasonable salary to help her parents.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
This is Hanna, fifty six years old and blessed with six children. 

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to benefit from training for enterprise development and financial management. This has helped to improve her knowledge of business management.

Her economic activity is maize farming. She is borrowing to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticide. This will greatly help in maintaining a steady income. She hopes that by doing this her level of income will increase and thus enable her to educate her children.

Hanna is very grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase: chairs, tables and tablecloths for the rental business

loans.name: Al Yasamine Al Sowairi Group

texts.en:
Al Yasamine Al Sowairi is a group which consists of three hardworking ladies who put so much effort to develop their families' living and businesses at the same time. All of them trust and care about each other, which helped them a lot to acquire the current Al Majmoua loan without hesitation.

Hala is the group's featured borrower. She is a 34-year-old married mother of four children. She works hard with her husband, who works as a barber, to provide them with a better living. All of the children attend an public school currently, and Hala and her husband hope that one day they can register them in a private school where they can benefit from a better education. 

Hala has worked for seven years from her house in preparing and selling special occasion souvenirs and handmade decorations, which is a very artistic business she is running. However, she needs a lot of cash to keep her items updated, which unfortunately she can't save from her income or her husband's because of their family's increasing needs.

Thus her acquired Al Majmoua loan will be invested in buying necessary raw materials such as flowers, special occasion themes, and newly released beads and colorful pieces requested.

Hala is the lady at the center of the picture. As for the other group members, Manal is the lady at the far left side of the picture, a Syrian citizen and married mother of one child who has worked as a hair dresser from her house for six years. Wafika is on the right side of the picture.

loans.use: To buy necessary raw materials such as flowers, special occasion themes, and new released beads and colorful pieces requested

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un joven responsable y honesto, nació en la ciudad de San Vicente y vive junto a su familia en dicha ciudad. Actualmente está trabajando en una gran empresa y también está estudiando, él cree que nunca es tarde para estudiar y quiere convertirse en un gran profesional y brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia por ello está saliendo adelante. En sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar fútbol con sus amigos y pasar gratos momentos con sus seres queridos.
Juan tiene muchos deseos de superación, es por ello que piensa utilizar el crédito para poder comprar sus libros, materiales, entre otros para sus estudios, con esto él espera mejorar su rendimiento académico y así culminar sus estudios con honores y más adelante tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Juan is a responsible and honest young man. He was born in the city of San Vicente and he still lives there with his family. Currently, he is working for a large company while also studying. He believes that it is never too late to study and he hopes to become a professional individual so that he can provide the best of everything for his family, and he is making progress towards this aim. In his free time, he likes to play football with his friends and spends the rest of his free time with his loved ones. Juan is very committed to overcoming difficulties and, as such, he plans to use this loan to buy books and materials, among other items, for his studies. With this loan he hopes to improve his academic performance so that he can complete his studies with honors and, in the future, he hopes to have a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy materials, books and other items for his studies.

loans.name: Jawad

texts.en:
Jawad is 25 years old, divorced, and has one child. He was born in Lebanon and is a Palestinian refugee who lives and works in a Palestinian camp. Jawad is a hard worker who is putting much effort toward developing his family's living, since Palestinians are suffering from limited access to some businesses, working sectors, and services in Lebanon.

Jawad's previous loans from Al Majmoua helped him to develop his family's living through buying a car and using it for rental purposes as an additional income, which helped his family's socioeconomic situation. 

Jawad requested his eighth loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to starting selling perfumes as an additional income. Perfumes are attractive to his current customers and selling them is a step forward towards developing his business career and diversifying his services. 

Jawad has worked as a barber for 14 years. He was only 12 years old when he had to quit school and start working to support his family. His father registered him in a vocational training center to develop his skills in a well managed way.  He hopes that in the future, he can move his shop outside the camp and widen his services, since he is suffering from a limited income inside the camp.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is twenty-seven years old and married with one child. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Charles runs a restaurant and also earns a salary from teaching as an additional source of income. He is very hardworking.

Charles has a dream of having an improved, modern type of home. He wants the loan facility to buy bricks and cement for home construction.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement for home construction.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es:
Isaac de 30 años de edad, está acompañado y  tiene 2 hijos, su pareja se dedica a los oficios de la casa y a administra una tienda que es de ambos. Isaac solo pudo estudiar hasta 4° grado de educación básica por falta de recursos económicos y como era el mayor de sus hermanos tenía que trabajar junto a su padre para llevar el alimento a la casa. Con él viven su esposa, sus hijos y sus padres.

Isaac es militar, trabaja en el ejército desde hace 6 años, tomo esta decisión porque no encontraba trabajo por lo que se sometió a las pruebas en el ejército y aprobó apoyado por un amigo que también trabajaba en ese lugar. Antes solo trabajaba como agricultor y como jornalero, todavía lo hace en sus tiempos libres, cultiva la tierra con granos básicos y hortalizas, también asiste a su pareja en la tienda.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar maíz, frijol, azúcar, arroz y demás para abastecer su tienda, pero también piensa comprar productos de higiene personal para tener otra mercadería que ofrecer, ya que en los últimos 2 años les ha ido muy bien.

Isaac espera algún día con fruto de su esfuerzo y apoyo financiero tener su propia casa para vivir mas cómodamente con su familia y dar el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Isaac is 30 years old, he is accompanied and has 2 children. His partner takes care of the household chores and manages their store. Isaac was only able to study up to the 4th grade of basic education due to lack of economic resources as well as the fact that he was the eldest brother and had to work alongside his father to bring food to the table. His parents also live with him along with his wife and children. 
Isaac is in the military, he has been working in the army for the past 6 years. He made this decision because he could not find work which is why he submitted himself to the army tests and passed with the help and support of a friend who also worked there. 
In the past, he worked only as a farmer and day laborer, which he still does in his free time, farming the land with basic grains and vegetables. He also helps his partner in the store.
The loan will be used to buy corn, beans, sugar, rice and other things to stock his store, but he also plans to purchase personal hygiene products in order to have other merchandise to offer since they have been doing quite well for the past 2 years. 
Isaac hopes to, one day, through the fruit of his labor and financial support, have his own home to live comfortably with his family and provide an education for his children.

loans.use: purchase corn, beans, sugar, rice, personal hygiene products and more

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.en:
This is Rafoat. She is a dairy farmer in Tajikistan. She feeds cattle at her home where she has a big cowshed. The cows produced milk that she sells to the locals. She also sells the cattle after some months of feeding in a local market. 

She has been busy with this business more than 15 years and has a great experience in this field. Her husband helps her with feeding the cattle. She works hard every day from early morning until late evening.

Rafoat has plans to grow her business to become a recognized dairy farmer in Tajikistan. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy cattle for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years old, married and has four children. 

Erlinda is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables and sugarcane in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a 24,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Erlinda has been farming vegetables and sugarcane for 25 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 51 years old and single. For the past ten years she has had a business selling traditional Philippine purses and bags.

Nida has applied for a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of purses and bags. She plans to use her profits to build the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of purses and bags to offer for sale.

loans.name: Tiang's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Thporng district of Kampong Spue province, Tiang is 36 years old and married. She has three children. To support the family, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 16,000 KHR per day to support the family’s needs.
 
Tiang has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles already and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family so they have sufficient food. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to build a decent latrine for her  family to use. She hopes to have a clean latrine to use.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family to use

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 27-year-old married woman living with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is an entertainer by profession; he provides entertainment services to children in his hometown. He has been doing this business for many years. He has various types of video games to provide fun for children.  With the passage of time, one of his favorite video games has become out of order. Children insist on playing that video game, but he is unable to provide it.

Rehana requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can replace that video game with new one. He hopes to successfully provide the video game to the children and entertain them again. Rehana thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy video games for his entertainment business

loans.name: Molly

texts.en:
Molly lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is a hardworking woman and runs a beauty salon. She has also started farming and sewing clothes to generate more income. 

She wishes to educate her children but inadequate capital hinders her business. 

Molly intends to use the loan to buy salon items like chemicals and braids.

loans.use: to buy salon items like chemicals and braids.

loans.name: Bibi Group

texts.en:
Bibi is a 59-year-old woman. She is the responsible mother of five daughters. Her husband has been running a crockery shop for the past 18 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and managing the household.

This is a group loan.

Bibi's husband wants to purchase different types of crockery, e.g. jugs, glasses, dinner sets etc. to fulfill the demands of customers, but due to financial constraints they are not in the position to buy this merchandise to resell.

To fulfill these business needs, Bibi has applied for a Kiva group loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these things to fulfill his business needs. This will also help him to increase his daily sales and earn a more profitable income to manage the business and the family's needs.

Bibi is  very happy and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to improve her husband's business

loans.name: Calixta Elizabeth

texts.es:
Calixta es una señora de 29 años, madre soltera que ha sacado adelante a sus tres hijos que viven con ella actualmente, habitan en casa arrendada en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, un sector muy cálido y caracterizado porque en esta zona habita la etia Tsachila.
Calixta es una madre ejemplar, ha trabajado mucho para sacar a sus pequeños adelante, realiza cualquier trabajo digno por llevar el alimento a su hogar; actualmente tiene un pequeño comedor, donde prepara desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas, está ubicado en una avenida principal, también en épocas vende ropa, ella ve la forma de salir adelante por eso trabaja muy duro; ya que Calixta se separó de su conyugue hace varios años por la irresponsabilidad.
Calixta acudió a la institución por referencias del sector, con el crédito que recibió podrá comprar  más mesas y sillas ya que está ampliando su local, además invertirá en un rotulo para el nombre de su negocio. Se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que la ha dado la institución para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Calixta is a 29 year old woman, a single mother supporting her three children that are still living with her. They live in a rented house in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a very warm region characterized by the Tsachila people who live in the area.

Calixta is an exemplary mother. She has worked a lot to support her little ones, doing any respectable job to put food on the table. Presently she has a small eatery where she prepares breakfasts, lunch and snacks. It is located on a main road. At times she also sells clothing. She sees a way to get ahead so she works very hard. Calixta separated from her husband several years ago due to his irresponsibility.

Calixta came to the institution on recommendations from the area. With the loan she receives she will be able to buy additional tables and chairs since she is expanding her establishment. She will also invest in a sign for the name of her business. She feels very grateful for the support that the institution has given her to grow as a small business owner.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her food stall to continue improving her business and support her three children.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
This is Grace - she is married, is fifty-seven years old and has two children. 

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her to improve her knowledge of business management skills.

She earns her living by operating a milk selling enterprise. She is borrowing money to buy more stock of milk which will boost her business. She hopes that by doing this her income will increase, so that she can continue to support her family with food and education.

Grace is very grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help and support

loans.use: To buy more stock of milk.

loans.name: Chhom 's Group

texts.en: Chhom ’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Chhom makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these man and women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Luis Enrrique

texts.es:
El socio Luis Enrrique se dedica al trabajo como profesor de una academia univesitario, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño del socio es tener un colegio. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner, Luis Enrrique, makes a living as a professor at a pre-university academy. He works from 8:00am until 2:00pm. He wants to get ahead through this job and his dream is to have a school one day. 
The partner requests the loan to purchase a television for his home. The partner is happy for the loan and committed to making all the repayments as specified.

loans.use: purchase a television for his home.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Coron, Palawan. She is 37 years old, has three children, and is married to Bobby. She manages a travel and tours agency, and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenses.

Rubelyn offers travel services like airline ticketing, local tour packages, hotel reservation, passport documentation, travel insurance, and more. Clients are attracted to pay for reservations because of the affordable airline ticketing and the minimum cost of seats she offer. Standard seats are sold at 100 Philippine pesos (PHP) each way. Premium seats, such as exit rows and the first two rows, are sold at PHP 200 each way. Rubelyn earns a minimum of PHP 10,000 in sales every week.

Rubelyn is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan to add to her current revolving cash fund, which she uses for her business. She will use her loan to improve her service as well as the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, she hopes to prosper through her business, for she desires to become a successful entrepreneur some day. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To add to the revolving cash fund needed in her travel agency business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 35 years old and married with two children; both of them are in school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane and vegetables in the Philippines. Francisca is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Francisca has been farming sugarcane and vegetables for 15 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 34 years old and married. She has three children, and all of her children are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock. Jocelyn has been raising livestock for six years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, thread, needles, etc. for her tailoring business.

Aniceta has been in this business for twenty one years, and she earns more income from fishing. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Aniceta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Female, small-scale farmers dominate the agricultural landscape in most production environments in Kenya, yet they constitute the majority of rural actors locked in socio-cultural structures that limit their agricultural productivity, efficiency, and effectiveness at all points across the value chain. Key examples are entrenched inequities in access to productive land, limited access to credit, poor access to markets, extension services, and agricultural technologies relevant to their needs. 

Kiva lenders, the above picture presents Doreen, who started farming seven years ago on a small inherited piece of land in Igoki, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of two children sells milk, eggs, vegetables, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart and, every day, she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking and feeding her cow. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and it protects them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions, such as rain. 

Doreen believes that, through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Doreen patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and build a dairy unit

loans.name: Olrongai Mwangaza S. H G Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Margaret, a member of Olrongai Mwangaza S. H G group. She is 62 years old, married and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIHEA) in 2013.

Margaret Operates a retail kiosk, where she sells goods like flour, sugar, cooking fat and other household items. She has gone through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training (HIHEA) which has enabled her to acquire skills on enterprise and financial management.

She is taking a Kiva loan to expand her business by adding more stock of flour, sugar, and cooking fat. She is happy about HIHEA because the training has helped her gain business knowledge. The loan will boost her business and thus increase her income level, and will assist her husband in taking care of her family's needs.

Margaret is grateful to Kiva and its lenders, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to add more stock of sugar, flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Rakem

texts.en:
This is the story of Apri, son of Rakem :

My family's economy is sufficient for daily needs. My father works in the army and my mother works as a trader. I have 3 sisters; two sisters are in the last 2 SMP class. My father was sick for 3 months and he borrowing money is very helpful to me. In the picture, Apri and his mother Rakem

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Mrs. Thao is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house. Her family’s income is mainly from farming, husbandry and hired labour. With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Nhi

texts.en: Mrs. Nhi is 42 years old. There are seven people in her family. Cultivation and husbandry are her main income. She can cover family’s daily cost and education from pig raising income. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family’s member, especially the kids.  She has daily income from garden such as vegetable, chicken and pig.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 40-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of a son. Farzana has been running her own beauty saloon for the past three years, she also contributes her income so together with her husband they manage the household.
 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty saloon but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore Farzana has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers, it will also helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Farzana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of beautician accessories for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Yang's Group

texts.en: Yang’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Yang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory worker to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita lives in Maliana. She is married, and her husband works in the coffee business.She is applying for a loan of $1,000. She has a kiosk, so she is taking this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, including noodles, detergent, water, cigarettes and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks.  

She started her business in 2006 with working capital of $200. She hopes to open a big store in the future, so she takes this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her management of her business. She also has animals in her place, like cows, goats, pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy noodles, detergent, aqua, cigarettes and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 43 years old and married with two children who are currently in school. Emma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like snack foods, chocolate drinks, coffee, toothpaste, bath soap, fabric conditioners, etc. to sell.

Emma has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, chocolate drinks, coffee, toothpaste, bath soap, fabric conditioners, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like snack foods, chocolate drinks, coffee, toothpaste, bath soap, and fabric conditioners to sell

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
Fidelina de 53 años de edad, ella no obtuvo ningun tipo de escolaridad por motivos economicos que pasaba su familia y es por eso que no pudo seguir con sus estudios. Es madre de 2 hijas, su esposo falleció hace un año, sus hijas trabajan para cubrir con los gastos en su hogar, una de ellas trabaja de cajera en una gasolinera y la otra de atención al cliente en una comercial.

 Fidelina solamente se dedica a los oficios domésticos lava y plancha ajeno para poder ayudar a sus hijas con los gastos en su hogar. Fidelina es una mujer esforzada y trabajadora.

El crédito que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar alambre de pua y grapas para hacer un alambrado alrededor de su casa, ya que el terreno esta desprotegido. El sueño de Fidelina es que a futuro poder instalar una tienda en su hogar para no seguir lavando y planchando ajeno, ya que la tienda seria rentable esta cerca del centro escolar y de la cancha del cantón, es un punto muy accesible para una tienda.
texts.en:
Fidelina is 53 years old and did not receive much schooling as her family was struggling economically, consequently, she was unable to continue with her studies. She has 2 daughters and her husband passed away a year ago.
