Her daughters work to cover the family expenses: one of them is a cashier in a gas station and the other is a customer services assistant in a shop.
Fidelina's only work is carrying out domestic tasks for other people by washing and ironing clothing in order to help her daughters with the home expenses. Fidelina is a conscientious woman who applies great effort to whatever she does.
This CREDICAMPO loan will be used to buy barbed wire and staples so that she can build a wire fence around her house as the land is currently unprotected. Fidelina's dream is to open a shop in her home in the future so that she does not have to continue washing and ironing other people's clothes. A shop would be a lucrative business as her house is close to a school and the sports ground, making it a very accessible location.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire and staples to put up a wire fence around her house.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Teresa. She is a 40-year-old small-scale farmer based in Sugoi Village in the North Rift area of Kenya. She runs a quarter acre of farmland with the help of her two sons. On the plot, she grows maize and keeps dairy animals. 

Teresa is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. She wants to start a poultry farm in a small way and grow it over time. The new venture will help her make enough income to buy enough food for her family. Having poultry will also help her diversify her business, mitigating business risks. The poultry birds will also bring her other advantages such as special meals with chicken meat during holidays; soil aeration when the birds scratch the earth looking for bugs; manure from the solid waste; and being able utilize off-colour grains from the maize harvest to feed the chickens.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 43-year-old farmer based in Sugoi Village in the Eldoret region of Kenya. She started farming in the year 2012 on a two-acre piece of land that she owns in the area. With the help of her children, Jane grows maize and vegetables and raises dairy animals and poultry. 

Jane is seeking a poultry loan to grow the number of chickens she keeps on her farm. This investment is likely to pay off within a very short time because eggs are collected regularly and fed to the ever-growing demand in the market. 

Income from the investment will help her look after her family's needs, pay for her three children's education, and take care of her two-year-old daughter Hope's medical expenses.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong is 40 years old, married and has four children, two of them are schooling. She works very hard to feed & education her children. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children but has a lack of capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from fishing and selling chicken in her garden.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: I's Group

texts.en: I’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. I makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs, and she also does extra work as a construction worker to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of them to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

loans.name: Sokchea's Grouo Group

texts.en: Sokchea’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sokchea makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

loans.name: Ratha's Group

texts.en: Ratha’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Ratha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a construction worker to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

loans.name: Thien

texts.en: Mrs. Thien is 48  years old .There are four people in her family. Fishing and husbandry are her main income. She can cover family’s daily cost and education from pig raising income. She also has daily income from garden such as vegetable, chicken and pig. She is interested to improve the living standard for her family so she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Mrs. Hien is a hardworking woman, 36 years old. There are six people in her family. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from small business and fishing. With more than 10 years experience and has support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Mrs. Hue is 52 years old. She is married and has three children, so she works very hard to provide for them. Husbandry and fishing are the main income of her family. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family living standard as well as for environment protection.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Di

texts.en: Mrs. Di is a hard working woman, 59 years old. She lives alone but she would like to improve her living standard. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from selling chicken, duck, pig and vegetables.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Tserendulam

texts.en:
Tserendulam has used her previous loans effectively and improved her living conditions. She is a widow and currently lives with her two children as her eldest son studies at university in Russia on scholarship. Her other two children go to high school. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy an electronic sewing machine in order to further increase her output.

loans.use: to buy an electronic sewing machine in order to increase her output.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita is a retired employee. She is married and has three adult children. She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Jovita is receiving a monthly pension, which supports her family's needs and greatly helped her in pursuing her goals. She hopes to live comfortably in a house with a good roof, walls, and flooring. Recently, Jovita requested a loan of 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase materials to complete her house. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. She is very thankful that all of her financing needs were supported by PMPC. She deeply wishes to live a happy and comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to complete her house

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Her name is Alicia, a widow, 57, resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She has four children who are already working. She works hard to meet their daily household needs and and to save for their old age.

Alicia is in a food business; she operates a food cart. A food cart is a mobile kitchen that is set up on the street to facilitate the sale and marketing of street food to people from the local pedestrian traffic. She cooks and sells "siopao" (steamed buns) which is a famous Filipino-Chinese snack. It is a pork bun recipe that can be eaten straight from the steamer. She sells also "siomai," a traditional Chinese dumpling. This popular dumpling has made its way to the heart of the Filipinos, as evidenced by the hundreds of stalls, eateries, and restaurants who serve them. In the Philippines it is often ground pork, beef, shrimp, among others, combined with extenders like turnips, carrots and other vegetables which are then wrapped in wanton wrappers or molo wrappers. It is either steamed or fried resulting in a crispy exterior. It can be eaten solo as a snack, or served with rice to make a full meal, so you can sell it anytime of the day. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) net income a day.

To help her maintain her business, Alicia is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to buy additional raw ingredients like pork, beef, chicken and seasonings, vegetables and other ingredients that are needed for her cooking. From her food cart earnings she was able to open a small general store. Part of the loan will be used to buy grocery items such as biscuits, rice, beverages and toiletries for her newly opened small store. She believes that with this financial assistance her sales and earnings will increase. She is thanking God in advance for your great help.

Alicia dreams to establish and expand her business so they could have a comfortable life on their old age. She also wants to live healthy and happy to see her grandchildren grow up. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery for ingredients for her food cart and also to pay for items, toiletries and beverages to sell at her newly opened general store.

loans.name: Mirna Esmeralda

texts.es: Mirna de 41 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos quienes trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mirna, 41 years old, is a single mother. She lives in her own house with two children who work and help her economically. For several years, she has made a living making and selling tortillas. Her business is located at her place of residence and she has many customers. She is requesting a loan to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder in order to continue making tortillas. This way, she can have a higher income and better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 34 years old and married with two children.

Anabelle works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Anabelle has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Anabelle aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24,000  through NWTF to buy ingredients for food production for her food vending business.

Angelina has been in this business for six years.

Angelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lucilyn

texts.en:
Lucilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000  through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell for her buy and sell used clothing business.

Lucilyn has been in this business for 10 years.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear

loans.name: Khanum

texts.en:
Khanum lives in Noravan village with her 14-year-old daughter. She is a math teacher with 9 years of experience working at local village school. In addition to her job, Khanum provides individual training to students, preparing them for entrance exams. Due to her professional work, Khanum is well known among locals in her village. 

To be able to make her classes more effective and less time consuming, Khanum has applied for this loan to purchase a notebook computer. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase a notebook computer  for providing classes to students

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo works hard to support his parents. Leo is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

He requested a PHP15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Leo has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Leo would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Al-Rayan Group

texts.en: This group consists of four women from Hodeidah city, Yemen. They applied for a second loan of 140,000 Yemeni rials (YER) from Kiva lenders. Ramdhana is the leader of the group. She applied for a first loan from Kiva lenders to buy sugar, flour, and canned foods to increase her working capital. She makes some kinds of sandwiches and potatoes and sells in the street for the people. The first loan which was given by Kiva lenders helped her very much to increase her business. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders for that first loan. In reality though, she hasn't completed the first loan and has applied for a concurrent loan of YER 40,000 from Kiva lenders to purchase more sugar, potatoes, tangs, canned food, etc., to improve her business more. All the members of the group hope to be financed with this loan too.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, canned food, etc., for her sandwich business.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 29-year-old married woman and mother of two children. Her husband(also shown in the photo), some time ago, started a van driving business. Her husband owns a van and needs some financial help. He will use the amount to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the van. 

Therefore, Rukhsana has requested a loan amount of 50,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the van.

loans.name: Chien

texts.en: Mrs. Chien is a hardworking woman, 48 years old. She is married and has two children. She has operated a fish selling business for 20 years. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living condition and health for her family, especially her children. Her income is mainly from business and fishing and she is able to repay the loan.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Dan

texts.en: Mrs. Dan is a hardworking woman, 40 years old. She is married and has two children. Her family’s income is mainly from small business and cultivation. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Lorn's Group

texts.en: Lorn’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Lorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a construction worker, factory laborer, and motor driver to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

loans.name: Gjeline

texts.en:
Gjelina is a villager in her 60s and a widowed mother of three children. She is seeking your financial help to make basic repairs to their family home including the stairs. Her house is in very poor condition as you can see it in the background of the photograph. The source of income for Gjelina is now her pension; she worked as a nurse. She also owns 11 dynym of agricultural land that she has rented out to other villagers. (A dynym is 1,000 square meters.)  Her daughter, who lives with her, is working as a nurse and the other two daughters are studying in public universities where they were granted scholarships.
 
Gjelina’s husband passed away in 2009 when a vehicle hit him.  “It was extremely difficult at the time, because my daughters were still teenagers, but God gave me and them the strength to continue on with our lives and goals; so far we have accomplished some of our goals,” said Gjelina smiling.

loans.use: to make repairs to her family home, which is in bad shape

loans.name: Drita

texts.en:
Drita is a 44-year-old Egyptian Albanian and was photographed with her adorable cat. She is the mother of an 11-year-old child.  She sells new underwear and used outfits in the villages around her town, just off Korca city, and is requesting this loan to stock up on inventory items.
 
A bit about Drita’s town: it has approximately 6,000 inhabitants. It was a marsh before the late 60s when, with volunteer work, it became a little town with a few buildings and agricultural land where sugar beets have since been planted. A factory of sugar was built also, where alcoholic drinks were made in addition to the sugar. Since the region was producing large quantities of potatoes, a factory for cornstarch was built a few years later and functioned until the first years after the collapse of the previous regime. Unfortunately, no sugar beets are planted and no sugar plant is functioning,except the cornstarch plant.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items to resell such as used outfits and new underwear

loans.name: Linh

texts.en: Mrs. Linh  is a hardworking woman, 26 years old. She is married and has two children. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from small business. With more than 20 years experience and has support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Hoai

texts.en: Mrs. Hoai is a hard working woman, 34 years old. She is married and has three children, who are still on school’s sit. She would like to improve her living standard, especially her children but lack of capital. The loan can help her to build a hygienic latrine and she is able to repay the loan from small business, selling vegetable and chicken in her garden.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Doan

texts.en: Mrs. Doan  is a hardworking woman, 32 years old. She is married and has a baby. She needs loan to build a sanitation latrine to improve health of her family’s member and also for environment protection. Her family’s income is mainly from business so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin has been operating her retail store for over four years and has been able to sustain her business. She supports her family and has bought some home improvements for more comfortable living.

Jasmin has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used for the business. She is now aiming to increase sales and, for this reason, she has taken out a new loan to purchase grains and livestock feeding supplies to sell in addition to her current inventory. In this way, Jasmin is hoping to cater for the needs of her customers and also increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase grains and livestock feeding supplies to sell in addition to her current inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy natural organic vitamins and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, 47, runs a sari-sari, a type of small general store. She has four children who both attend school and work to help support the family.

Susan received a previous loan of 20,000 PHP that she used to buy more school supplies and other grocery stuff to stock her store. Recently she also started selling meals to customers, as she is a good cook.

Susan is now applying for a 30,000 PHP loan through CCT to buy additional school supplies and grocery stock such as rice, coffee, soda, and noodles, plus the ingredients she uses to produce the meals she sells. She feels certain of a good return on her investments and dreams of having a large grocery store and café someday.

Susan aims to give her children the best education she can to ensure a better future for them. She thanks God and you for the help she receives.

All CCT community clients like Susan are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store plus the ingredients she uses to produce the meals she sells.

loans.name: Raghda

texts.en:
Raghda is a 45-year-old, single, lady. She is self dependent, and has been running her own business for seven years selling clothes. She also started selling blankets recently for the upcoming winter season. 

Now she needs to expand her business so that she will gain better profits. She wants to open her own store in the future. 

Raghda currently needs to buy more blankets and winter clothes. But because she doesn’t have enough money to buy them, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of winter clothes and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma works hard to support her family. Erma is married and she has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish nets.

Erma has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Erma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish nets.

loans.name: Divine Group

texts.fr:
Mr DAOUDA représente le groupe DIVINE.  Il  se porte bien. Il est célibataire sans enfant. Il n'a  personne en charge. 
Mr  est gérant d’un kiosque depuis 05ans. Il s’approvisionne dans son secteur. 
Il veut s’acheter  02sacs de riz, 01 bidon d’huile.
Avec ses bénéfices,  il veut renforcer d’avantage  son activité. Il  ambitionne un grand restaurant et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Daouda represents the group Divine. He is doing well. He is a bachelor without any children, and doesn't have any dependents.

Daouda has run a kiosk for 5 years. He gets his supplies in his area. He would like to purchase 2 bags of rice and 1 barrel of oil. 

With his earnings, Daouda wants to further grow his business. He hopes to have a large restaurant and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bags of rice and 1 barrel of oil

loans.name: Racel

texts.en:
Racel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

Racel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish.

Racel has been in this business for one year now, and also earns additional income from fishing.

In the future, Racel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Wendranigyande Group

texts.fr:
FATIMATA  est responsable du groupe WENDRANIGYANDE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 04 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend des plats plastiques, du savon, des tubes de pommades et des poudres depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Mme veut s’acheter 02douzaines de plats , 02douzaines de seaux et 02 douzaines de gobelet.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique et mieux entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatimata is the representative of the Wendranigyande group. She is doing well. Fatimata is married and the mother of 4 children between the ages of 15 and 6, all 4 of whom attend school.

Fatimata has been selling plastic containers, soap, tubes of ointments and powders for 11 years. She gets her supplies at the market in her region.

Fatimata would like to purchase 2 dozen containers, 2 dozen buckets and 2 dozen cups. She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. Her dream is to open a large store and to better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 dozen containers, 2 dozen buckets, and 2 dozen cups

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 29-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children. Sumaira has been running her own beauty salon for the past four years, and she also contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household. 

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics (i.e. creams), a hair brush, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not capable of buying these items for her business purposes. Therefore, Sumaira has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purposes so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Sumaira is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of cosmetics and other accessories for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Bobgu N Nye Yem - Nyoligu Group

texts.en:
Memunatu is a 40-year-old hardworking woman from Nyoligu in the Northern region of Ghana. Memunatu is married and has four children, three of whom attend school. Memunatu is the individual pictured second on the right among members squatting.

Memunatu is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last two years. The name of the group is Bobgu N Nye Yem - Nyoligu. Memunatu earns a good profit from the business, as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local and non-local markets.

Memunatu and Bobgu N Nye Yem - Nyoligu have asked for a loan of GHS 7,700. Memunatu’s share of the loan is GHS 300, which would help her to buy shea nuts to process shea butter. She aspires to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her children with food and educational materials.

Memunatu thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts to process shea butter.

loans.name: Panthoibi Jlg Group

texts.en: “Life is like weaving change, each wraparound I have woven and sold has given me the opportunity to do more in life for more reasons,” said Geeta as she narrates her story. She is an active woman who believes in the financial freedom of all women. “Every single cloth I have woven is not merely a product but is precious and meaningful to me because that is where my strength lies,” she said. She has three school-going children. Her husband is engaged in school van services for income generation. She took a loan from WSDS in the previous years to buy raw materials for weaving. The income she derived from weaving was used for providing household expenses and other fees. She holds a good record of repaying the loan amount on time. She makes wraparounds costing from 250 INR to 500 INR at home and sells them through her elder sister who is a school teacher. The wraparounds are very popular among the lady teachers in school and they used to place orders for different designs of their own liking. This made her business popular and successful. Now she aspires to buy a handloom to weave more products to sell. With the Kiva loan, she will buy a handloom so that she can weave more beautiful wraparound to attract more customers. She says “thank you Kiva.” The other group members also will promote their business through the Kiva loan. They are active women engaged in different businesses including weaving, rice selling, a fish business, embroidery and a petty shop to generate income and strive for financial freedom.

loans.use: To buy colourful and different textures of yarn to use in weaving beautiful wraparound skirts to sell.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 24 year old Palestinian refugee who lives in the Chouf region since she left Syria at the start of the civil unrest in early 2011 to come live in Lebanon.
Living as a refugee in an unstable socio-economic situation pushed Abir to start her own business in selling accessories and cosmetic products  at day. She also works as a tutor at the Anout tuition lessons center at night.
She is currently engaged and still lives with her parents who also flew Syria at the beginning of the war. Her dad is a taxi driver, her sister works in a small shoe and accessories store, and her brother works at a hotel. 
Abir is asking for a 1,850,990 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She is planning to use the loan for the purpose of growing her merchandise and expanding her product line to also include purses. This way, her sales and monthly income will increase which will help her start planning her future in better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her stocks and expand her product line

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a 27 year old Palestinian refugee who was born and raised in a Palestinian refugee camp located in South Lebanon.
He is single and living with his parents and younger brother.  His mother is unemployed and his brother is still at school.
After completing his school studies, Ahmed decided to start working on his own to help his father cover the family expenses. He entered the furniture making business when he was 18 years old as an apprentice then quickly started his own business in furniture painting at 20 years old. Inside the camp, Ahmed has his own clients who are loyal to his high quality of work as they see him as a hard working and reliable young man. 
Ahmed is asking for a 3,083,000 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. Aiming at expanding his business inside the camp and increase his income, he needs the loan to buy new furniture painting tools to replace and upgrade his used toolkit.

loans.use: to buy furniture painting tools

loans.name: Nasommor Group

texts.en:
Phaeng is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water-borne diseases. 

Phaeng's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in her village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. Even though some people in the village, including Phaeng, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. 

Phaeng and other filter-users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Phaeng's filter is guaranteed for two years, though most users find the filter works for three-five years. 

Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work also improves a family’s income and overall well-being.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Fathieh

texts.en:
Fathiyeh is a 42 year old Palestinian refugee who lives with her husband and three children in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. She has two married daughters and one son who still lives in the family home. her husband works in a social organization inside the camp and her son who is 17 years old works as a hairdresser. 
Fathiyeh decided to establish her own business a year ago in order to support her husband in covering the family expenses since he has been suffering from several health problems which limited his income to the monthly salary received from the organization.
Her business consists in baking local bagels and selling coal and gas tanks to her loyal customers who see her as a hard working woman constantly looking to improve the family's livelihoods. 
Fathiyeh is asking for a 1,029,765 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa in order to buy coal and gas tanks and sell them in her small shop. Such an increase in her supplies will allow her to develop her business and see her sales and revenue grow.

loans.use: to buy coal and gas tanks and sell them back

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 40 year old Palestinian refugee who grew up in a Palestinian refugee camp located in South Lebanon. He has been married to his wife for twenty years and together they have three children who are in their last years of school. 
While his wife is unemployed, Ali's income in the family's only source of income. 
Ali started working as a tiler eighteen years ago and his business has been expanding despite the unstable situation inside the camp. His clients see him as an honest hardworking man dedicated to growing his business and continue providing his family with decent living conditions. 
Ali is asking for a 2,057,996 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva field partner Ibdaa. He is planning on using the loan to buy a new generator and some construction tools he needs which will improve his productivity and allow him to provide his clients with an improved quality of work.

loans.use: to buy a generator and construction tools

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has a motorcycle transport business and has been in the business for one year. He is 35 years old and married. He will use this loan to buy spare parts to service his motorcycle.

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and improve his family's living standards. 

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. In the future, he hopes to have a prosperous and sustainable business and live a better life.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.en:
A loan of Rp 10,000,000 helps Albertina to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to her community. These new of technologies will expand the range at her small shop that sells everyday goods from snack and drinks to phone credit. 

Albertina’s parents are teachers. As a child she dreamed to be more successful than her parents and studied tourism.  Her first job was doing administration for a bus tour agent. She works in a training organisation and is married with three children.

To increase her income, Albertina has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies. She will use the loan to buy stock and grow her income to pay for her children’s education and save for her retirement.  She is excited about Kopernik’s training program to learn about these new technologies, promote them to customers and improve her general business skills.

loans.use: This borrower will use this loan to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to her community

loans.name: Valentinus

texts.en:
A loan of Rp 10,000,000 helps Valentinus to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community.

Valentinus’ parents are teachers. As a child he dreamed to be a farmer and his first job was breeding livestock.

To increase his income, Valentinus has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies. He will use the loan to buy stock and grow his income.  He is excited about Kopernik’s training program to learn about these new technologies, promote them to customers and improve his general business skills. 

Besides selling technology, Kopernik have appointed Valentinus to coordinate the restocking of other technology salespeople in his area. This will improve his skills in stock management and financial reporting.

loans.use: This borrower will use this loan to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
A loan of Rp 10,000,000 helps Paulina to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to her community.

Paulina is married with three children. She wanted to be a doctor when growing up but studied communications and works as a government employee. She often travels to remote villages a few hours from town. She plans to promote solar lamps and biomass stoves to reduce the community’s reliance on kerosene and improve their health through the reduction of dirty smoke. 

Paulina will use the loan to buy stock to grow her income. She is excited about Kopernik’s training program to learn about these new technologies, promote them to customers and improve her general business skills.

loans.use: This borrower will use this loan to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to her community

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
A loan of Rp 10,000,000 helps Lusia to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to her community.  

Lusia’s parents are farmers. As a child she dreamed to be a teacher but got married young so only completed high school.  She has two children and her husband works in construction. Her first job was working in a private business at 22 years old.

To increase her income, Lusia has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies. She will use the loan to buy stock and grow her income to pay for her children’s education.  She is excited about Kopernik’s training program to learn about these new technologies, promote them to customers and improve her general business skills.

loans.use: This borrower will use this loan to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to her community

loans.name: Heribertus

texts.en:
A loan of Rp 10,000,000 helps Heri to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community.

Heri is married with one child. He studied a bachelor degree and his first job was as a research assistant. He also works together with local coffee farmers to create better quality coffee beans.

To increase his income, Heri has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies. He will use the loan to buy stock to grow his income to fulfill his plan to build a house. He is excited about Kopernik’s training program to learn about these new technologies, promote them to customers and improve his general business skills.

loans.use: This borrower will use this loan to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community

loans.name: Vinsensia

texts.en:
A loan of Rp 10,000,000 helps Vinsensia to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to her community. These new of technologies will expand the range at her small shop that sells everyday goods from snack and drinks to phone credit. 

Vinsensia’s parents were government employees. As a child she wanted to become a nun, but was unwell and only completed high school. She completed a sewing course and her first job at age 15 was making handcrafts. She is single, but works to cover the financial costs for her niece and nephew. Besides running a kiosk and selling technology, she also does cross-stitching and sells it based on order. 

To increase her income, Vinsensia has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies. She will use the loan to buy stock to grow her income. She will use the profits to improve the product range in her small shop.  She is excited about Kopernik’s training program to learn about these new technologies, promote them to customers and improve her general business skills.

loans.use: This borrower will use this loan to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to her community

loans.name: Peng's Group

texts.en:
Peng’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Peng makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a construction worker to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Nurlan

texts.en:
Nurlan is 26 years old, married, and this year his child was born. He is living with his family in the Absheron region. This is Nurlan's second loan. Once he turned to Kiva to repair his car, and then he changed cars. He also is a driver, he provides transportation for order. 

A while ago the tire of his lorry was broken, and to repair it he needs 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He expressed great thanks to the Kiva organization for helping him to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy new tire

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 24 years old and single with no children. She has a pharmacy business which she has been running for two years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of medicine for her business to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to help and support her siblings.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. In the future, Gladys hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of medicine to sell.

loans.name: Ataogul

texts.en:
Ataogul is 22 years old. He is single. He lives with his family in the Baku region. His mother is ill and he can't learn at the university. He must go to work.  

Today, he started a business. Ataogul rents a cafe, "TeaHouse," and, in this cafe, he serves customers. 

Ataogul wants to buy new tableware for the cafe. Therefore, he needs a loan of AZN 1,300 (Azerbaijan New Manat) and he has applied to Komak Credit Union. He gives thanks for the loan to the Kiva organization and its lenders.

loans.use: to by new tableware for his cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, flour and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is taking a loan for the second time. Due to the first loan, she paid annual tuition of her son at the Polytechnic University. You can read her credit story at this link: http://www.kiva.org/lend/623890. She is very grateful to Kiva Lenders for their financial support. Munira's son continues studying and is doing well. 

Munira fully repaid her first loan and now has applied for a new loan. Currently, she needs $1,000 for her son's tuition. She hopes that Kiva lenders will support her this time, too.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her son

loans.name: Gul  Zeba

texts.en:
Gul Zeba is 56 years old and a married woman. She is the mother of seven children. One of her sons (also shown in the photo with her) is running a small general store to make enough to support his family circle. 

He is making a great effort to support his family. However, he faces a financial problem in the growth of his business. For this reason, Gul Zeba has accessed a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to buy more packs of biscuits, grains, and cleaning products to meet the demand of customers, time after time. She is positive about her son’s future earnings and will spend part of income on improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more packs of biscuits, grains, and cleaning products to meet the demand of customers, time after time.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: To be young and starting a new family with a fragment of land is a challenge for people in the Litein area of Kenya. Rose, 30, has overcome this challenge and has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary source of income has been selling eggs, milk, vegetables and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. Rose, who is an ever-smiling farmer, has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans that farming is for the older generation. She passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early riser and she wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cow. Although this humble farmer has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit and buy a chaff cutter. Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking and feeding her cow. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and it protects them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Through the loan, she will also be able to buy a chaff cutter which is a mechanical device used to cut hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forage for better feeding of the cow. The chaff cutter also prevents the animals from rejecting any part of the food. Rose believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Lenders if you want to invest in someone with great vision, Rose is the one.

loans.use: To build a dairy unit and buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La casa de Martha, se ve cada día más completa y con mejores condiciones, todo gracias a las ganancias que ha ido obteniendo en su negocio. Esta madre, esposa y comerciante, quiere agradecer a todos los que le extendieron su mano en el préstamo anterior, donde pudo comprar sillas, mesas y maíz para tener mayores ingresos con su molino y su alquiler de los asientos plásticos. Con 31 años de experiencia en ese mundo, siente que su negocio le ha ido ayudando a mejorar su condición y ambiente familiar.
Ahora, tras ver el gran avance que tuvo con el primer préstamo, va a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar mesas plásticas para alquilar. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y sabe que juntos podrán seguir brindándoles la mejor vivienda a su hija y a ellos mismos. Su sueño es ver completamente mejorada su vivienda, por lo que sabe que debe trabajar fuerte para seguir haciéndolo. Ayuda a Martha a cumplir con una de sus principales metas.
texts.en:
Martha's house is becoming more complete and in better condition every day, all thanks to the profits that she has been making from her business. 
This mother, wife and saleswoman would like to thank everyone who helped on her previous loan, which she used to buy chairs, tables and corn to make more income with her mill and the hire of plastic seats. With 31 years of experience in that world, she feels that her business has been helping to improve her family and home environment. 
Now, after seeing the great progress she had with the first loan, she is applying for a new loan to buy plastic tables to rent out. She has the support of her husband and knows that together they can continue providing the best housing for their daughter and themselves. Her dream is to see her home fully upgraded, so she knows she must work hard to keep up. Help Martha to fulfill one of her main goals.

loans.use: to buy plastic tables.

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en: Zeenat, a 37-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing and then selling it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, Zeenat has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in various colors.

loans.name: Mehraj

texts.en:
Mehraj is 56-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of milk selling for many years, with the help of her husband. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has six children; she is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

Now, she has requested for a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase one more cow for milking. She is hopeful that she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow for milking.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: A local farmer from Siem Reap province, Sokha is a mother of five children. Her main source of income is from rice farming and cassava farming. This business earns her about 35,000 KHR. This is the second loan for Sokha with VisionFund (Kiva's partner.) She has repaid back her past loan completely. For this cycle, she is seeking for a new loan in order to buy fertilizer, to pay for plowing fees, and to pay for labor fees for her cassava. In the future, she hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, to pay for plowing fees, and to pay for labor fees.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Twin Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Mercy, a member of Twin Women Group. She is 26 years old, married and a mother of four children, all attending school. She is a maize and beans farmer. Part of the produce is used for family consumption and the rest is for commercial purpose.

Mercy is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for the enterprise management training she received, which equipped her with skills to manage her business. She is borrowing from Kiva to purchase farm inputs like seeds, fertilizer and storage sacks. She hopes the Kiva loan will help her boost her business, hence increasing her income.This will enable her improve the living standards of her family which includes quality education. 

Mercy is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase planting seeds, fertilizer and storage sacks.

loans.name: Olrongai Mwangaza S. H G Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Margaret, a member of Olrongai Mwangaza S. H G Group. She is 51 years old, married and blessed with seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIHEA) in 2013.

Margret operates a food kiosk where she sells beverages and meals such as tea, rice and beans stew. Having gone through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s  training on enterprise development and financial management, she is now able to manage her business well. She is borrowing a loan to expand her business by adding more stock of rice, sugar and beans. This will enable her meet customers' rising demand and hence make more income, thus supporting her children's education and her family's basic needs.

She is happy with Kiva and its lenders for the support, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, and beans.

loans.name: Elba Santiaga

texts.es:
El kiosko escolar de Elba cada día va creciendo en popa. Poco a poco ha ido creciendo con fuerza y todo es gracias al su gran trabajo. Esta comerciante de 57 años de edad se siente muy agradecida con quienes la apoyaron económicamente en el préstamo anterior, donde compró gaseosas, galletas, jugos, frutas, entre otros productos que tanto piden los estudiantes durante el recreo. 
Ella recuerda cuando inició vendiendo en la entrada del colegio, hasta que los directores del centro  le dieron el espacio para que pudiera vender adentro. Ahora ya tiene 11 años de haber iniciado con este negocio y quiere seguir creciendo, por lo que solicita un crédito para comprar lápices, bebidas, pegas, borradores, galletas, tijeras, entre otros productos. Esto le permitirá cumplir con las exigencias de sus clientes y poder ahorrar para establecer la pulpería que tanto sueña en su casa.
texts.en:
Elba's school kiosk is growing every day. Slowly it has grown strong and it's all thanks to her hard work. This merchant, 57, is very grateful to those who have supported her financially in the previous loan, which she used to buy soft drinks, cookies, juices, fruits, and other products that students ask for during recess. 
She remembers when she began selling at the school entrance until the school directors gave her a proper space that she could sell in. 
Now we are 11 years into this business and she wants it to keep growing, so she is requesting a loan to buy pencils, drinks, glue, erasers, cookies, scissors, and other products. This will allow her to meet the customer demand and allow her to save to build the grocery store she dreams of at home.

loans.use: to buy pencils, drinks, glue, erasers, cookies, scissors, and other products.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Se acercan las navidades y el año nuevo y en este último trimestre las fiestas no se detienen, de esta manera estudiantes, profesionales, amas de casa, niños, hombres y jóvenes, quieren vestir con  elegante ropa nueva y esto los hace felices. Por eso desde el año 2000, Viviana aprovecha  cada temporada para aumentar sus ventas y generar mas ingresos, que llenan de bienestar a su familia, conformada por su esposo y sus hijos en las edades de 6 y 8 años. Desde muy niña le gustó la actividad comercial y hoy está atenta a responder a su clientela con lo que esta necesita y desee para satisfacerla; Viviana comprará vestuario en todas las líneas para hacer  de su Diciembre una época maravillosa, logrando el aumento de sus ventas, porque con el tiempo comprará su vivienda y tendrá su propio local comercial que ya le hace mucha falta, tal y como ella lo sueña. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa para damas, caballeros e infantil, así logrará aprovechar la temporada haciendo feliz a su clientela y a su familia y esto es justamente el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Christmastime and the New Year are approaching, and in these final three months the parties do not stop. Students, professionals, homemakers, children, men, and teenagers want to wear elegant new clothes that make them happy. This is why since the year 2000, Viviana has made the most of each season in order to increase her sales and generate more revenue. This provides her family with comfort, which includes her husband and children, six and eight years old. From a very young age, she liked commercial activities, and today is attentive to respond to her customers with what they need and wishes to satisfy them.

Viviana will buy apparel of all styles in order to make their December a wonderful time, increasing sales. Over time, she will buy her house and have her own local business property that she needs and dreams of. This is the reason why she is turning to a Kiva loan, the first financing that the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation is doing.  With this loan, she will purchase clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children. In this way, she will make the most of the season, making her customers and her family happy--precisely the sign of success of her investment.

loans.use: to buy a greater volume of clothing

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer emprendedora de 24 años de edad, madre de dos hijos de 5 y 2 años, es soltera y vive con sus hijos.

Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en diferentes talleres de confecciones como operaria de máquina, razón por la cual posee experiencia y conocimientos en el manejo de este tipo de negocios; pero, ya está cansada de trabajar en otros talleres y con el ánimo de pasar más tiempo con sus hijos, decidió emprender su propio taller de confección, por ello se anima a solicitar el crédito que será invertido en la compra de una maquina fileteadora, recubridora e insumos de confección como tela e hilos. 

Esto le permitirá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar un buen impacto en el sector para que le genere una rentabilidad favorable y así lograr cumplir el sueño de posicionarse en el mercado y, con su empuje y coraje se proyecta en un futuro a mediano plazo generando empleo.
texts.en:
Ana, 24, is an enterprising woman and the mother of two children, ages 5 and 2.  She's single and lives with her children.

During her working life she has worked as a machine operator in a variety of tailoring shops, so she has experience and knowledge in running this type of business.  She's tired of working in other shops, though, and she wants to spend more time with her children, so she decided to start her own tailoring business.

She's requesting a loan to buy an overlock machine, a hemming machine, and sewing supplies such as fabric and thread.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine, a hemming machine, and sewing supplies such as fabric and thread

loans.name: Alvaro Javier

texts.es:
Álvaro es un hombre trabajador, que desde hace 12 años estableció su pulpería, como negocio propio. Él es un sobreviviente a sus 51 años, pues antes de tener su negocio, era cambista de dólares y córdobas, hasta que un día sufrió un robo donde casi pierde la vida y decidió no seguir arriesgándose por su bien y por el de su familia. Él es padre de tres hijos, quienes lo han apoyado, junto con su esposa, quien le manda remesas como soporte económico. 
Álvaro siempre está buscando como superarse, por lo que no deja de trabajar ni un solo día para ser una persona autosuficiente. Por esta razón, solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería, arroz, frijoles, papel higiénico, pasta de dientes, sopas instantáneas, entre otros productos. Esto le permitirá tener en su pulpería siempre lo que los clientes tanto solicitan. En sus planes está mejorar la infraestructura del negocio e ir invirtiendo en nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Álvaro is a hard-working man who, 12 years ago, started his own business by opening a convenience store. At 51 years old, Álvaro is a survivor. Before having his business, he was a money-changer in dollars and córdobas, until one day he suffered a robbery where he almost lost his life. He decided not to continue risking it for his own well-being and that of his family. He is the father of 3 children whom he has supported along with his wife, who he sends financial support.

Álvaro is always looking for ways to improve himself. In order to be self-sufficient, he does not miss work even a single day. This is why he is requesting a loan to buy merchandise: rice, beans, toilet paper, toothpaste, instant soups and other products. This will allow him to always have what his customers are asking for in his convenience store. His plans are to improve the infrastructure of his business and invest in new products.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, toilet paper, toothpaste, instant soups and other products.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. Her husband (also shown in the photo), some time ago started a van driving business. Her husband owns one van and needs some financial help. He will use the amount to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the van to provide better services. Therefore, Shehnaz has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for her husband. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the van

loans.name: Sana

texts.en: Sana, age 27, is a married lady. With the help of her husband, she is running a successful business selling goats to give them a decent life. She buys baby goats at low prices and after raising them a year or two, her husband sells them out in their locality.  Currently she has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats to increase her sales to fulfill her dream of providing basic necessities to her family.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob has a metal workshop in Eldoret town and has been running this business for 8 years. He is 34 years old and married. He and his spouse have been blessed with 3 children.

Jacob will use this loan to buy more stock of metal and iron bars for use in his workshop. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business as well as to repay the loan.

This is Jacob's first loan from VisionFund Kenya, and in future he hopes to have a prosperous business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of metal and iron bars

loans.name: Sunya

texts.en: Sunya is 26 years old. She lives in the Baku region with her family. Her father has died and now Sunya helps her mother and her sisters. Sunya has a consulting business. It is her first business. Today she wants to increase her business. To do that Sunya wants to buy a new computer (notebook) because she can't take the computer which you can see in the picture with her when she needs it. Therefore she has applied to Komak company for a loan amount of 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Sunya is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for the help. In the future she wants to buy a store to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy a new computer (notebook).

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
Seymur was born in Fuzuli city in 1972. He is a taxi driver. Now he lives in Baku region  with his mother and his two brothers. For 22 years his motherland was occupied by Armenians, and Seymur’s family is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). 

Seymur is a hard-working man and loves his job. Now he needs a loan in amount of 1300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Seymur applied to Komak for loan, which he will use to buy spare parts to repair his car. Seymur is thankful to Kiva and lenders for help. In the future, he wants to repair his car’s salon.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 39-year-old woman who is married to Kenneth, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children. Rose operates a tailoring business, which has been in operation for two years, earning herself an income of 10,000 KES at the end of every month.

Rose is now servicing her third loan of 20,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire loan to buy material, needles, zippers and thread to add to her current stock, which is running out.

Rose plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have growth in her business and live a stable life.

loans.use: to buy material, needles, zippers and thread

loans.name: Nigina

texts.en: Nigina is 66 years old. She lives in the Hamadoni district with her family. She has three children (a son and two daughters). Nigina has been engaged with livestock for many years. For more than 10 years, animal husbandry has been her profession. Nigina cared for cattle from a young age and knows all about this activity. She is going to further continue her small business and wants to expand the herd of cattle. With such intentions she applied for a loan. Her age does not embarrass her and she understands that to achieve goals, age is not a barrier and she hardily goes to her goal.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and increase the herd

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is a 45-year-old married woman. She has four children. She wanted to give her family a better standard of living so she decided to start her own business of sewing clothes in order to support her family. She has been sewing clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

Currently Naila has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy more spools of thread in different colors, packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy thread, laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 38-year-old married lady. She has 2 children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been running a small general store for many years.  

Yasmeen's husband offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at his store. He is able to make enough to provide for his family. 

However, for the improvement of her husband’s business, Yasmeen has applied for a Murabaha-type loan of 30,000 PKR in order to buy larger quantities of rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way Yasmeen's husband will be able to consistently fulfill the increasing demands of their customers.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour in order to supply the increasing demands of her and her husband's customers.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Ten years ago Juliana started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Roret, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of three children sells milk, eggs, vegetables and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding it. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from getting diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Juliana believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Juliana patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 41 years old, married, and has seven children. She operates a retail shop, which she has been doing for five years, and it has been profitable. 

Jane requested her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy more stocks of milk, sugar, rice, salt, detergents, and cooking oil to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. She hopes are to buy a plot of land and build commercial houses, earn more income, and care for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, rice, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 44-year-old married woman. She has seven children and she wants to provide them with good living conditions. She recently started a small general store at her home. Her husband does not make enough to lead his family circle alone. Balqees is making a great effort to support her family. 

However, she faces a financial problem in the growth of her business. She needs to buy more items to fill her store. For this, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more packs of biscuits, grains, and cleaning products to meet the daily demands of her customers. In this way her business will move forward and she will be able to offer a good income to her family so that they continue having a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more biscuits, grains, and cleaning products to meet the daily demands of her customers.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
De 27 años de edad Juana en su estado civil  casada, con dos hijos residentes en Sololá siendo el primero de 9 años de edad estudiante en la escuela de la comunidad y el segundo de 1 año de edad, por los cuales tiene ese deseo de superarse en la vida.  

La actividad que dignamente desempeña para poder obtener ingresos y ganancias económicas es la realización de compra de abarrotería y venta de productos de abarrotería que se encuentra ubicado en su comunidad, eligió dicha actividad porque a tenido la oportunidad  de haber trabajado 6 años en dicha actividad y que si deja buena ganancia económica.

El motivo principal de la realización del préstamo es para poder comprar productos de abarrotería para poder obtener un ingreso económico y así mismo el ingreso de las ganancias para mantener un sistema económico y apoyar el desarrollo de su comunidad y la de su familia.

Sus metas personales en la vida y en los años próximos es obtener ganancias que estima de su negocio y en ampliar su negocio en la compra de más locales en el centro de su comunidad y en darles una educación mejor a sus hijos para que llegue a ser  buenos profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Juana, 27, is married and lives in Sololá.  She has two children, so she wants to get ahead in life.  The oldest, 9, attends school in the community; the second one is a year old.

She earns an honest living and a profit buying and selling groceries in her community.  She chose this work because she had the opportunity of having worked for six years in the field, which provides a good profit.

Juana's main reason for the loan is to be able to buy grocery products to earn an income with which to support the economy, the development of her community, and her family.

Her personal goals in life and in the next few years are to earn profits she hopes for from her business and to expand her business by buying more retail spaces in the center of town.  She also wants to give her children a better education so they can be good professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel operates a general store where he sells bread, sugar, cooking oil, biscuits, soap, and other groceries.  Samuel also volunteers as a Learner Guide at the local area, actively assisting in the creation of  business. 

Samuel requested a loan from WOYE/MFI  to increase his inventory and boost his store.

loans.use: to buy more goods to increase his inventory and boost his store.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida, 33 years old, is a very enthusiastic married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) runs a general store to meet their household expenses. He offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base.

 In order to avoid shortages, Abida has accessed a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR for her husband who bought additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, biscuits and grains, etc. Abida is hopeful that her husband’s earnings will increase and their future will be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, biscuits and grains, etc.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 28 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a driver and provides transportation services using his own van. The man shown in this picture is her husband. He earns a good income. 

The van requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. Parveen requested a loan for 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy tires and spare parts for the vehicle. This loan will help her husband drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 49 years old, widowed, and has four children. She operates a tailoring business, which she has been doing for seven years. She earns an income of 12,000 KES every month.

Anna requested her second loan from VisionFund Kenya for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy more materials, zippers, threads, and buttons. She plans on using the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Giovanni Eliseo

texts.es: Giovanni de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el quiere mejor su vivienda construyendo un muro perimetral en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero con lo que gana no le alcanza por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, ladrillos, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra y así poder vivir seguros y cómodos con su esposa.
texts.en:
Giovanni, 37 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. He has worked as an employee at a private company for several years. With what he earns from his job, he is able to cover his household expenses.

He wants to improve his house by building a perimeter wall in the place shown in the photograph, but what he earns is not enough to do it. That is why he is applying for a loan to buy cement, bricks, sand, and iron, and to pay for labor, so that he can live safely and comfortably with his wife.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, and iron, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is 39 years old and married. She is involved in cattle selling with the support of her husband (also in the photo). Both are working together to run their household activities.  They look after the cattle and after raising them for a year or two sell them in their neighborhood. 

Bushra requested a loan for 30,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase stocks of good quality grass and feed. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase grass and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 46-year-old married woman. She has five children and she dreams of seeing them graduate and become professionals, which is why she plans to work very hard and save money. Her husband's income was not able to cope with the expenses. Therefore she started her own business. She has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She earns enough for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for PKR 40,000, which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Shamim wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Rene Antonio

texts.es: René de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, el posee un taller de radio técnico desde hace 10 años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos de su casa, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo una nueva pared, cambiar el techo y colocar puertas, pero no tiene de suficiente capital para poder realizarlo, por esa razón solicita nuevamente un crédito pero esta vez para comprar cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro, laminas, polines, puertas y pago de mano de obra para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
René, 37 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and children. He has had a radio repair shop for 10 years. With what he earns from his work, he is able to pay for household expenses.

He wants to improve his house by building a new wall, changing the roof, and putting in doors, but he doesn't have enough capital to do it. This is why he is applying for another loan, this time to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, metal sheets, beams, and doors, and to pay for labor, so that he and his family can live more comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, metal sheets, beams, and doors, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the required raw materials for growing his furniture-making business, such as specialty sponges, textiles, and other necessary accessories.

loans.name: Gabriela Margoth

texts.es:
Gabriela es una joven de 22 años, nacida en la ciudad de Latacunga, es soltera por lo cual aún vive con sus padres en una zona rural de la provincia de Cotopaxi en Ecuador. Gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres terminó la secundaria pero debido a sus bajos ingresos económicos no pudo continuar con sus estudios en la universidad.
Actualmente se dedica a la producción de leche, negocio que realiza hace dos años. Gabriela aprendió este oficio de su padre, ella se vio obligada a trabajar para ayudar a sus padres a mejorar su economía pero a pesar de su esfuerzo este negocio familiar no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos generados en el hogar. 
La joven está solicitando un préstamo porque quiere comprar cerdos y necesita pagar una deuda, este préstamo la ayudará a crear una nueva fuente de trabajo para así ayudar a sus padres y generar otros ingresos. 
Gabriela agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Gabriela, 22, was born in the city of Latacunga.  She's single, so she still lives with her parents in a rural area of the province of Cotopaxi in Ecuador.  She finished secondary school thanks to her parents' efforts.  She couldn't go on to the study in the university, however, because of their low income.
