Currently she earns a living producing milk, a business she has had for two years.  Gabriela learned this line of work from her father.  She saw the need to work to help her parents improve their finances.  Despite her effort, this family business isn't enough to cover the expenses generated in her household.

The young woman's requesting a loan because she wants to buy pigs and she needs to pay back a debt.  This loan will help her generate another source of income to help her parents and generate additional income.

Gabriela's grateful to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making it possible for her to grow in her job and her personal life.

loans.use: to buy pigs so she has another source of income to be able to help her parents

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 4 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young lady whose face has been blurred because she is 24 years old and lives in a high-risk area, has been making a living making and selling tortillas for 4 years. Her business is located in her home, and she has a lot of customers.

The young lady lives in her own house with her life partner and two daughters. She is applying for a loan in order to buy corn by the quintal and lime to be able to continue making tortillas and to get a better income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime.

loans.name: Silvia De La Paz

texts.es: Silvia tiene 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres, ella tiene un taller de costura y con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos de la casa, quiere mejorar su vivienda terminado de construir el cuarto que muestra en la fotografía pero no tiene de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, ladrillos, piso cerámico, arena, puertas y pago de mano de obra para que ella y sus padres puedan vivir más cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Silvia is 33 years old and lives in her own house with her parents. She has a tailoring shop, and with what she earns, she is able to pay for household expenses.

She would like to improve her house and finish building the room that is shown in the photograph, but she doesn't have enough capital. That is why she is applying for a loan to buy cement, bricks, ceramic flooring, sand, and doors, and to pay for labor, so that she and her parents can live more comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, ceramic flooring, sand, and doors, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Zahro

texts.en:
This resident of the Hamadoni district is Zahro. She is 54 years old. She is a mother of four children. Her husband, as many citizens of Tajikistan, is in the Russian Federation, while Zahro is engaged in farming in the homeland. 

Zahro is sowing her next crop. She does not have enough money to buy tools for planting and finishing the harvest. Zahro already processed and prepared the ground for planting, so what is needed now is to buy fertilizers and seeds. She relies on a loan and believes that due to the loan, she will be able to successfully complete sowing and get a good harvest in spring.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a motorcycle mechanic and has been in the business for seven years. He is 63 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with two children.

He will use this loan to buy more stock of motorcycle spare parts and be able to serve his customers well and make more income. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in the future he hopes to have a prosperous business, make more income and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts for use in his business.

loans.name: Joel Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Joel tiene gran experiencia en el área de la cocina y los alimentos, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propi negocio de preparación y venta de comidas rápidas que hasta ahora le ha generado muy buenos resultados.

Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días desde las durante 10 horas.

Actualmente necesita un auxilio para realizar mantenimiento a su carro de comidas, comprar sillas, mesas, e insumos.

El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y podrá garantizar la calidad de sus preparaciones.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran restaurante con muchos clientes.

Con esta ayuda podrá trabajar de una manera más cómoda y con una mejor prestación de su servicio.

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Joel!
texts.en:
Joel has a lot of experience with cooking and food. A little while ago, he started his own business making and selling fast food, that so far has given him very good results.

He has always preferred to work independently. He works everyday for 10 hours.

Right now he needs help to make some repairs to his food cart, and to buy chairs, tables, and ingredients. The loan would allow him to work under better conditions and to be able to guarantee the quality of his food.

His greatest dream is to be able to have a big restaurant with a lot of customers.

With this assistance, he will be able to work more comfortably and provide better service. With a loan that you make today, you will be able to improve Joel's life and business!

loans.use: to maintain his food cart, and to buy chairs, tables, and ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Hacienda Chacrasana Group

texts.es: El grupo “HACIENDA CHACRASANA” está conformada por mujeres trabajadoras dedicadas al comercio minorista. Marivel tiene 30 años de edad es conviviente con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños adultos. Años atrás prestaba servicios en una empresa textilera. El préstamo lo invertirá  en la compra de más ropa para niños y adultos. Su mayor deseo es tener un stand donde pueda ofrecer su mercadería. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Marivel viste polo de color turquesa.
texts.en:
The Hacienda Chacrasana group is made up of hardworking women working in the retail trade. Marivel is 30 and has a live-in partner and 1 dependent child. She works selling children's and adult's clothing. Years ago she used to offer her services to a textile company.  

She will invest the loan in the purchase of more children's and adult's clothing. Her greatest wish is to have a stall where she can sell her merchandise. The group is grateful to the KIVA investors for the offered loan. Marivel is wearing a turquoise t-shirt.

loans.use: buy clothing for children and adults.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Salome, from Kapsowar, Kenya. Kapsowar is an area where the earth is red and smells fresh from the rain. The trees are lush, and tiny, matchbox-like, mud brick houses with tin roofs line either side of the dirt roads. Salome is happily married, and she and her husband have been blessed with four lovely children.

For the past nine years Salome has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, vegetables, and some personal business she engages in to make extra cash. Salome has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She passionately loves dairy farming. “Cows are part of me. I love cows, I walk cows, I sleep cows, I eat cows,” she says. The village women call her Mrs. Cow.

She sells milk to her neighbours and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet demand. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10-20 litres of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit margins and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying back the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. 

Salome is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling. She will also start selling dairy products such as yogurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Edmond

texts.en:
Edmond is a motorcycle mechanic and has been in this business for 4 years. He is 27 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with one child. 

He will use this loan to buy motorcycle spare parts such as nuts and bolts,springs and brakes as well as oil for use in his business. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business by buying more stock of spare parts. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future he hopes to expand his business, be successful and provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for use in his business.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Dorothy. She is a smallholder farmer from Chemoiben in Litein, Kenya. She is the mother of one daughter. Like many farmers in the region, she keeps a dairy cow. Litein has a thriving market for dairy products. 

Dorothy has sustained herself through dairy farming for six years now. She enjoys the farming lifestyle. She has a connection with farm animals that goes deep, to the extent that she names each of them. She has aspirations of expanding her dairy farm, but due to financial constraints, she has been unable to do so until now. 

Dorothy is kindly requesting KES 50,000  from Kiva lenders, to purchase a high yielding dairy cow. This cow will boost milk production on the farm. As a result, she will have a higher quantity for both consumption and sales. With the money from the additional sales, she will be able to service her loan on time. With increased income from the loan, Dorothy plans to spend money to settle the high costs of production in farming. 

Many farmers compromise quality because of the high cost of inputs. However, with increased income, Dorothy will not take such measures. In the long run, her family will realize an improved standard of living

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fertilize and perform maintenance on his cacao.

loans.name: Bori-Begeri Suli - Nyoligu Group

texts.en:
Hawa is a 35-year-old, hard working woman from Nyoligu in the Northern region of Ghana. Hawa is married and has 3 children. Hawa is the individual pictured 2nd on the right among the members squatting.

Hawa is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last 7 years. The name of the group is ‘Bori-Begeri Suli - Nyoligu’. Hawa earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local and non-local markets.

Hawa and ‘Bori-Begeri Suli - Nyoligu’ have asked for a loan of GHS 7,200. Hawa’s share of the loan is GHS 300 which would help her to buy shea nuts for processing. 

Hawa aspires to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her children with medical care and educational materials.

Hawa thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es una mujer de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta  6ª grado sus padres ya no quisieron que siguiera. Esta casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y ganadería  tiene 5 hijos, 3 ya no viven con ellos y los otros 2 están estudiado.

 Santos, desde hace 10 años tiene un negocio de pupusas y vende ropa, la necesidad la llevo a dedicarse a este negocio y el deseo de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.

 Antes le ayudaba en la sembrá de maíz a su esposo,  su negocio lo tiene en su casa pero su producto lo compra en la capital del país donde tiene que tomar un bus que lleva a ese lugar y se tarda 2 horas y luego regresa su día comienza a las 5:00 am donde prepara el desayuno para su esposo y sus hijos para que luego se vayan para la escuela. 
 
El crédito que esta solicitando, es para comprar  1 docena de pantalones, camisas, blusas, faldas, bloomer, tangas, calcetas, bóxer y mas para su negocio.



Su deseo es que sus últimos hijos sean profesionales, ampliar su negocio y con la ganancia pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Santos, age 46, went to school through the sixth grade.  Her parents did not want her to continue.  She is married, and her husband works in agriculture and with livestock.  She has five children.  Three no longer live with them, and the other two are in school.

Santos has had a business of selling ‘pupusas’ [stuffed tortillas] and selling clothes for ten years.  Necessity and the desire to help her husband with the household expenses led her to this business.  Before that she helped her husband plant corn.  Her business is in her house.  She buys her product in the capital of the country.  She has to take a bus to get there, and it takes two hours.  She then returns home.  Her day starts at 5:00 a.m. when she prepares breakfast for her husband and her children before they go to school.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy one dozen pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, leggings, and different types of underwear for her business.  Her wish is for her last two children to become professionals, to expand her business, and to repay the loan with the profits.

loans.use: to buy one dozen pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, leggings, and different types of underwear and more.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Hello world, meet an amazing woman by the name of Lydia. She is a smallholder farmers based in Sochoi village in the Nandi hills, Kenya. She is married to James with whom she has been together with for almost a decade. She has 3 children who commute to school from home every school-day.  

Lydia has been practising livestock farming for 7 years to help her husband cover family expenses. She has managed to raise 3 sheep, 4 cows and 32 poultry on the farm. She also makes extra money through leasing a tractor and trading in cereals. 

Lydia is seeking a loan to restock her cereals business. She plans to use your money to purchase and transport cereals in bulk to far markets where she will sell at prices high enough to cater for all the expenses incurred plus profit. 

Lydia is confident that she will be able to repay the loan in time because she is hard-working and financially disciplined. Returns from the investment will change her life as she will use the additional income to raise her family's living standards and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 25-year-old, single man, who has been employed in a flower shop for ten years. He was only fifteen when he quit school and became employed in his current field.

He has a special talent and experience in this domain. So he is investing in starting his own flower selling and special occasion decorations business in parallel.

Since he has a limited income, it is hard for him to save enough money to develop his own business. For this reason, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to support and develop his own business selling special flowers and decorations for special occasions.

He hopes to develop his own business to make sure that he can quit his job and concentrate on his own business.

loans.use: to develop his own flower and special occasion decorations business.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly sells potatoes in Eldoret town and has been running this business for 8 years and it has been profitable. She is 39 years old, married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with 2 children.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of potatoes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of potatoes.

loans.name: Chelangat

texts.en:
Chelangat is a smallholder farmer from Chepkemel village in the South Rift region of Kenya. She is a mother of 3 boys and one girl. She practises mixed-farming to fend for her family. Her main sources of income are milk and crops. Milk income comes regularly while crops take a bit of time to mature before they can be ready for the market.  

Chelangat is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to expand her horticultural farm. To make the investment worthwhile, she needs to grow more crops so that she can reap significant returns after all the hard work and long wait. 

Income generated from the investment will make it possible for her to afford the next season's farm-input costs. She will also use the money to pay for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to expand her horticultural farm.

loans.name: Farzand

texts.en:
Farzand is a 30-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and three children. Her husband has been operating a motorbike showroom for new vehicles for many years. 

Farzand's husband needs to pay a wholesale motorbike dealer for a recent shipment, and so Farzand is requesting a loan to do so. For this financial support, Farzand is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To pay a motorbike wholesaler for shipment of merchandise to her husband's showroom.

loans.name: Gonzalo Adalberto

texts.es:
Gonzalo de 61 años de edad, estudio hasta 6ª grado debido a la muerte de su padre ya no pudo seguir en la escuela para ayudar a su mamá con los gastos del  hogar y fue con un amigo de su padre que termino de aprender a trabajar. Esta acompañado y su pareja le ayuda en el cultivo de maíz tiene 5 hijos pero todos se acompañaron, solo viven 2 nietos con ellos.
 
Gonzalo se dedica a la agricultura desde que tiene 10 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de sus padres, siembra miz, pipían, chile, plátano.  El terreno donde siembra esta a un km de su casa y para llegar a su trabajo lo hace a pie, labora 6 horas por la mañana pero regresa por la tarde y trabaja otras 3 horas, su día comienza a las 4:30. am para llegar temprano a su trabajo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 4 toretes para repasto. Su sueño es construir una casa de ladrillo, hoy es de adobe; cultivar 21,000 metros cuadrados de plátano, pues da mas que el maíz y comprarse unas 3 vacas lecheras
texts.en:
Gonzalo, age 61, went to school through the sixth grade.  This is because his father died, and he could no longer continue at school.  He had to help his mother with the household expenses.  He stopped going to school and went to work with a friend of his father’s.

He is in a relationship, and his life partner helps him with the corn crop.  He has five children, and they are all in relationships.  Only two grandchildren live with them.

Gonzalo has worked in agriculture since he was ten years old.  He learned this work from his parents.  He grows corn, pumpkins, peppers, and bananas.  The land that he cultivates is one kilometer from his house.  He gets to his work on foot.  He works six hours in the morning, and returns home in the afternoon.  Then he works another three hours.  His day starts at 4:30 a.m. in order to get to work early.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy four young bulls.  His dream is to build his house from brick as it is now made of adobe, to cultivate 21,000 square meters of bananas as it yields more than corn, and to buy three dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy four young bulls.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy nail polish and beauty products

loans.name: Yessica Suleyma

texts.es:
Yessica es una joven de 19 años de edad, esta cursando 3er año de bachillerato, esta soltera y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en su hogar. 

 Yessica estudia los fines de semana, ya que en el transcurso de la semana le ayuda a su madre a atender el negocio de gallinas ponedoras y cerdos, el cual les genera ingresos para sostener la familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para construir un baño ya que el que tienen esta en malas condiciones, también comprara pollos y alimento para los mismos.

El sueño de Yessica es en el futuro su esfuerzo se vea recompensado con una buena producción de pollos y así tener siempre los ingresos que este le genera y dar mejores condiciones de vida a sus  familia.
texts.en:
Yessica is a young 19 year old woman who is in her 3rd year of high school.  She is single and lives with her parents and her siblings in their home.  Yessica studies on the weekend, since during the week she helps her mother with their chicken and egg production business as well as with hogs.  This is what generates the income to support the family.  

The loan that she is requesting will be used to build a bathroom since the one they have is in bad condition.  They will also use the loan to purchase chickens and feed for their animals. 

Yessica's dream is to see her hard work pay off with great egg production and thus to have enough income to provide a better quality of life for the family.

loans.use: to build a bathroom since the one they have is in bad condition.  They will also use the loan to purchase chickens and feed for their animals.

loans.name: Guluipa

texts.ru: Гулуйпа, 53 года, замужем, все дети взрослые и самостоятельные, только младший сын живет с родителями. Образование у Гулуйпы средне-специальное, дополнительно много лет занимается сельским хозяйством, а именно полеводством и животноводством. По характеру Гулуйпа очень приятная и отзывчивая женщина, она очень общительная и трудолюбивая. В хозяйстве есть 5 коров и 5 лошадей. Также Гулуйпа  выращивает на 0,40 ГА собственной земли ячмень, который реализует оптовым покупателям. Совокупный доход семьи составляет около 11,000 (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития бизнеса, Гулуйпа решила обратиться в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. На прибыль от кредита она планирует построить большой сарай для скота и начать строительство нового дома, так как старый стал очень ветхим.
texts.en:
Guluipa is 53 years old and married. All her children are adults and independent, only the youngest son lives with his parents. Guluipa has vocational education. In addition she has worked with agriculture for many years, mainly with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding. 

Guluipa is by nature a very pleasant and responsive woman. She is very sociable and hard working. She has five cows and five horses at her farm. Guluipa also has 0.40 hectares of own land where she grows barley, which she sells wholesale. The family's total income is around 11,000 som (KGS) per month.

With an aim to further develop her business, Guluipa decided to turn to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) per month to purchase a cow. She plans to use the income from the loan to build a large barn for the livestock and start building a new home, as the old one has deteriorated.

loans.use: to purchase a cow in order to increase the headcount of livestock

loans.name: Nazirahon

texts.ru: Назирахон 56 лет, замужем, мать 6дочерей, они взрослые и самостоятельные. У Назирахон - среднее образование, уже 30 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Стартовав с 5,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у Назирахон имеется 0,62 ГА собственного земельного надела, на котором она ежегодно выращивает картофель для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Также в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы и 3 теленка.  Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назирахон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) для покупки коровы. Доходы от кредита Назирахон хочет вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на расширение сарая.
texts.en:
Nazirahon is 56 years old, married and the mother of six daughters. They are adults and independent. Nazirahon has secondary education. She has worked with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding for 30 years already. 

After having started with 5,000 som (KGS), due to her hard work, Nazirahon currently has her own plot of land of 0.62 hectares, on which she every year grows potatoes for own use and sale. She also has four cows and three calves on her farm. The monthly income is 7,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Nazirahon turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS). She would like to invest the income from the loan in increasing the number of livestock, and plans to save money for expanding her barn.

loans.use: to purchase a cow in order to increase the headcount of livestock

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмира успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Доходы от кредита позволили ей расширить хозяйство, на сегодняшний день у Эльмиры есть одна корова с теленком и лошадь. На 0,49 Га собственного земельного надела, Эльмира выращивает клевер. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) для покупки двух дойных коров, что позволит ей увеличить объемы реализации экологически чистого вкусного, домашнего молока. Доходы от кредита Эльмира планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Elmira successfully repaid her loan, after having used it as intended. She thanks Kiva and all who helped her with the financing. The income from the loan allowed her to expand her business. Currently Elmira has one cow with calf and one horse. She grows clover on 0.49 hectares of own land. 

With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase two dairy cows, which will allow her to increase the volume of ecological, tasty, homemade milk for selling. Elmira plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, and plans to save money for repairing her home.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows in order to increase the volume of ecological milk for selling

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмира, 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Элмиры - средне-специальное образование. Элмира очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Вместе с мужем она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав много лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Элмиры на сегодняшний день имеются: 20 овец и 3 коровы. Также Элмира обрабатывает 1,09 ГА земли, где выращивает ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Элмира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации домашнего экологически чистого молока, которое пользуется большим спросом. Доходы от кредита Элмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Elmira is 45 years old, married and has three children together with her husband. Elmira has vocational education. She is very responsible, sociable and happy. 

Elmira works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation together with her husband, after having started this business many years ago. Thanks to persistent work, Elmira currently has 20 sheep and 3 cows on her farm. She also processes 1.09 hectares of land, where she grows barley for own use and sale. The monthly income is around 16,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Elmira turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a dairy cow for increasing the volume of homemade, ecological milk to sell, which will give a larger demand. Elmira plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, and plans to invest money in building a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase the volume of ecological milk for selling

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида, 41 год, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Фариды - высшее образование, начала свой бизнес она 10 лет назад, благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию Фариды, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 3 дойные коровы, 15 овец.  Также имеется 1,86 ГА земельной доли, на которой она ежегодно выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Фарида обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для закупки корма и сена для скота, это позволит ей сохранить поголовье скота и получить здоровый приплод. Доходы от бизнеса Фарида планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en:
Farida is 41 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has higher education and started her business 10 years ago. Thanks to Farida's purposefulness and hard work, she currently has three dairy cows and 15 sheep. She also has 1.86 hectares of land on which she every year grows barley. The total monthly income is around 20,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Farida turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase fodder and hay for the livestock. This will allow her to keep her livestock and receive healthy offspring from it. Farida plans to invest the income from the business in further developing it.

loans.use: to buy hay and fodder for livestock in order to keep her livestock and get healthy offspring from it

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer de treinta y seis años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de diecisiete años y dos hijas de trece años y de tres meses de edad, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de papas fritas.
Ella es emprendedora, responsable, buena madre, y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Cruce Villa Adela’, un lugar caracterizado por conectar a varios barrios de la ciudad y por el comercio en todas las áreas que provoca, además de su altura a 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clíma frío y vientos fuertes.
Francista es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es típica (manta sombrero y pollera),  su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español en el comercio. su vida la realiza con su esposo que se encarga de la venta de la producción y sus tres hijos, dos de los cuales se encuentran en la escuela y el mayor ayuda en las ventas, todos viven en una casa propia de ladrillo que cuenta con los servicios de luz, agua y gas.  Su trabajo es la elaboración de papas fritas artesanales; hechas a fogón a fuego lento y con un especial seguimiento en cada una de las fases de elaboración,  su énfasis se encuentra en el uso de productos naturales, Papas, Aceite y Sal, todos ellos carecen de conservantes y colorantes. Una vez elaboradas, su esposo se encarga de la venta en un puesto de venta fijo con muchos clientes al paso. Ya lleva un año de experiencia en este trabajo y esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la empresa. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio comprando maquinaria para la elaboración de nuevos productos para variar su oferta y generar mejores ingresos. Ella desea realizar la obra fina de su vivienda para que sus hijos vivan en mejores condiciones y no pasen frío.
Es por esos motivos que Francisca solicita un préstamo para la refacción de su vivienda para que sus hijos no pasen frío.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 36-year-old married woman. She has one son who is 17 years old and two daughters who are 13 years old and 3 months old. Her business is making and selling fried potato chips.

She is resourceful, responsible, hardworking, and a good mother. She runs her business in the "Cruce Villa Adela" area, a place known for linking several neighborhoods of the city and for all kinds of commerce, as well as for its altitude of 3,800 meters above sea level and its cold weather and strong winds.

Francisca has a dark complexion and long, braided, black hair. She dresses traditionally (shawl, hat, and skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish for her business. She shares her life with her husband, who is in charge of selling what she makes, and her three children, two of whom are in school; the oldest also helps with selling. They all live in a brick house that they own. It has electricity, water, and gas service. 

Her work is the production of homemade fried potato chips, cooked over a low fire on a wood-burning stove with special care in every step of the process. Her emphasis is on the use of natural products: potatoes, oil, and salt—all of them without preservatives or dyes. Once they are made, her husband is in charge of a permanent sales stand with many customers passing by. She already has one year of experience in this work, and this is her first loan with the company. 

Her dream is to expand her business by buying machinery for making new products in order to diversify her offerings and generate a better income. She would like to do finish work on her house so that her children will live in better conditions and won't be cold.

It is for these reasons that Francisca is requesting a loan to repair her house so that her children won't be cold.

loans.use: to repair her house so that her children won't be cold

loans.name: Zhanyl

texts.ru: Жаныл 53 года, замужем, есть 4 детей. У Жаныл - среднее образование. По характеру она очень ответственная, аккуратная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Вместе с мужем Жаныл занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 9,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Жаныл, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 теленка, 25 овец и 6 коров. Также на земельном участке мерою 1,5 ГА она выращивает картофель и кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). Жаныл  является лидером группы "Ничкесай", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 3 человека, всего их четверо. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жаныл обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки, телята будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, Жаныл хочет накопить средства на постройку дачи с сараем за селом.
texts.en:
Zhanyl is 53 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education.  By nature she is responsible, conscientious, sociable and happy.  She and her husband are involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, having started in this field 19 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 9,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, Zhanyl currently owns four calves, 25 sheep and six cows.  She also cultivates potatoes and corn on 1.5 hectare of land.  She makes a monthly income of 9,000 som (KGS). 

Zhanyl is the leader of a group named "Nichkesai", which consists of three more people, so four in total.  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy some calves to increase her livestock headcount.  She will keep the calves that she buys on her own farm.  Zhanyl plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her herd.  She would also like to save enough money to build a house with a barn outside of the village.

loans.use: to buy additional calves in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis, de 45 años, inicio con un negocio de prestación de servicios de parqueadero aproximadamente 10 años con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

Trabaja todos los días con el afán de conseguir el pan diario para su familia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de realización de reformas y adecuaciones locativas, así podrá prestar un servicio de mejor calidad.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener a su hijo y a su esposa brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor.

Apoya a Luis para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en: Luis is 45 years old and approximately 10 years ago he began a business offering parking services with the goal of having a business that would generate him income to survive. He works every day with the goal of providing his family their daily needs. He seeks a loan to make repairs and modifications to his location in order to provide better service. With this loan he will be able to support his son and wife, providing them a better quality of life. Support Luis so that he can continue with his work!

loans.use: to remodel and make modifications to his parking service business.

loans.name: Estuardo

texts.en:
Estuardo is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in cotton hammocks. He would like to hire additional weavers for his workshop and invest in a bulk purchase of wood and thread. Estuardo has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story: "Thanks to my parents I've learned everything about handicrafts and I find interesting how today's artisans continue to use the type of tools and techniques developed by the ancient Maya. My first items were white hammocks using the natural color of the threads, and then we began to weave them in different colors, always making sure we made improvements where needed, according to what people were looking for. Throughout this time I've learned a lot and have had many great experiences. The people who know me would tell you I'm quite the enthusiast and charismatic, as well as a go-getter. I love to play sports, study and go out with my friends. I am a man of simple means that enjoys life just as it is, and has a positive outlook on life. I have faith in everything I undertake. I feel very proud of what we have achieved so far. I'm involved in every step from designing the hammock and choosing the colors of the threads and pinewood. It feels amazing to see how something that began as an idea in my head becomes a finished product. I feel proud to represent one of Guatemala's textile traditions, because the world deserves to know about the beautiful things our culture has to offer." "Many thanks, my friends, for believing in our craft and our vision. Your support helps keep the traditional art of hand-loomed hammocks alive, giving employment to artisans and helping the community prosper." Use the link below to view Estuardo's cotton hammocks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8617

loans.use: to hire additional weavers for his workshop and invest in a bulk purchase of wood and thread

loans.name: Sebastián

texts.es:
En el departamento de Sololá, durante 15 años, Sebastian  hombre casado de 37 años, se ha dedicado a la venta  de cortes. Como hombre  trabajador, ha tomado el reto de la vida de sacar adelante sus tres hijos que se han convertido en el motivo de luchar cada día para tener un mejor futuro para su familia y que el tengan la condición de vida adecuada. 

Su actividad principal es la venta de cortes, dicha actividad lo ha venido realizando desde hace 15 años, la segunda actividad que el realiza es la venta de refacciones por los alrededores de su comunidad, el es una hombre muy emprendedor siempre busca nuevas estrategias para poder tener un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia para que tengan la condición de vida que se merecen.

El uso respectivo que le dará al préstamo es para la compra de mercadería de cortes típicas para contar con mercadería para tener a la disposición de los clientes diferentes tipos de cortes, uno de los sueños de Sebastian es la construcción de casa para sus hijos para que ellos tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada y mejorar sus ventas con el requerimiento de un préstamo.
texts.en:
In Solola department 37 year old Sebastian has sold traditional clothing for 15 years. Married and hard-working, he has made it his goal to help his three children succeed and it is for them that he works hard every day so that his family has a better future and what they need to live.

He has a business selling traditional clothing, which he has been doing for 15 years. His second job is selling snacks around his neighborhood. He is an enterprising man always seeking new strategies to be able to have income to benefit his family so that they may have a good quality life that they deserve.

This loan will be used to buy traditional clothing to sell to his customers seeking various styles. One of his dreams is to build a house so that his children have adequate living conditions, and to improve his sales with the requirement of the loan.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru: Мария, 52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Марии - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1996 году, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Марии, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 коров, 3 теленка, а также есть земельный надел размером 2,0 ГА, на котором она выращивает картофель и кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). Мария является участником группы "Ничкесай", в которой кроме нее состоит еще 3 человека. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мария обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Mariya is 52 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising four children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and is involved in animal husbandry and crop farming, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  She started in this field in 1996 with the purchase of some cattle for 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she now owns six cows and three calves, as well as a two-hectare plot of land on which she grows potatoes and corn.  She makes a monthly income of 6,000 som (KGS).  Mariya is the member of a group named "Nichkesai" which consists of three more people.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy some calves for fattening and resale.  She is planning to re-invest her earnings from this loan into further increasing her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy additional calves for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Jose Amadeo

texts.es: Jose de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la venta de medicina popular desde hace 7 años, vende en las diferentes colonias aledañas y ya tiene muchos clientes por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas medicina popular por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jose is 58 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and daughter. He has been selling natural medicine for 7 years. He sells in different adjacent neighborhoods and now has many customers for the quality of his product and good prices. Jose seeks a loan to buy more natural medicine at wholesale as this is his only form of work and it will result in better income.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
“When women come together, they are powerful,” says Betty, a 24-year-old farmer who lives in the village of Cheplanget in the Litein area of Kenya. As a girl, she watched women in her village mobilize to replace traditional thatched roofs with waterproof corrugated iron. The memory of this collective effort led her to join Cheplanget youth self-help group. 

For the past year she has been actively involved in mixed farming, and because she is from rural Kenya, gender roles still adhere and women do the heavy work of fetching and carrying water and fuel wood, in addition to household chores, childcare and tending crops. Many are left to run farms alone while their husbands migrate in search of paid employment. This has not been a set back because Betty has been making great profits in farming. 

Betty has one of the places that has favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming - that is good climate, soils, transport system, and market. Betty  has always wanted to diversify and start horticulture farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is lack of funds to start the business off the ground. 

She is requesting a loan to start horticulture farming. Through Cheplanget youth self-help group (a group where members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan), she joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro finance that supports young and enterprising farmers. 

With your loan she intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow her to transport the produce faster to an international market, hence making more money. This loan will improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Telson Misael

texts.es: Telson Misael mayor de edad casado con dos menores de edad de origen chinandegano ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable, el cual lo ha demostrado en los créditos anteriores en cuanto a la responsabilidad de sus pagos en tiempo y forma, es un microempresario administrador y propietario de su propio negocio el cual consiste en la compra venta de cerdos en pie a comerciantes de esta localidad, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano saliendo a las comunidades aledañas a comprar cerdos al mejor precio por lotes de 4 a 6 cerdos los empaca o los engorda máximo dos meses y luego los vende tiene clientes fijos y eventuales sus compras son al contado, negocio el cual tiene ya varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad como una fuente de trabajo el cual le ha ayudado a mejorar sus ingresos económicos en su hogar, hoy en dia esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de un lote de cerdos en pie para la crianza y venta de este mismo ya que se los están ofertando a buen precio. Telson Misael agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua. Para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Telson Misael is an older, married man with two young children. He is originally from Chinandegano, on the western side of the country. He is known for being a hard-worker and responsible, which he has demonstrated in previous loans through punctual repayments. He is a small businessman and owner of his own business which is buying and selling pigs commercially. He begins work very early, leaving to nearby communities to buy pigs at the best prices by lots of 4-6 pigs. He raises and fattens them for two months and then sells them to his customers, and eventually his pigs are all sold. He has had this business for several years as a source of work which has helped him generate income for his home.

Today he seeks a new loan to buy a lot of pigs to raise and sell as they are being offered at a good price. Telson Misael is thankful to the Kiva lenders who provide help to people of few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they may work with dignity.

loans.use: to buy several pigs.

loans.name: Libardo Antonio

texts.es:
Libardo es un hombre de 67 años de edad, que desde hace unos meses comenzó a trabajar en su propio negocio de abarrotes con el afán de ganarse la vida y tener recursos suficientes para el sustento de su familia.

Trabaja todos los días durante 10 horas y, a pesar de la competencia que existe en el sector, ha obtenido buenos resultados, generando ingresos suficientes para que a su esposa y sus hijos no les haga falta nada.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para comprar un enfriador y surtido al por mayor (mecato, lácteos, galletería, granos, entre otros), esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades inmediatas de sus clientes, aumentando las ventas e ingresos que recibe por su labor.

Libardo, con su espíritu de superación y las ganas de salir adelante con su familia, lo impulsan a seguir luchando y avanzar para cumplir el sueño de adquirir una casa propia, en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Libardo is 67 years old and some months ago he began to work in his own grocery business with the goal of earning a living and having sufficient resources to support his family. He works every day for 10 hours. In spite of the competition that exists he has been successful, generating sufficient income so that his wife and children don't lack for anything.

The loan he seeks is to buy a cooler and stock at wholesale (dairy products, cookies, grains, other items). This will enable him to offer a greater variety of products to meet the immediate needs of his customers, increasing his sales and income through his labor.

Libardo's spirit to succeed and desire for his family to get ahead inspire him to succeed and his family to also succeed. It inspires him to fight and work toward his dream of buying his own home, where he can enjoy a better quality of life in the company of his family and provide a good education to his children.

loans.use: to buy a cooler and stock at wholesale (dairy products, cookies, grains, other items).

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne is a married woman and has been blessed with five kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Evalyne operated a poultry selling business, which had been operational for over 4 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Evalyne dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a smallholder farmer based in Kipsebwo village in Nandi Hills, Kenya. She stays with her husband Nicholas and 5 children on a high altitude, 0.4 acre, farmland that is fertile for agriculture. She grows maize, tea, and keeps dairy animals and poultry. 

She started farming 4 years after getting married 18 years ago. It was a means of helping her husband look after the family. Besides farming, she started planting trees to give the farm an aesthetic appearance. Ever since, she has become a hardened farmer.
 
Lucy is seeking a loan to purchase farm implements. She is going to use the money to purchase modern farm equipment that is in good working condition, efficient and improved in design and usability. She has opted out of using old tools that are worn out and hectic to use.
 
She believes she is going to realize a better harvest as a result of using better tools. She will use the additional income to provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to purchase farm tools.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin, a 29-year-old father of three children between the ages of one and seven years old, is from the city outskirts and operates a motor taxi and works as a cleaner to earn a living. Like most women in the community, his wife stays home to take care of the children and the house. 

Martin has always wanted to improve upon the substandard and unhealthy living conditions of his family, but his limited income has prevented him from achieving his goal. For the first time, he is requesting a loan to improve those conditions by renovating his house. Specifically, he wants to replace the windows and doors of the house to better insulate it and keep the family warm and dry in the upcoming cold and rainy season. This will help keep them healthy and reduce their costs for medicines.

Martin is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support. He promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To buy new doors and windows for his home.

loans.name: El Milagro Group

texts.es: Graciela de 47 años de edad es casada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “El Milagro” y está conformada por 06 mujeres emprendedoras con deseos de desarrollarse en su negocios. Graciela  se dedica a la venta de comida como el lomo saltado. Gracias a su constante esfuerzo su negocio continua creciendo y de esa manera poder educar su menor hijo. El crédito que solicitó lo destinara para la compra de carne de res, pescado, arroz y aceite. Su mayor anhelo es contar con un local, para así dar un  mejor servicio a sus comensales. La Alcancía Comunal “El Milagro” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Graciela es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo morado.
texts.en:
Graciela is 47 years old, married, and has one dependent child. She belongs to the "El Milagro" communal bank, which is made up of six enterprising women with the desire to develop themselves through their businesses. 

Graciela sells food such as lomo saltado (a traditional Peruvian stir-fry made with vegetables and strips of beef). Thanks to her constant effort, her business is continuing to grow, and this is enabling her to raise her child. The loan she has for will be earmarked for the purchase of beef, fish, rice and cooking oil. Her greatest desire is to have a permanent location so that she can provide better service to her diners.

The "El Milagro" communal bank is grateful to the people who have made this loan possible. Graciela is the second from the right, wearing a purple T-shirt.

loans.use: To buy beef, fish, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Luisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Luisa de 45 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal y carteras desde hace 5 años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal en una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee mucha clientela, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Luisa está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería como lociones, cosméticos, perfumes, carteras, cremas, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Luisa is 45 years old and lives with her husband and daughter. She has been selling personal use products and purses for five years. Her business is located in the municipal market, in a very busy area, and for that reason she has a considerable clientele. With the earnings she gets she manages to pay for some of her household expenses.

Luisa is requesting a loan so that you can buy more merchandise at wholesale such as lotions, cosmetics, perfumes, purses and creams, so that she can continue with her sales which generate good earnings.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise at wholesale such as lotions, cosmetics, perfumes, purses, creams, etc.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Victor de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de medicina popular,  vende en las diferentes colonias y mercados aledaños y ya tiene muchos clientes por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, Victor está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas medicina popular por mayor para tener mejores ingresos y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Victor is 54 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their two children. He has been selling over-the-counter medicines for five years. He sells in various neighborhoods and local markets, and already has many customers because of the quality of the product and the good prices. 

Victor is requesting a loan in order to purchase more over-the-counter medicines at wholesale so that he can have a better income, and consequently a better quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: To buy more over-the-counter medicines at wholesale.

loans.name: Marta Edilia

texts.es:
Marta, con 38 años de edad, se ha dedicado por muchos años a vender alimentos y comestibles en el municipio de Medellín; de esta forma complementa los ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido luchar incansablemente, siempre buscando la manera de salir adelante, esto la impulsa a solicitar el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor como bebidas gaseosas, insumos para preparación de alimentos, licores, entre otros, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y tendrá más variedad de artículos para ofrecer a sus clientes mejorando así sus ingresos.

Marta manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir un local propio ubicado en el centro de la ciudad para montar su negocio y lograr que sea mucho más rentable y que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Marta, 38 years old, has made a living selling food and groceries for many years in the city of Medellin. In this way she supplements the income with which she has moved her children forward.

Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to fight tirelessly, always seeking the means to move ahead. This drives her to request a loan to restock wholesales supplies like soft drinks, ingredients for food preparation and liquor, among others. This will allow her to continue her work and to have more variety of goods to offer her customers thus improving her income.

Marta says that her greatest wish is to be able to acquire her own place located in the city center to set up her own business, manage to make it more profitable and that it guarantees her favorable economic stability to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to restock wholesale supplies like soft drinks and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana, 52, is photographed on her tricycle with her husband Selman, 54. They are Egyptian Albanians and parents of two grown children. Selman works for the city doing maintainance work. After work, he collects trash metal.

Suzana and Selman use their tricycle to collect metal, which they sell. They are requesting a loan to purchase metal, repair their tricycle, and pay for a medical checkup. Suzana suffers from a lung disease and has to go to the hospital annually. Unfortunately, the couple lives in a basement that is in poor condition and this negatively impacts her health.

loans.use: to repair her tricycle, purchase metal trash, and pay for a medical checkup

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA ESTRELLA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yanet es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, taller de costura, venta de comida, costura de chalecos, confección de polleras, servicio de construcción, venta de gelatina y refrescos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yanet es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace siete años, cuando se caso, ya que su esposo realizaba este trabajo, con el pasar del tiempo ella aprendió el negocio y decidió emprender un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas por mayor y una máquina) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en diferentes departamentos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las el área de salud, las capacitaciones y el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Nueva Estrella Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Regional Office.  It's made up of nine members governed by a board of directors of which Yanet is the president.  The bank members carry out a variety of jobs, including food sales, tailoring, sewing vests, sewing "polleras" [traditional skirts], construction services, and gelatin and soft drink sales.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Yanet.  She said she has been with Pro Mujer for four years, having joined on the invitation of a friend who's a client of the institution.  Currently she has a tailoring business that she started seven years ago when she got married, because her husband was in that line of work.  As time went by, she learned the business and decided to go out on her own.

This loan is to increase her capital with a purchase of fabric wholesale and a sewing machine, which she'll get from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz.  After production, she'll sell her merchandise in different departments.  This form of work allows her to earn money to help her family financially, because she's married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she say the health field, the trainings, and the loans the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale and a sewing machine

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:
Yohanna is a maize farmer from Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Yohanna had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yohanna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later at prices up to 40% higher than around harvest time. 

When asked, Yohanna said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: To pay for urgent expenses such as school fees and food, and stock his harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Sale

texts.en:
Sale is a maize farmer from Sada, Nigeria. Before becoming a Babban Gona member, Sale had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to pay for urgent expenses such as food, school fees and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sale can now store his maize at harvest and sell it a few months later at prices up to 40% higher. 

When asked, Sale said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.”

loans.use: To pay for urgent expenses such as school fees and food, and stock his harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Zachariah

texts.en:
Zachariah is a maize farmer from Makera, Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Zachariah had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Zachariah can now store his maize at harvest and sell it a few months later at prices up to 40% higher. 

When asked, Zachariah said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To pay for urgent expenses such as school fees and food, and stock his harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a maize farmer from Kuradawa, Nigeria. Before becoming a Babban Gona member, Esther had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cover her immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Esther can now store her maize at harvest and sell it a few months later at prices up to 40% higher. 

When asked, Esther said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To pay for urgent expenses such as school fees and food, and stock her harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en:
Hannatu is a maize farmer from Makera, Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, she had to sell her maize at low prices soon after harvest to cover school fees and food expenses. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hannatu can now store her maize at harvest and sell it a few months later at prices up to 40% higher. 

When asked, Hannatu said, “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To pay for urgent expenses such as school fees and food, and stock her harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Audi

texts.en:
Audi is a maize farmer from Maijakai, Nigeria. Before becoming a Babban Gona member, Audi had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cover urgent expenses such as school fees and food.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Audi can now store his maize at harvest and sell it a few months later at prices up to 40%.

When asked, Audi said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To pay for urgent expenses such as school fees and food, and stock his harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer from Maijakai, Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover urgent expenses such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa Kallamu can now store his maize at harvest and sell it a few months later at prices up to 40% higher.

When asked, Musa Kallamu said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To pay for urgent expenses such as school fees and food, and stock his harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un señor de 24 años, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en un pequeño recinto llamado Salto del Bimbe, conocido así porque existe una gran cascada,  este sector pertenece a la provincia de Santo Domingo, con un clima muy cálido y zona productiva.
Miguel actualmente trabaja en una finca ya varios años, él se dedica al ordeño de las vacas y jornales, también v queso, se ha ganado el apoyo y confianza de su jefe; es por ello que tiene un gran sueño, de ponerse su propio negocio, va a emprender en el negocio de la crianza de pollos, tiene preparado el terreno y le falta el capital  para empezar.
Miguel acudió a la institución por su hermana ya que ella ha trabajado varios años con la institución y ha podido crecer en su negocio. Miguel pudo obtener el crédito, con ello podrá comprar pollos, el balanceado y los comederos y bebederos para montar su galpón, Miguel ya tiene visto su mercado para la entrega; está muy feliz y se siente muy agradecido con Fundación Alternativa y el proyecto Kiva ya que muchas instituciones no querían creer en su sueño y le cerraban las puertas. Con la Fundación ahora su sueño es una realidad con esto podrá crecer profesionalmente y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 24 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a small area called Salto Del Bimbe, known for its great waterfall. This area is located in Santo Domingo province and has a warm climate and is a productive area.

Miguel has worked on a ranch for several years. He is in charge of the cows and the day laborers, as well as cheese. He has gained the confidence and support of his supervisor. Miguel has a dream of opening his own business, so he is going to start a business raising chickens. He has prepared the land and he needs the capital to get started. Miguel approached the institution through his sister as she has worked with the institution for various years and has been able to grow her business. Miguel could obtain a loan with which he could buy chickens, food, feeders, and waterers to open his shed.

Miguel has identified his market to enter, he is very happy and grateful to Fundacion Alternativa and Kiva as many institutions didn't want to believe in his dream and they closed their doors to him. Thanks to the Foundation now his dream is a reality and he will be able to grow professionally and help his family get ahead.

loans.use: to start a chicken farm, be able to grow professionally and help his family get ahead.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is a hard working single lady aged 33. She comes from Kakoba in Mbarara district, Uganda. She is a veterinary doctor with a diploma in the field. She decided to put her expertise in the animal drug shop business where she sells animal drugs and other farm materials and herbicides and pesticides. She has under her care the three children of her late brother who would otherwise be helpless as their mother abandoned them. 

She wants to restock her business with veterinary drugs so that she can serve her customers well. Because of limited capital, she has again approached UGAFODE at the local branch of Mbarara to request a loan of UGX 2,000,000.

With the competitive advantage of a big stock and expertise in her business she is sure to service this loan very well as usual and to earn more profits from the business which will really give her a big boost. All assistance rendered to her is highly appreciated.

loans.use: To buy veterinary drugs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides, and other agricultural supplies to improve his land.

loans.name: Eluzia

texts.en:
Eluzia is single and lives with his mother and sister. Eluzia pays for his family's expenses and also cares for them.

His business consists in charging and repairing mobile phones. 

He requested a loan which he will use to expand his business. His dreams are to develop his business.

loans.use: To expand his phone repairing business

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is single and lives in Mundri town with mother and sister. He pays for a large portion of the family's expenses. 

David sells motorcycle spare parts, repairs motorcycle and  offers other services to his customers. He learned at a young age when he dropped out of school due to school fees problems, and he performs it with the help of some workers. 

With the loan, he will buy more items and spare parts for his shop to satisfy his customers demand, and also to pay workers in his store.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his business

loans.name: Mirgul

texts.ru: Миргул 43 года, замужем, мать 3 сыновей и 1 дочери. У Миргул среднее образование, уже 18 лет занимается разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря неустанному труду и выдержке Миргул, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 55 овец, 4 коровы и 3 теленка, также есть земельный надел мерою 1,9 Га, где она выращивает картофель и подсолнечник. Для разведения скота у нее есть все условия. Миргул является одним из 4 членов группы "Ничкесай". В целях увеличения поголовья скота она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для дальнейшего их разведения. На доходы от кредита Миргул планирует увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en: Mirgul is 43 years old, married, and the mother of three sons and one daughter.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and she has been breeding livestock and growing crops for 18 years already.  Thanks to her persistent labor and fortitude, she now has 55 sheep, four cows and three calves.  She also grows potatoes and sunflowers on a plot of land measuring 1.9 hectare.  She has everything she needs to breed livestock.  She is one of the four members of the "Nichkesai" group.  Eager to increase her livestock headcount, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy calves for further breeding.  She plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into increasing her herd.

loans.use: to buy additional calves in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Massah

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Massah, a mother of three children aged 23, 11 and six. In 2006, Massah began her textiles business to be self-reliant after divorcing her husband. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she has been able to increase her profit from 911,797 to Le 1,015,000 every month thanks to the previous loan she received. 

Having received and repaid three previous loans, Massah is requesting a new one for Le 5,000,000 to buy more lace, wax and batik. While currently selling from a stall, she plans to move to a shop, educate her children and build a house.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for cotton, lace and batik.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pigs and feed.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda, 59 years old, lives in Burgos, Aloran, Misamis Occidental and is a widow. 

In order to survive, she has found ways to attain income through her sari-sari (small grocery) store. It began with displaying a few inventories of canned goods, noodles, sugar, a dozen packets of shampoo, and soap. 

She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2009. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. 

Now, she applies for 30,000PHP to pay for additional merchandise to draw more customers to buy in her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise to draw more customers to buy in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Preciosa

texts.en:
Preciosa is driven by passion in selling. She is a widow and lives in Oroquieta City. 

She is operating a sari-sari (small grocery) store to sustain their needs. Being the breadwinner, she experienced hardship especially in raising her family. Day and night, she never gets tired tending her store. 

Preciosa is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations in a timely manner. Now, she has taken another loan to restock items for her sari-sari (Small Grocery) store to continually serve more customers. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. 

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continually provide for her family and someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children.

loans.use: to restock items for her sari-sari (small grocery) to continually serve more customers

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda is a businesswoman from Molave. She is 65 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store (variety store) and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Luzminda is a full-fledged member of Paglaum MPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Luzminda continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for the maintenance of his cacao plantings

loans.name: Angel Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Angel, radicad en zona rural del municipio de Montería, siempre se ha desempeñado en el sector agropecuario al lado de su familia donde aprendió estos menesteres. 

Lleva varios años con su propia cría de cerdos de engorde para la venta y distribución en varias zonas del su pueblo. 

Sueña con mejorar el número de animales y solicitó a la Corporación un crédito con el que adquirirá varios Cerdos para levante y los insumos para la alimentación y sostenimiento de estos. 

Las ganancias obtenidas por el aumento de sus animales será mucho mayor lo que le permitirá tener un mejor nivel de vida sin tanta dificultad económica.

De este negocio dependen sus hijos y esposa a quiénes ayuda mucho para salir adelante.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una casa propia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Angel lives in the rural area of the municipality of Montería. He has always worked in the animal farming sector, together with his family, from whom he learned this business. For several years now, he has been raising his own pigs for fattening, to sell and distribute throughout the region around his town. 

He dreams of increasing the number of animals and applied to the Corporation for a loan with which he will acquire several pigs for raising and the supplies for feeding and maintaining the same. 

The profits obtained by the increase in animals will be much greater, and this will allow him to have a better standard of living without such financial difficulty. 

His wife and children depend on this business; he helps them to get ahead. 

His greatest dream is to be able to have his own home and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To acquire several pigs to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cashew seeds wholesale

loans.name: Laureta

texts.en:
Laureta is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. 

Recently, she took a loan to purchase additional piglets and bags of animal feeds and vitamins. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she also wanted to venture into swine production. Someday she hopes to open a meatshop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and bags of animal feeds and vitamins

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Madis

texts.en:
Madis finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well.
