At the age of 61 and widowed, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of Paglaum MPC. She credits to the cooperative her capital for supporting her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Madis wishes to become a supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Adom Wo Wim Group

texts.en:
Kojo is a leader of Adom Wo Wim group. He is 48 years old and comes from Egyirkrom in the Central Region of Ghana.  

Kojo is a farmer and  he has been in farming for the past  seven years. He has ten acres of orange farm plantation. Kojo is married with  three children, and only one of his children is in school.  He uses the proceeds from the orange plantation to maintain the farm and also care for his children. 

Kojo is faced with one crucial challenge which is additional finance to supplement the cost of maintenance of his orange farm. He needs micro finance assistance to enable him maintain his farm to increase crop yield. Kojo has to pay for the cost of hiring labour to weed the farm as well as buying fertilizer and food fly traps. 

He is hopeful for a good harvest to generate more income to cater for the family. Kojo thanks all  his micro lenders for their kind support in realising his dream.

loans.use: To hire labourers to weed the farm and to buy fertilizer and food fly traps

loans.name: Pedro Armando

texts.es:
Pedro se desempeña exitosamente en su negocio de taller de cerrajería, metales y madera, siendo una persona muy reconocida en la vereda por su buen trabajo y servicio. 

Ya que ha laborado 24 años con los conocimientos que adquirió por medio del aprendizaje empírico, ha tenido la oportunidad de mantener su trabajo y ha intentado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 

Por esta razón quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de materia prima como madera y metal.

Con estos elementos podrá continuar prestando su servicio ya que podrá capitalizar su negocio.

Actualmente es casado y vive con su familia en una humilde finca, a los cuales siempre trata de ayudar económicamente para que puedan sustentar y mejorar su vida. 

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran taller con varios empleados y poco a poco podrá lograr su objetivo. 

Ayuda a un hombre emprendedor con ganas de salir adelante con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Pedro has a successful business as a metal and woodworker. He is well known in the region for his good work and customer service.  

Having worked for 24 years with the knowledge he acquired through hands-on experience, he's had the opportunity of keeping a steady job and has tried to improve his family's living conditions. 

That is why he is requesting a loan to buy raw materials, such as wood and metal. With these items, he will be able to continue offering his services and capitalize on his business. 

He is currently married and lives with his family on a humble farm. He is always trying to help them out financially so they can maintain and improve their lives. 

His greatest dream is to be able to have a large workshop with several employees, and little by little, he will be able to achieve his goal.

Help out this enterprising man who wants to get ahead by giving him a loan!

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as wood and metal.

loans.name: Ewuradi Dea Group

texts.en:
Adjoa is a 50-year-old single mother, with six children. Her two youngest children are still attending school. She lives with her family in Enyinabrim, in the central region of Ghana. 

She is a member of the Ewuradi Dea Group. All the group members reside within the same community. Adjoa and her group members are active members of their farming association. The association is responsible for marketing their crops to local industrial buyers.

Adjoa has been farming for the past 25 years, with a lot of experience. She grows palms and oranges for a living. She also owns a small provisions shop at her home to supplement her income. 

Her main challenge is the maintenance of her farm, as it is physically demanding. She is faced with the challenge of financing the cost of hired labour in weeding the farm. Additionally, she has to pay for the cost of harvesting the crops as well as transporting them to a sale centre for sale. 

A micro-loan will allow Adjoa to maximize her profit. she plans to invest her profit into her provisions store, as well as to further her two children's education. Adjoa and her group members thank all their micro-lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: To weed the farm and harvest the crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To hire labourers to weed and to buy fertilizer and food fly traps.

loans.name: Ayekoo Group

texts.en:
Kwesi is 67 years old and he is a member of the Ayekoo Group. Kwesi is happily married with seven children. His four youngest children are still in school. He lives with his family in Enyinabrim in the Central Region of Ghana. 

He has been a farmer for 37 years. He grows oranges. He also owns a small provisions shop to supplement his income. However, his main source of income remains his farm. Kwesi and his fellow group members belong to a local registered farming association that is very dynamic with strong leadership. His association also gets regular capacity building support from GIZ Germany, Ghana Office and the Ministry of Agriculture (MOFA Ghana). The association has obtained a contractual agreement with a local company that buys their crops. 

Kwesi now only needs to focus on maximizing his profit. He plans to re-invest the profit from his farm for future expansion and payment for his four children currently attending school. He finds it costly to maintain his farms since it is very difficult to finance the cost alone. He has to hire laborers to weed the farm and harvest the crops. He also has to pay for labourers to transport the oranges to sale centre. Without this help, Kwesi's crops would remain in the farm and he would lose income. 

Kwesi hopes to make enough profit on his farms so that he can also see his four younger children through high school and tertiary education. A micro-loan will help him to improve upon his income. Kwesi and his group members are thankful to all their micro-lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: To weed the farm and harvest the crops

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Cándida es una mujer casada, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable, trabajó con su familia en  diferentes negocios donde adquirió experiencia en las ventas. 

Desde hace 9 años inició con una tienda de abarrotes para trabajarla como independiente y  labora 9 horas al día.

Cándida sueña con tener un supermercado a futuro, por lo pronto con el crédito solicitado desea adquirir al por mayor una gran variedad de productos como verduras, granos, frutas, hortalizas etc., y poder brindarle a sus clientes artículos de excelente calidad. 

Con este negocio ha podido salir adelante poco a poco y ha intentado mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Candida is a married woman. She is a very hard-working and very responsible person. She worked with her family in various businesses where she acquired experience in sales.

Nine years ago she set up a grocery store in order to work independently, and she works 9 hours a day.

Candida dreams of having a supermarket in the future. In the meantime, with the loan she has applied for, she wants to acquire a great variety of products wholesale, such as greens, grains, fruits, vegetables, etc., and to be able to offer her customers articles of excellent quality.

With this business, she has been able to get ahead little by little, and she has tried to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to acquire a great variety of products wholesale, such as greens, grains, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 58 years old, married and resident of Oroquieta City, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have 5 children of which, 2 are in school.  

Starting with the capital of 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member in January 2011 and has taken out several loans. All loans were religiously repaid without record of default, up to this day. Now she is applying for 14,900 PHP to buy additional stock for her store to meet her customers' needs. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart and will be fully satisfied if she sees all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store to meet her customers' needs

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 59 years old and lives in Caputol, Aloran, Philippines. She is married with four children. Due to her desire to meet her families’ needs, Paz ventured into retail business. She has had this business for 20 years. 

Recently, she requested a loan to buy sacks of rice and corn for retail. She also wants to add to her inventories of canned goods and other consumable items. Through this, she hopes to increase her income in order to help in the expansion of her business. Paz has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future she dreams of nothing more than having a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and corn for retail

loans.name: Maria Sebastiana

texts.es: Maria de 35 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee desde hace 10 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 35 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. For 10 years she has had a little store located in her residence. She has many customers because of the good prices and the friendliness that she shows when she makes her sales. She is applying for a loan in order to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc., and thus be able to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc., for her store

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion signed up for her membership with Paglaum MPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Concepcion was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Nkunemdea Group

texts.en:
Amadu is a member of Nkunendia Group. All the group members belong to a registered vibrant farming association. Amadu is 45 years old this year, and is happily married with two children, ages 18 and 8. Both of his children are in school. Amadu lives with his family in Abura Koforidua, in the central region of Ghana. 

Amadu has been farming for the past 12 years, and has gained much experience. He grows oranges on ten acres of land. He is also a tailor, and though the tailoring business is doing well, his main source of income is still the farm. Amadu's farming association has obtained a contractual agreement with a local company that purchases the crops for processing into juice. 

He just needs to maximize his profit now, and his only challenge is the difficulty in getting the micro loans from financial institutions locally to finance the costs required to maintain the farm and harvest the crops. In particular, Amadu needs to hire laborers for weeding, harvesting the crops, and transporting them to a sale centre for sale. 

A micro loan will help  Amadu to maintain his farm to increase his profit significantly, and his profits would far exceed the capital he needs to invest in his farm now. Amadu will use the gain from the farm to care for his family, and also help pay the school fees for his children. Amadu and his family thank all their micro-lenders for their generous assistance.

loans.use: To weed the farm and harvest the crops

loans.name: Iris Anabel

texts.es: Iris tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 11 años y 7 años de edad. Iris posee un puesto de elaboración y venta de tortillas el cual le permite percibir los ingresos necesarios para apoyar en la economía de su hogar. Iris ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio dado que desea cubrir una mayor demanda de mercado. Con el monto solicitado comprará maíz al por mayor para prevenir quedarse desabastecida en el futuro.
texts.en: Iris is 28 years old and lives in her own house along with her life companion and their two children, ages 11 and 7. Iris has a stand where she makes and sells tortillas, which allows her to receive the income necessary to support the economy of her household. Iris has made the decision to apply to FUSAI for this loan in order to invest in her business, given that she wants to meet a greater market demand. With the amount that she has applied for, she will buy corn wholesale to prevent being out of stock in the future.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale for her business

loans.name: Jurenda

texts.en:
Jurenda signed up for her membership with Paglaum MPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Jurenda was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Therefore, she recently took a loan to restock her store, with soft drinks, convenience foods, canned goods and medicine. In the future she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with soft drinks, convenience foods, canned goods and medicine

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could get financial assistance for her chosen business. Segundina has maintained her membership in good standing without record of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional hogs for commercial sale and bags of feed for her piglets. Segundina wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. Someday she hopes to repair her house to provide her family a safe and descent living.

loans.use: to purchase additional hogs for commercial sale and bags of feed for her piglets

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is 44 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children who are now adults.

Lucille has a fruit stand for thirteen years to provide support, with her husband who is a security guard. The family earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to purchase a parcel of coco land.

Lucille has been a member of PMPC for almost ten years. In the future, Lucille hopes to expand her fruit vending business.

loans.use: to acquire a parcel of coco land.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a school supplies store in Molave and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed a membership with Paglaum MPC to gain access to capital. She wants to increase her inventory. She obtained a loan to restock school supplies, thread, picture frames, and office supplies. Edna hopes to sustain her business and dreams to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to restock school supplies, thread, picture frames, and office supplies.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is happy to improve their family's living condition. She has profited from selling fruit at the market. She is a proud Paglaum MPC member who owes much to the cooperative with her financial needs. She made her last availment and fully repaid the loan, which she used to renovate her house and beautify her home.

Recently, she received another loan to add inventory to her market stall. She wants to buy kilos of dried fish and fruits to make more profit. Zenaida wants to buy a hauling truck in the near future so she does not have to worry about transporting her stock.

loans.use: to buy kilos of dried fish and fruits.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained money to start a sari-sari store. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Letecia is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities so that she can save and improve their living condition. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is a minimum wage earner. She realized how difficult it is to survive, dependent on her meager salary. She made a side earning, selling dry goods. She can easily bring her stocks to the office and make good sales. Now she wants to expand her business. She applied for a loan to purchase inventory in bulk to increase her income. She doubled her efforts, as her children are growing old and require more financial support for their education. In the future, she hopes to acquire a motor unit for easy transport of her stock.

loans.use: to purchase inventory in bulk.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered such farming activities as growing, caring and harvesting and earning income as well. Jesusa has supported her husband doing this type of work.  As a farmer, Jesusa has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to PMPC for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds, which will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  Someday, Jesusa hopes to purchase more land to cultivate rice that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, which will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose has a sari-sari store built at his own home. But he is always enthusiastic about farming. He has cultivated their rice land in Tudela and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, he applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Jose knows that he has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Jose hopes to buy a hauling truck to easily transport produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Jaime Arturo

texts.es: Jaime de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su esposa, el tiene un taller de carpintería desde hace 25 años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda para la construcción de tres cuartos en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que ganan no le alcanza por esa razón esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de demás ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro, laminas, polines, puertas y pago de mano de obra para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: Jaime, 45, lives in his own house with his wife and three children.  For 25 years he has been running a carpentry shop and earning enough to cover household expenses.  He wants to renovate his home by building on three rooms in the space shown in the photo.  But since he cannot afford to do this with his earnings, he is requesting a loan to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, metal sheeting, beams and doors, as well as pay labor costs.  This is so he and his family can live more safely and comfortably.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, metal sheeting, beams, doors, and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Helmar

texts.en:
Helmar is managing his restaurant business in Molave Z.N, Philippines. He has mastered the business when he and his wife were in their early years of marriage. This has been doing well, supporting the needs of the family. He has local customers and would also accept catering for added income.

Recently, he borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for his eatery business. He wants to expand his business and would be happier to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for his eatery business.

loans.name: Florabel

texts.en:
Florabel is 44 years old and married. She has had a load retailing business in Tudela, Misamis Occidental for five years. It provides a meager income to support their needs. Florabel wants to increase her load inventory so that she can cater to more customers at her cellphone loading station. She requested a loan to pay for her electronic load account.

Florabel has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Florabel hopes to become a wholesaler of load in their town to provide her family a good life.

loans.use: to pay for her electronic load account for retail.

loans.name: Loriana

texts.en: Loriana has mastered her hog raising business in Tudela. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to obtain credit to fully support her business. Just as how she takes care of her hog raising business and so with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run for any financing needs. Now, the loan of PHP 12,000 will help her build concrete pig pens that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build concrete pig pens.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en: In 2012, Arsenia learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives. Arsenia tried her luck at doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Arsenia was loaned another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost.  Arsenia looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita has a papaya fruit farm in Talic, Oroquieta City. This is her primary source of income for her family. Lolita makes it a point to have good land preparation to have the maximum yield and will have a good income. Recently, she needed a loan to pay for irrigation costs for which she was loaned  PHP 14,900 from Paglaum MPC. Lolita wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply papaya fruit in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs for irrigation to soften the tillage pans

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en: Leonardo is a businessman from Molave. He is 62 years old, married and has expertise in selling. He runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports his family. Leonardo is a full-fledged member of Paglaum MPC and has taken several loans already. He maintains his membership in good standing without records of default. Now, he applied for a loan to restock his store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Leonardo continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that he has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for his family.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en: Cerila makes a living through her junk shop business. She runs a junk shop in Molave Z.N, Philippines and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC to gain access to capital. She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she took a loan to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital for her junk shop. Cerila hopes to sustain her business and dreams of sending send all of her  chlidren to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital for her junk shop

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia, 27, is married with four school-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for seven years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the health needs of her children. She is still continuing the business because it provides a good income due to her loyal customers. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her. She already took loans previously to purchase additional stock and now she is applying for a new loan for her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store

loans.name: Jumalene

texts.en:
Jumalene makes a living through her junk shop business. She runs a junk shop in Molave Z.N., Philippines, and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC to gain access to capital. 

She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she availed herself of a loan to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital for her junk shop. Jumalene hopes to sustain her business and dreams to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital for her junk shop

loans.name: Gladis Yrlanda

texts.es:
Gladis es una señora de 49 años, vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima cálido húmedo, un sector muy comercial ya que es la unión entre la sierra y la costa. Gladis actualmente vive con su hijo en una casa arrendada, ya la conocen muchos años en el sector, ella en la avenida principal cuenta con un pequeño local donde por las tardes elabora empanadas, café y corviques, es muy dedicada a su negocio, ya que es su única fuente de ingreso.
Gladis solicita un pequeño crédito para la compra de una nevera muy necesaria para su negocio, ya que sus clientes también le piden colas heladas.  Acudió a Fundación Alternativa por referencias del sector,  la institución pudo ayudar a Gladis una señora muy trabajadora, se siente muy agradecida ya que en otras instituciones no le brindan este gran beneficio de crecer.
texts.en:
Gladis, 49, lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas which is a coastal region city with a warm, humid climate.  The area is very commercial because of its connection between the mountains and the coast.  Gladis currently lives with her son in a rented house and she is well known in the area.  She runs a small stall on the main avenue where she works in the afternoons making meat pastries, fritters and coffee.  She is very dedicated to her business since it is her only source of income.

Gladis is requesting a small loan to buy a refrigerator for her business because her customers also request cold sodas.  She visited Fundación Alternativa through references in the area and the institution was able to help Gladis.  She is a very hard worker and very grateful because other institutions do not offer her this great advantage of expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her food stall so she can offer cold beverages.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie has started her small-time business and became a boss with her sari-sari (variety) store. She has managed to have enough inventory and roll up her capital to gain more profit. Everyday she has made good sales, since she has the only store in her barangay (neighborhood). 

Recently she approached Paglaum for her much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce to have enough inventory and roll up her capital to gain more profit

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion signed up for her membership with Paglaum MPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (variety) store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Concepcion is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is from Molave. He operates a sand and gravel retailing business that sufficiently supports his family. He makes good income, but he wants to expand his business by adding additional inventory. Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase more sand and gravel for resale. 

In the future, Allan wishes to acquire another hauling truck for easy transport of his inventories.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of sand and gravel for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph operates a motor transport business. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

For him to continue his business, he availed himself of a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repair. He dreams to own motor units and be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts/repair

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earns well for her family. As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. In the future, Josefa wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a minimum wage earner in Molave. She makes extra income selling dried fish. She wants to double her income now that her children are growing and she wants to be able to support their educational needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase more kilos of dried fish. She wishes to save her profits to prepare for the college needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en: This is 37-year-old Kadie. She is married and has three children who are 10, 5 and 2 years old. She has two additional dependents to assist her with her business. In 2004, Kadie established her cosmetics business. She began her business just to be self-reliant and to assist her husband in the running of the home. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,126,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Kadie requires a loan to add to her business capital and to buy more cartons of cosmetic items like perfumes, Vaseline, shampoo, styling gel cream etc. for resale. In the future, Kadie plans to expand her business to a large scale, educate her children to higher levels and to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of cosmetic items

loans.name: Markazi Group

texts.en:
Ashura, who is in her late 30s, is married with two children who are still in school.  She has been selling charcoal and is a hair stylist.  She has been in her business for eight years now.  She works from 7 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Ashura's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and to put up a tent and make her hair styling place secure. She dreams of improving her life style and to send her kids to good schools.

Ashura will share this loan with her loan group "MARKAZI", which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and to put up a tent and make her hair styling place secure.

loans.name: Karoti Group

texts.en:
Anna, who is in her early 40s, is single with four children who are still at school. She has been a food vendor for seven years now. She works from 1 p.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Anna's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and stated selling soft drinks. She is doing fine with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to increase her mamalishe (cafe) stock and to buy soft drinks. She dreams of owning a retail shop.

Anna will share this loan with her loan group, "Karoti," which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase mamalishe (cafe) stock and to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Iringa Group

texts.en:
Rukia, who is in her late 30s, is single with three children who are still in school. She has been running a beauty salon for 15 years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rukia's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy salon equipment and has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, reinvest in the business and covered household expenses. She normally has a challenge of electricity. 

She will use this loan to buy salon products according to her customers' requirements. She dreams of making her salon classic.

Rukia will share this loan with her loan group, "Iringa," which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon products according to her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Zoltan

texts.en:
Zoltan is divorced. He has two sons from his first marriage. Zoltan has had his own business for seven years. 

Zoltan does car repairs. He is a good specialist. Zoltan has many repeat clients. He used to have a garage in his previous house, but after the divorce, Zoltan left the house to his ex-wife and children. Lately, he has been renting a garage for his car-repair business. 

Zoltan is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to build a garage at his new house. He will not need to pay for rent. Zoltan can use the additional income for his new family needs.

loans.use: to build a new garage

loans.name: Nhóm 03 - Đồng Bèo - Đồng Tiến - Triệu Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thế works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Thế has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thế faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

Thế is 62 years old, and she is married with four children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the Nhóm 03 - Đồng Bèo - Đồng Tiến solidarity group. 

In 2013, Thế joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thế has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

With her business profit, Thế hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis, who is in his early 30s, is married with two kid; one of them is in school, and the other one is still small. He has been running a retail shop for eight years now. He works from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Denis' second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase the shop inventory and has paid back his loan successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses. He will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in the shop inventory. He dreams of owning a hardware shop.

Denis will make sure that he pays back the loan on time.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in the shop inventory.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca se dedica desde hace 25 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su madre en casa propia, con lo que vende logra salir adelante, Blanca está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
For 25 years Blanca has worked in agriculture, growing corn and beans.  She sells her products at the different markets near her home where she lives with her mother.  She is able to earn enough to get ahead.  

Blanca is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, insecticides, etc. and improve her land which is shown in the photo.  She wants to be able to continue her work and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, insecticides, etc. and improve her land.

loans.name: Genera

texts.en:
Genera is 47 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Genera is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Genera has been pig fattening for four years and earns additional income from buy and sell of dried fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Imelda has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Imelda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jacinta works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines and earns additional income from motorcycle transport services and raising chickens. Jacinta is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

Jacinta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jeremy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jeremy works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising goats and selling vegetables. Jeremy is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jeremy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Norita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Norita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending and raising goats. Norita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional rice grains to sell.

Norita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional rice grains to sell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Teodora works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store and goat raising. Teodora is borrowing PHP 16,500 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Teodora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 24 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, eggs, noodles, milk, sugar, etc.

Rowena has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and earns an income from buying and selling rice grains.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, eggs, noodles, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of hollow blocks business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming vegetables.  Yolanda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of cement, sand, gravel and other materials for her buy and sell of hollow blocks business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cement, sand, gravels and other materials

loans.name: Las Frutillitas Group

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 38 años de edad, soltera, tiene dos hijos de diez y catorce años, y su negocio es la venta de frutillas por mayor.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, buena madre, constante, luchadora, y trabajadora, su trabajo lo realiza en la zona de ‘la ramada’ caracterizado por el comercio de mercadería al por mayor y en grandes cantidades, Allí acuden generalmente los intermediarios y distribuidores a comprar en cantidad los productos que después han de revender a otros comerciantes, a precios mayores y caprichosamente elevados.
Juana es de tez morena,  cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el guaraní que ya no utiliza y habla español debido al comercio en la ciudad (al centro, blusa lila a rayas, pantalón negro). Su vida la realiza independientemente junto a sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa de ladrillo alquilada que cuenta con luz y agua. Su necesidad por ampliar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa, venta de fruta, venta de tomates, taller de costura, tejidos, venta de pescado y servicio de construcción, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de frutillas por mayor, los productores del campo llegan hasta su lugar de venta a entregarle grandes cantidades de frutillas que ella almacena y vende al por mayor. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en ocho años de experiencia que viene realizando esta actividad. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio realizando ‘pasas de frutilla’, ella piensa que será un negocio próspero porque sus clientes le exigen el producto y antes de producir ya cuenta con varios pedidos.
Es por esos motivos que Juana solicita un préstamo para ampliar su negocio con la elaboración de pasas de frutilla y complacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana is a 38 year old single woman. She has two children who are ten and fourteen years old and works selling strawberries in bulk. 

Juana is enterprising, independent, a good mother, tenacious, courageous and hardworking. She works in the 'la ramada' zone, which is known for its sale of merchandise in bulk and in large quantities. There they generally welcome the intermediaries and distributors who buy their products in bulk and then resell them to other vendors at higher and unreasonably elevated prices.

Juana has dark skin, long black hair and is average height (standing in the middle in a striped purple blouse and black pants). Her native language is guarani which she no longer uses; instead she speaks Spanish due to her work in the city. She lives independently with her children who go to school. They live in a rented brick house which has electricity and water.

To expand her business, Juana formed a group of people so she could apply for a loan and improve her business. The group run businesses such as selling clothing, fruit, tomatoes, knitted items and fish; running a sewing workshop, a clothing workshop and a construction service

Juana sells strawberries in bulk. The fieldworkers come to her selling point to deliver great quantities of strawberries which she displays and sells in large quantities. This is her second loan cycle with the institution after eight years of experience in the business. Her dream is to expand her business by making strawberry desserts. She thinks it will be a prosperous business because her customers are asking her for this dish and without having made anything she already has some orders. This is why Juana is applying for a loan to expand her business: so she can make strawberry desserts to please her customers.

loans.use: to expand her store by making strawberry desserts to please her customers

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Lourdes has been in this business for nine years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Butanuka Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Butanuka est fait de 37 membres .C’est un groupe de Bubanza.  Joséphine est exclue du groupe  par les membres, après la prise de photo. Sur la photo, c’est la  première femme de la première rangée, en comptant de gauche à droite.
Elie est le représentant du groupe. Il a 33 ans et est mariée à Joséphine, un infirmier. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 2 à 14 ans, dont  4 étudient.
 
Il fait le commerce de l’huile de palme  depuis  15 ans. 

Il est à  son troisième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’huile de palme à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
The Butanuka group from Bubanza, Burundi has 37 members. Joséphine is pictured in the photo, but is no longer part of the group. She is the first woman on the left in the front row. 

Elie is the group representative. He is 33 years old and married to Joséphine, a nurse. Together, they have five children between the ages of two and 14. Four of them go to school. 
 
He has been selling palm oil for 15 years. This is his third loan with Turame. With his Kiva credit, he will increase his capital and buy a large amount of palm oil that he will resell in order to earn more.

In the next few years, he would like to see his children go to school.

loans.use: increase his capital and buy a large amount of palm oil that he will resell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Kutsikivi Group

texts.fr:
André fait partie du groupe  Kutsikivi  et  habite à  Bubanza. Il a 32ans et est marié  à Espérance, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 3 à 8 ans, dont  1 étudie.
 
Il fait le commerce de l’huile de palme  depuis  6 ans. 

Il est à  son  deuxième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de noix de palme pour  les transformer en huile de palme, à vendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  avoir une boutique et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
André is a member of the Kutsikivi group who lives in Bubanza. He is 32 years old and is married to Espérance, a farmer. Together, they have three children between the ages of three and eight. One of their children goes to school. 

He has been selling palm oil for six years. 

This is his second loan with Turame. With his Kiva credit, he would like to increase his capital and buy a large amount of palm fruit that he can use to make palm oil. He will then sell the oil to earn more. 

In the next few years, he would like to have a boutique and see his children go to school.

loans.use: increase his capital and buy a large amount of palm fruit that he can use to make palm oil. He will then sell the oil to earn more.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Sonia de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor, ella se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de pupusas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, Sonia esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, frijol, chicharrón, quesillo, etc. para poder continuar con la elaboración de las pupusas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sonia is 38 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her husband, a farmer. For two years, Sonia has made a living selling "pupusas" (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans). She runs her business out of her home and has many customers. Sonia is applying for a loan in order to buy corn, beans, pork rinds, fresh cheese and more. With these items she can continue making "pupusas", earn a higher income and enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, pork rinds, fresh cheese and more.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 41 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Juditha has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 21 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Carol has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Carol aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 49 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Sylvia has been in this business for six years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Charry

texts.en:
Charry is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. Charry earns more income from buying and selling fish. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her fishing business. Charry has been in this business for 10 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. Charry has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna is 56 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living from pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Digna is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Digna has been in pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 47 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Melinda has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from farming rice and fishing.

Melinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Rawya

texts.en:
Rawya is 29 years old and married. She lives in Jinen city with her small family. She has three sons who attend the primary school. 

One year ago, Rawya initiated raising sheep in her own yard to sell its products in the local market. It is a good business but still needs a lot of improvement.
 
She asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy more goats and food for them. This will increase her income, which will help her to improve the financial conditions for her family.
 
Rawya is very grateful to everyone who helps her, and the one who appears on the photo is her husband. For cultural reasons she can’t publish her photos online, so she apologizes.

loans.use: to buy more goats and food for them.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher, 19, is a single man from Khan Younis. His father is an employee in the public sector with a low income. This is the family's only source of income. Maher is a Business Administration student. He wants to earn his BA degree and find a job in the future to help his family with part of their expenses.

Maher took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him to read online articles and write reports more easily. 

Maher appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials to be used for her vulcanizing shop business. She has been in this business for 10 years and also earns more income from rice farming.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials to be used for her vulcanizing shop business.

loans.name: Aisa Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Aisa Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and raising pigs. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to weave for her business.

Aisa Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to weave

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
As a married parent with children, Florita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Florita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of seaweed to sell for her business.

Florita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of seaweed to sell for her business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is single and 28 years old, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables  in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending, raising pigs and operating a general store.  Amelita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell in her vegetable business.  She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Amelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her businesses to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, sugar, soap, soy sauce, noodles, and other products

loans.name: Ametes

texts.en:
Ametes, 42, is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ametes has a business direct selling Avon, Natasha and Personal Collection products in the Philippines. Ametes requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more products from Avon, Natasha and Personal Collection to sell to her customers.

Ametes has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ametes would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon, Natasha and Personal Collection to sell to her customers

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi  équitablement composé de monogames et polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sabalibougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’encens, des tubercules et habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Haya (femme assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande renommée dans la vente des encens de qualité dans tout quartier. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5kg de magnonkissèni, 3 cartons d’eau de Cologne et 7 bouteilles de parfums de qualité à Bamako. Pour faire de l’encens, on imbibe le magnonkissèni dans l’eau de Cologne pendant au moins 2 semaines puis on l’assaisonne avec des parfums. Ce produit ainsi obtenu avec des odeurs impeccables est prête à la vente en détails et à crédits à Sabalibougou à clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Haya espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif de maintenir cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’avoir beaucoup plus d’argent.
texts.en:
The Benkadi Group is made up of equal numbers of women who belong to monogamous and polygamous families. A group member's average age is 39 and each woman has four children on average. They all live in Sabalibougou, one of the districts of Bamako. They all know each other through their local community. Group members earn a living through selling incense, tubers and clothing. In order to increase their working capital, the members of this group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This will be their third group loan.

Haya, the woman sitting second from the left in the photo, is very well-known throughout the district for selling quality incense. She plans on using this loan to purchase five kilograms of magnonkissèni (the seeds of a wild plant), three boxes of eau de Cologne and seven bottles of quality perfume from Bamako. In order to create this incense, the magnonkissèni seeds are soaked in the eau de Cologne for at least two weeks before being imbued with the perfumes. Once the product has taken on these impeccable odours, it is ready to be sold in exchange for credit in Sabalibougou to a female-majority customer base. With this loan, Haya hopes to make an average monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested back into her business. Her aim is to continue this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso so that she can earn an even higher income.

loans.use: to purchase the base materials for making incense

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is 25 years old. He lives with his parents in Gaza.

Mustafa asking Ryada for this loan to buy flagstones to pave his house and install plumbing and electricity. He wants to help his family with this loan to improve the house after the last war at Gaza and make it better, which will enable them to live in it with more psychological comfort.

He has a shortage of money to buy the things he needs and help his parents. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to improve his house and install plumbing and electricity.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 35-year-old married woman from Khan Younis. She lives with her husband and four kids, two of whom are sons and the other two are daughters.

Her husband was an employee in the public sector, but a few years ago he retired.  He opened a workshop for repairing bicycles in the city. It is a good business, and provides the family with a good income. 

Lina and her husband would like to improve the workshop and expand it in the future.  Lina took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more repair parts for her husband's bicycle workshop. This will increase the workshop's productivity and also its income. 

Lina appears in the photo in the bicycle workshop

loans.use: to buy more repair parts for her husband's bicycle workshop.

loans.name: Elfha

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elfha works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Elfha is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy seaweed to sell for her business.

Elfha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seaweed to sell for her business

loans.name: Vivi Sandra

texts.en:
Vivi Sandra is 35 years old and married with four children, and she works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Vivi Sandra has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

Vivi Sandra aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is 39 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Anabella works very hard to provide for them.

Anabella runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, etc.  

Anabella requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, etc. to sell.

In the future, Anabella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Al- Omr4 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Omr 4, and consists of four women who are all hardworking. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 80,000 YER. 

Ilham is 36 years old and a single woman. She is an educated woman, with an elementary education. She has a strong determination to improve the standards of her living. She said she had a small amount of money which she saved up herself. Ilham invested that money in her own business. She has started her business two years ago, selling makeup and accessories in order to help her father in the expenses of the family. She sees this business as a profitable for her. 

For further expanding, Ilham requested a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more accessories, makeup, and cosmetics to sell to the women in her area.

Ilham expects a boost in her income. She looks forward to expanding her business through selling more accessories, makeup, and ready-to-wear women's clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories, makeup, and cosmetics

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 35 years old and single.

Analy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Analy has been in pig fattening for three years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Analy requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Analy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Al-Nakous3 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Nakous3. It consists of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Fahmia is the leader of the group. She is a 42-year-old married woman, living with her family in a poor area in Hodeidah city. She has an elementary school education. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. Over time, he became unable to look after his family. Fahmia decided to help him in that responsibility by selling women's and children's clothes and shoes door-to-door. She started this business more than nine years ago. Her profits from that business are very limited and she wants to increase it, but she doesn't have enough money to do. 

For this reason, Fahmia asked a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more stylish ready-made women's and children's clothes and shoes for customers.

Fahmia looks forward to expanding her business more by opening a large shop to sell all stylish clothes, shoes, and different kinds of cosmetics and accessories.

loans.use: to purchase more stylish ready-made women's and children's clothes and shoes

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en:
Natasha has a lovely clothing store in Beer Sheva. She is well known and has always had a steady business. Unfortunately with the conflict over the summer, the rockets from Gaza and Operation Protective Edge, her store was barely operational all summer and therefore she has minimal income. While she was able to keep up with her day-to-day expenses from savings, Natasha was unable to raise funds for future investment in her store.

She needs this loan to pay for fall and winter stock, without which she would have little to sell.

Natasha does not invest in advertising but knows she must establish an Internet and Facebook presence. She hopes one day to incorporate these marketing tools and even sell online if another conflict should rage in the region.

loans.use: to assist in paying for fall and winter stock.

loans.name: Diaa

texts.en:
Diaa is a 22-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. His father works as an employee in the public sector, with a low income. This income is barely covering all the family needs. 

Diaa started his own business one year ago to help his father in part of the family expenses. He opened a workshop for painting and repairing rickshaws.

Diaa requests a loan for improve his workshop and buying some necessary repair parts. This will increase his productivity, and also the income.

Diaa appears in the photo

loans.use: to improve the workshop and buy some necessary repair parts

loans.name: Esteban Hildemaro

texts.es:
Esteban es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde hace algún tiempo trabaja brindando servicio de taxi con un vehículo de su hermano, con esos ingresos a poya a su familia en los gastos del hogar porque quiere mejorar su calidad de vida. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar una profesión porque no tenían suficiente economía en su hogar, pero él lo toma como una experiencia que no todo es fácil en esta vida, por eso se siente muy contento ya que con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y por sus propios medios.
Esteban está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá realizar la conversión de su vehículo de gasolina a gas natural, con esto no gastará tanto en combustible y así más adelante podrá empezar a construir su propia casa para mayor tranquilidad y comodidad.
texts.en:
Esteban is a young man with great desire to get ahead. For some time he has worked offering a taxi service with his brother's vehicle. With this income, he supports his family in the household expenses because he wants to improve their quality of life. Unfortunately, he could not study for a professional degree because there weren't sufficient economic resources in his home, but he took it as a learning experience that not everything is easy in life. So, he feels very happy since with a lot of effort, he is getting ahead by his own means.  

Esteban is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the support they have offered him, he will be able to convert his vehicle from gasoline to natural gas. With this, he won't spend so much on gas, and in the future he will be able to begin to build his own house to for greater peace and comfort.

loans.use: to convert his vehicle to natural gas.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, 28, is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Analiza has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. 

Analiza requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 31 years old and married. She has six children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from buying and selling recyclable materials. 

Analyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Al-Waseem Group

texts.en:
Al-Waseem is the same group which applied for the first loan from Kiva lenders. All the members of this group applied for a second loan of 170,000 YER from Kiva lenders to improve the condition of their families more.

Elham is the same leader of the group. She applied for the first loan from Kiva lenders to purchase an amount of incense and perfume to improve her business more. The first loan helped her very much in increasing her business more, but she can't meet all the demands of her customers. 

Specifically, Elham didn't finish the repayment of the installments of the first loan and applied for a concurrent loan of 40,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase another amount of incense and perfumes to increase her business and to be able to meet all the demands of her customers. 

All the members of this group thank warmly Kiva lenders for their first loan, and hope to be financed in this loan, too.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfume

loans.name: Riquelme David

texts.es:
Riquelme es un señor de 45 años, vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos. Es un señor muy trabajador, en su juventud vivía en la costa donde pescaba y vendía marisco, luego se radicó en Santo Domingo a seguir con esta actividad ya que le contaron que  es un mercado muy bueno, y fue así ahora ya lleva 10 años radicado en esta ciudad donde ha prosperado, ya que poco a poco pudo construir su vivienda propia. Riquelme comenta que su vida ha sido muy dura, ha trabajado mucho para tener lo poco que ahora tiene, por eso también se dedica a la compra y venta de chanchos, viaja a una ciudad cercana a comprarlos en la feria, los tiene unos días y los vende.
Riquelme es un cliente fidelizado con la institución, este es su segundo crédito, se siente muy feliz ya que gracias al primero él pudo ponerse un negocio de pollos, ahora cuenta con más trabajo pero está feliz ya que es algo que le gusta.
Se siente enormemente agradecido con la institución por ayudar a los pequeños comerciantes con él a superarse.
texts.en:
Riquelme is 45 years old and he lives with his wife and their three children. He is a very hard-working man. In his youth, he lived on the coast where he fished and sold seafood. Later he moved to Santo Domingo to continue with this work since he had been told there was a very good market there. And, so it is that he has now lived in this city for 10 years, where he has prospered, since he could build his own house little by little. Riquelme states that his life has been very hard; he has worked a lot in order to have the little that he has now.  For this reason, he also works buying and selling pigs. He travels to a nearby city to buy them at the fair, he keeps them for some time, and he sells them.

Riquelme is a return borrower of this institution. This is his second loan. He is happy because, thanks to the first, he could start a chicken business. Now he has more work but he is happy because it is something he likes. 

He is enormously grateful with the institution for helping small businessmen with what they need to improve themselves.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to diversify his business and continue getting training to develop himself professionally.

loans.name: Badea

texts.en:
Badea is a 30-year-old married man, and a father of only one child, living with his family in a rented house Sana'a city, Yemen. He is from a poor family which lives in very hard conditions. 

In order to improve the living conditions of his family, Badea decided to start his own business, selling many kinds of simple foods materials, spices, and other items in a small grocery. His capital still is small. For this reason, he can't meet all the demands of his customers. 

Badea wants to enlarge his business more, but he doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase many different kinds of food materials, goods, and other items to be able to meet all the demands of his customers that will help him in providing his family with the necessary needs. 

Badea looks forward to expanding his business more by opening other branches inside the capital city of Sana'a in order to be able to provide his family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase many different kinds of food materials, goods and other items

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is 67 years old, and he lives with his sons in Gaza. He has been working at a dry clean shop.  

His house was affected by the last war at Gaza, and his house was partly destroyed, so he applied for a loan to rebuild the bathroom and the kitchen and paint the house again. 

He hopes to be able to provide his family the best life conditions. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to rebuild the bathroom and the kitchen and paint the house again.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 40 years old and married with one child. With her child currently in school, Araceli works very hard to provide for the family.

Araceli runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, candies, beers, bread, noodles, etc. 

Araceli requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like soft drinks, canned goods, candies, beers, bread, noodles, etc. to sell.

Araceli would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like soft drinks, canned goods, candies, beers, bread, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
A married father of two children, Sopheap is age 32 and living in a rural village of the Siem Reap district, Cambodia. 

To support his family, he and his wife grow vegetables as the main source of family’s income and they have been in this business for several years.

Sopheap is in his first cycle with VisionFund. Now he is applying for a loan to pay for his tuition fee at university. He hopes to get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee at university.

location.town: Siem Reap district, Siem Reap province

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Korng Pisey district of Kampong Speu province, Sokha is a 49-year-old mother of three children.
