Rice farming has been the only source for her family’s income to make a living for several years. The current business earns her about US $12 per day.

Sokha has been with VisionFund for three cycles and now she is applying for a loan to pay for her son’s tuition fee at university. She hopes to keep him there until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition fee at university.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.en:
Vasiliy is 31 years old. He is married and has two children. Vasiliy has his own business.

Vasiliy grows early and late vegetables in greenhouses. He has been in this business for 12 years. Vasiliy is a hardworking man, full of energy and takes good care of his family.

Vasiliy is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to build new greenhouses and install a heating system. The loan will help Vasiliy to get ready for the new season.

loans.use: to build new greenhouses and install a heating system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restock hair ties and ribbons and affordable children’s clothing pieces.

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en:
Tariq is a 22 year old, young man living in Irbid-Jordan. He lives with his family that consists of eight members. 

He is a university student majoring in Graphic Design, and he is in his third year. His aim is to start depending on himself after getting his Bachelors' by finding a job in his field. 

Now he is applying for this loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his study fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Aracili

texts.en:
Aracille is 35 years old and has six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Aracille operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years. 

Aracille requested another loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional items such as bread, canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as bread, canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a hardworking entrepreneur who operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She earns additional income from selling vegetables and other food items. 

Beatriz requested a loan from NWTF for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 39 years old, married, and has two children. She is from Dulag, Leyte. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store, which she has been doing for six years. She sells basic commodities such as rice, cooking oil, canned goods, soap, seasonings, and soft drink. 

Jocelyn requested a loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stocks such as rice, toiletries, beverages, and seasonings. This loan will help Jocelyn and her family improve their standard of living, providing her family with good food and quality education for her children. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, toiletries, beverages, and seasonings

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 64-year-old woman with five adult children. 

She has been a member in good standing of PMPC for four years. She is very hardworking and has always been known to provide the best for her family. She has been a farmer for 20 years and plants rice. Their monthly income is 8,000. 

She wants to increase sales and has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and other items so that she can continue to put bread on the table.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Cirinia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Cirinia works hard to support her family.

She has a sinamay (a way of weaving banana-plant fibers) weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Cirinia is borrowing 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her weaving business.

Cirinia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Mutasem

texts.en:
Mutasem is a 21-year-old university student majoring in accounting, and he is in his first year. He lives with his family that consists of five members in Irbid, Jordan. 

Mutasem is seeking to continue his studies and find a job in his field after graduating. 

Now he is applying for this loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay his university fees

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: Doña Maria Ester, esta solicitando su quinto crédito para invertirlo en su negocio de venta de Ropa Usada, ya que en estos meses de Noviembre y Diciembre incrementan los costos de venta y así aprovecha compran antes para mantener precio para sus clientes exclusivos, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para los gastos del hogar ya que tiene dos hijos que asisten al colegio y su mayor sueño es que culminen una carrera profesional ya que ella por sus recursos económicos no pudo lograrlo, Agradece la confianza que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado a pesar de ser una pequeña comerciante.
texts.en:
Maria Ester is requesting her sixth loan. She will use it to invest in her used clothing business. She wants to be prepared and buy merchandise before the prices rise during the months of November and December, in order to continue to offer her fixed customers good prices.

Her husband helps her to cover the home expenses. They have two children that go to school and her dream is to help them become professionals, something she could not do herself. She wants to thank Kiva and Afodenic for trusting her despite being a micro entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Rhyme Rose

texts.en:
Rhyme Rose, from Calabayan, Ozamis City, is still single. She has been operating her cosmetic sales for many years and is able to sustain the business. She supported her family and bought some home improvements for a comfortable living. She repaid successfully her previous loan used for the business. 

She is now aiming for an increase of sales, and for this purpose, she took a new loan to purchase more cosmetic products to expand her product offering, in addition to her inventory capital. She is hoping to cater to the needs of her customers and increase her income as well.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic products to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 47 years old and married with six children.

Dolores works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like fabric conditioner, sugar, coffee, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, etc., to sell.

Dolores has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from making broom sticks.

Dolores aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like fabric conditioner, sugar, coffee, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, etc., to sell

loans.name: Elgie

texts.en:
Elgie works hard to support her family. Elgie is married and has an abaca (banana plant fiber) weaving business in the Philippines.

Elgie requested a 23,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials like abaca fiber, etc., for her business.

Elgie has been in this business for five years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Elgie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials like abaca fiber, etc., for her business

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 42 years old and married. 

Flora is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Flora requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Flora has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Flora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Florame

texts.en:
Florame is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Florame is 32 years old, and both children are in school.

Florame has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Florame requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional piglet, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Florame has been in this business for one year. In the future, Florame would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional piglet, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 36 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Elvira works very hard to provide for them.

Elvira runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Elvira has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, shampoo, hair conditioner, sanitary pads, cooking oil, etc. 

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with eight children and resides in Ozamiz City with her family. She has been selling her delicious ice cream for many years. She was able to sustain their living with her income and has successfully repaid her previous loan used in buying ingredients. Her children are still studying, and she was able to finance their daily needs and education expenses with her profit. 

She took a new loan recently to purchase more ingredients to prepare ice cream to sell. She is planning to buy an additional cart to be used for selling ice cream as an expansion of her business. She wants to have a stable and sustainable income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to prepare ice cream to sell

loans.name: Jovielyn

texts.en:
Jovielyn,  29, is a merchant selling rtw (ready to wear) items like pants, shorts, t-shirts, dresses and jeans. She is also engaged in buying and selling of school bags. She has been in that kind of business for a year now. Together with her family, she lives in Dulag, Leyte. She has six children; the oldest is 10 and the youngest is 1 year old. Jovielyn  has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy a variety of pants, t-shirts, dresses and bags. She can now cater to her customers' needs well and hopefully improve her earnings.
 
Jovielyn  hopes to have a stable income that would help her send her children to school for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of pants, t-shirts, dresses and bags

loans.name: Emmalyn

texts.en:
Emmalyn is 24 years old and married with three children.

Emmalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Emmalyn has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Emmalyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Flodelisa

texts.en:
Flodelisa is 32 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Flodelisa works very hard to provide for them.

Flodelisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Flodelisa has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as seasonings, cereals, coffee, sugar, candies, canned goods, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, Flodelisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda is 38 years old and has one child. Florinda is married, and her child is currently in school.

Florinda is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Florinda requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Florinda has been in pig fattening for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Florinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Geneveve

texts.en: Geneveve is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now. Geneveve requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. In the future, Geneveve would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gina is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Gina has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jenita

texts.en:
Jenita is 40 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

Jenita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jenita has been in this business for 29 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Jenita requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Jenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin, who is 58 years old, lives in a community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. He has one dependent child and two married children. 

To make a living, he operates and manages a rice farming business on rice farmland which is located near his house. He has been in this career for fourteen years. On average, he can generate earnings of USD 5.00 per day. 

Sarin wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL, with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru: Ирина, 46 лет, замужем, есть дочь, которая активно помогает матери по хозяйству. У Ирины - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2002 году. Целеустремленность и упорный труд позволили Ирине развить свое хозяйство до 1 коровы, 2 бычков, 1 теленка, 3 овец и 9 свиней. Также есть пасика, а на арендованной земле Ирина сеет ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет 25,000 сом (KGS). Ирина в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на постройку большого дома.
texts.en: Irina is 46 years old, married, and has  a daughter, who actively helps her mother on the  farm. Irina has finished a technical college. As a main source of income for her family, she raises livestock, having launched this business in 2002. Irina’s persistence and hard work have allowed her to keep developing her farm; at present she has one cow, two bulls, one calf, three sheep and nine pigs. She also has a bee yard, and grows barley on a leased land plot. Her monthly income is 25,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Irina has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 150,000 KGS to buy livestock and increase her headcount. She plans to invest the resulting revenue in an additional livestock increase. She also plans to save up for building a large house.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase the headcount.

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth is a married woman with four children. She is 45 years old and three of her children are currently in school.

Jeneth is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jeneth requested a 14000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business.

Jeneth has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jeneth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Junecelinda

texts.en:
Junecelinda works hard to support her family. Junecelinda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Junecelinda has been in this business for 4 years now.

Junecelinda requested a 12000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like seasonings, spices, meat, hotdogs, etc. for her food vending business.

Junecelinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like seasonings, spices, meat, hotdogs, etc. for her food vending business.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a 49-year-old married woman and from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in the rice retail business for more than three years now. She also makes an additional income from sugar cane farming.
 
As of this time, Chona needs a loan for her the expansion of her ventures. She is asking for a loan to buy more rice to sell, as well as fertilizer for the sugarcane. With this, she will be able to improve her rice stocks and the productivity of her sugar cane farm.

In the future, Chona hopes to make her business more stable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell, as well as fertilizer for her sugarcane.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evangeline is 35 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Evangeline has a food vending business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Evangeline has been in this business for 4 years. Evangeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 34 years old and married. Jovelyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Jovelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, sanitary pads, juice, etc. to sell. Jovelyn has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items in her store.

In the future, Jovelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, sanitary pads, juice, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Thinh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thinh, born in 1977, is a Thai ethnic person. She lives with her husband and her two children in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s income comes from cultivation and breeding. The annual income from cultivation and breeding also helps her family cover the living costs and pay one part of her children’s education costs. However, her two children are at important schooling levels - one in high school and one in grade 6 - so she is having difficulty covering all education costs for them. Therefore, she really wants to borrow a loan to invest in her children’s education.

She expects the loan will help her children have good conditions for studying and her children will study hard to get good results in order to have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to invest in her children’s education.

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan, born in 1983, is the Kinh person. She currently lives with her husband and her two children in Mai Son district, Son La province. She is the youngest member of the cluster, but she always strictly observes the rules of the program.

Her family is breeding geese and chickens, and growing maize plants on the family’s land in a small scale. Because her two young children are at school so most of her income is invested in their education, she needs to borrow a loan to invest in the breeding.

She expects the loan will help her family invest effectively in breeding, and her family will gain more profit and thus their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to invest in the breeding of geese and chickens.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 61 years old and married with two children.

Laura works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Laura has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 29 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Laura aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 60 years old and married with six children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Lucita has been in pig fattening for 20 years now and has borrowed from NWTF 5 times in the past to sustain it.

Lucita has requested a 11000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ainur

texts.ru: Айнур 41 год, замужем, мать 3 детей. Образование у Айнур средне-специальное, уже 7 лет занимается животноводством, развитие своего бизнеса Айнур начала с 5,000 сомов (KGS). Сегодня, благодаря ее ответственности и трудолюбию у нее в хозяйстве есть уже 2 коровы, 1 теленок и 20 овец. Все условия для содержания скота имеются.  Ежемесячный доход доходит до 12,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнур обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом на покупку двух коров для увеличения поголовья скота, также для увеличения ежемесячного дохода от продажи молочных продуктов. Доходы от кредита Айнур планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на расширение сарая и постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Ainur is 41, married, and the mother of three children. She has a vocational education and has been raising livestock for seven years already. She started her business with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her sense of responsibility and hard work, she currently has two cows, a calf, and 20 sheep. She has all of the necessary things to care for livestock and earns up to 12,000 som (KGS). In order to expand her business in the future, Ainur applied for a loan with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy two cows to increase her livestock numbers and her income from dairy sales. She plans to use the profits to invest in additional livestock and save money to build a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and increase the number of livestock

loans.name: Roxana Jeannette

texts.es:
Roxana de 39 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, estudio hasta bachillerato, estuvo acompañada pero su pareja falleció, actualmente vive sola en su casa y nadie depende de ella.

Roxana es comerciante, inicio trabajando para una empresa que vende suplementos nutritivos, ella trabajo como vendedora y todavía se relaciona con dicha empresa. Tiene casi 5  años de haber iniciado una tienda en su casa y la ha administrado ella misma con ayuda de su fallecida pareja. Hace dos años se graduó de un curso de panadería impartido en la alcaldía de su comunidad y meses después compro su horno y hasta hoy en día vende su producto en todo el municipio.

El préstamo que solicita será invertido en su tienda, comprará granos básicos, condimentos y productos de cocina, artículos de higiene personal, golosinas y bebidas para mantener abastecida su tienda para satisfacer la demanda de productos y mantener satisfechos a sus clientes.

Roxana le ve buen futuro a la elaboración y venta de su pan, por lo que sueña con tener una panadería estable y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roxana is 39 years old, is single, and has no children.  She studied through high school.  She was in a committed relationship but her partner died. Currently she lives alone in her own home and no one depends on her. 

Roxana is a business woman.  She began working for a business that sells nutritional supplements.  She worked as a saleswoman and she still collaborates with that business.  She began her own store in her home five years ago, and she has managed it herself and also had the help of her partner who has since deceased.  Two years ago she completed a degree in bread-making offered through the local government in her town and a few months later she purchased an oven and currently she is selling bread products throughout the city. 

She is requesting a loan in order to invest in her store.  She will buy basic grains, condiments, and products for baking, articles for personal hygiene, candies, and drinks in order to keep her store supplied so that she can satisfy customer demands and keep her clients happy. 

Roxana sees a positive future in the making and selling of bread, which is why she dreams of having a bread shop that is stable and capable of improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, condiments, and products for baking, articles for personal hygiene, candies, and drinks in order to keep her store supplied

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thu, born in 1972, is a Kinh person. She lives with her family in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family consists of 5 members, including her and her husband, her daughter, her son, and her daughter-in-law.

Her family’s main occupation is small business and livestock breeding, so the income is just temporary subsistence for food and saving a small amount. But, her little daughter is always sick, which influences her studies, so she needs to borrow a loan to cover her daughter’s medical care.

She hopes that the loan she will borrow can help her daughter get timely medical care and her daughter will be better to go to school and learn well.

loans.use: to cover her daughter’s medical care.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio is 59 years old and single. He is a fisherman from Dulag, Leyte. He catches and sells fish to the locals in the community, which he has been doing for almost five years. 

Because he has no capital to improve and continue his fishing livelihood, Julio requested a loan for 15,000 PHP, which he will use to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, weights, and floater. These materials are very helpful in generating more catch, which would help defray his daily expenses.  In the future, Julio hopes to expand his fishing business for sustainable livelihood and set aside some savings for his old age.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as fishing net, weights, and floater

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en: Maylinda, 36, is married and lives in Ormoc, Leyte. She has two children aged 10 and 8, and earns a living by raising hogs. She has been in this line of work for more than three years, and is hardworking because she wants to give her best to support her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more piglets to raise as well as animal feed and supplements for them to eat. This loan will allow Maylinda to improve her business and increase her income. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise, animal feed and various supplements.

loans.name: Jezreel

texts.en:
Jezreel, 25, and is single and residing in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She works in a private company to earn income to support her family and dreams of having her own savings for her future. She studied well, with the help of her uncle, until she finished school and become successful with her work.

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit for the purpose of paying her brother's tuition fees. She wants to share the blessings that she had with her family so that they will receive the goodness of success that her family wants.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for her brother.

loans.name: Marcelyn

texts.en:
Marcelyn is 47 years old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, Marcelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marcelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, beers, candies, diapers, seasonings, cereals, noodles, cooking oil, etc. 

Marcelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marilie

texts.en: Marilie is 43 years old, married and the mother of three children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a loan for PHP 15000 from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her herd. She has been in this line of work for 17 years and also earns additional income by selling food. She is working tirelessly to achieve her dream: save enough to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to assist with buying out her partner, to purchase cloth bases for head coverings and to increase stock.

loans.name: Laicheng

texts.en:
Laicheng, 43, is married with three children. Her family lives in a house with thatched roof, located in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district. The main sources of her family’s income are from growing rice, cassava, and rubber. She has been running her business for 10 years, earning about 12.00 USD per day. She is able to save about 6.00 USD each day. 

This is the second loan for Laicheng with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to pay for her daughter’s tuition fees to study Accounting. She hopes this loan will enable her daughter get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila  is married and earns a living by operating a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells various items such as noodles, coffee, soap, bread, cooking oil and seasonings. She earns additional income by fishing and selling the fish she catches. She has been fishing for 20 years. Leonila and her husband live in Dulag, Leyte, and she is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy items to sell, such as soft drinks, toiletries and beverages, and fishing materials such as fishing nets. This will allow her to improve her catch and offer her customers a greater variety of items to buy. In the future, Leonila hopes that both of her businesses will prosper so that she can improve her family's life.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, who is 62 years old, lives in a community in PreyVeng Province, Cambodia. He has two dependent children and three married children. To make a living, he operates and manages a rice farming business on a rice farmland, which is located near his house. So far, he has been in this career for more than twenty years. On average he generates earnings of USD 5.00 per day. 

Pov wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma est composé majoritairement de femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sabalibougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, de parures et la restauration. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Nana  (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 18 pièces de pagnes wax en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Sabalibougou à une clientèle mixte. Madame Nana  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma group is made up mostly of women in polygamous families. They are on average 43 years old with an average of 7 children each. The women all live in Sabalibougou, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and came to know each other as neighbors.

The members of the group sell clothing, trinkets, and food. In order to build up their stock of supplies, the members of the group decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso and they are now on their 3rd group loan cycle.

Nana (the woman featured on the far right of the photo) has a good reputation as a clothing seller. She plans to use her loan to purchase 18 pieces of wax "pagne" cloth from wholesalers in Bamako. She will resell them at retail in Sabalibougou to a customer base made up of both men and women. 

Nana hopes that with this loan she will earn an average monthly income of 90,000 francs CFA which she will use to reinvest in her business. Her goal is to purchase a plot of land to live on as a result of this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Dinh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Dinh, born in 1989, is a Thai ethnic person. She lives with her husband and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding. The income from these activities is used to cover her family’s living costs and her children’s education costs. She is trying to improve yields but lacks funds, so she is looking to borrow some money to buy fertilizer for the coffee plants.

She desires a loan amount that will support her family to invest well in cultivation, and the next harvest season her coffee field will have a higher yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the coffee plants.

loans.name: Hoa's Group

texts.en: Mrs Hoa, who was born in 1984, lives in Vietnam but is ethnically Thai, and joined M7-MFI in 2007. She lives with her husband and two sons in the Mai Son district of Son La province. Her family’s main income comes from farming. She often uses chemical fertilizers to grow coffee but this year she learned about the effectiveness and impact of organic fertilizers on the environment, and decided to take out a loan from M7-MFI to buy organic fertilizer. Though the cost of purchasing organic fertilizers is twice the usual price, she expects this change will improve her field and increase the size of her harvest.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is an industrious woman from Dulag, Leyte. She sells food supplements to earn money for her family. She is raising five children, ages 8 to 22..She has been selling food supplements for 15 years. Because of a capital shortage to finance her business, Lorna has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP  to buy additional stocks of food supplements. In this way, she could sell more products and gain more yield. She could then afford to pay school fees and prepare healthy diets.

Lorna would like to expand her business and hopes someday she could start a rice retailer store that would help support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional food supplements

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Merlita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Merlita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mihrinisahan

texts.ru: Михринисахан 58 лет, не замужем, есть дочь. У Михринисахан - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается торговлей женской одеждой, стартовав в 1994 году с 5,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Михринисахан на сегодняшний день имеет товар в обороте на сумму 700,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Михринисахан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товаров в обороте. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и накопить средства на покупку квартиры.
texts.en: Mihrinisahan is 58 years old, not married and has one daughter. Mihrinisahan has a secondary education. To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in selling women's clothing, having started this business in 1994 with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today Mihrinisahan has a working capital of merchandise equal to 700,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Mihrinisahan requested a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to increase her goods turnover. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and saving money to buy an apartment.

loans.use: to purchase clothes in order to expand her selection and attract new customers

loans.name: Khuyen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs.  Khuyen was born in 1980, and she is currently living with her husband and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province. Both of her children are obedient and good students; her older son is in grade 10, and the younger son is in grade 6.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding animals. Because her two children are attending school, her family life is still in more difficulties. She has to pay for her children’s education costs at the first stage of the coming school year but she doesn’t have enough money. So she really wants to borrow a loan from the program of M7-MFI to pay her children’s education expenses. 

She expects that the loan she will take out will help reduce difficulties for her family and make her children not be worried about fees and feel ensured for studying, and become useful citizens of the country.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s education expenses

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Pheap is 46, married and the mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She lives in a village in the Ponhea Krek district, where she has been farming rice and growing cassava for a living for the last 18 years. Pheap manages to earn about $12 a day to feed her family and children. She is requesting her first loan from VisionFund, and will use it to pay her son's tuition so her can study information technology. She hopes he can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Lai's Group

texts.en:
La was born in 1974 and is Thai. She joined the microfinance program in January 1999, and is one of the earliest members. Her family consists of six members, including her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law and her son's two children. Now, her family lives in Mai Son district, Son La province. 
Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding. This coming season, she needs to borrow money from M7-MFI to buy fertilizer for maize plants and coffee plants. She hopes the loan will help her family invest effectively, and that the coming harvest will bring a higher yield so her family will have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business vending root crops in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more root crops to sell to her customers.

Marilyn has been in this business for five years. Marilyn earns additional income from weaving.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more root crops to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 31-year-old married mother of three children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Marivic has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like coconut and sugar for her business.

Marivic has been in this business for 10 years. Marivic would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like coconut and sugar for her food production business

loans.name: María Transito

texts.es:
María de 59 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos ambos mayores de edad y con su propio hogar y familias.  No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, su esposo es agricultor y solo él vive con ella.

María tiene un pequeño negocio en el que vende pan relleno, pasteles de carne , papas fritas entre otros bocadillos todos los fines de semana y de lunes a viernes trabaja en una granja vecina que está a 200 mts de su casa, ella es la encargada de la vacunación de los pollos.

El préstamo será invertido en su negocio, comprara papas, harina de maíz, pan carne aceite y demás para aprovechar la temporada, pues en estos momento es que se pone muy popular el consumo de estos productos. María sueña con tener una tienda que le permita ganancias suficientes para mantener su hogar
texts.en:
María is 59 years old, is married and has two children who are both adults with their own home and families. She didn't have the opportunity to go to school. Her husband is a farmer, and he is the only person who lives with her. 

María has a small business in which she sells stuffed bread, meat cakes, french fries and other snacks every weekend. Monday to Friday she works on a neighbouring farm that is 200 metres from her house. She is in charge of vaccinating the chickens. 

The loan will be invested in her business. She will buy potatoes, corn flour, bread, meat, oil, and other food items to take advantage of the season, since the consumption of these products becomes more popular this time of year. María dreams of having a store which would give her sufficient earnings to support her home.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, corn flour, bread, meat, oil, other food items.

loans.name: Mean's Group

texts.en: Mean’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Mean makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work selling grocery items at home to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both of these group members safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Yeu's Group

texts.en:
Yeu, born in 1972, is living with her family in the Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family consists of four members, including herself, her husband, her son and her daughter. Her children are studying hard with her son studying in college.
Her family's main occupation is cultivation and breeding and the income is just enough to cover family living expenses. She is willing to invest in education for her children, but needs to borrow money to pay for her children’s tuition.
She expects the loan will help her family reduce its difficulties, and her children will feel secure to study. Her children will contribute a small part to build their homeland in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s tuition

loans.name: Sal

texts.en:
Sal has been a farmer for a long time. Her husband has been a motorbike taxi driver for 30 years. They have been married since 2002. Sal lives in Cheung Ek village about 10 kilometers from maxima, Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She wants to apply for a loan to buy more cows to raise.
She hopes that the next year she can earn money from the cows.

loans.use: To buy more cows to raise.

loans.name: Toem

texts.en:
Toem (shown in the photo) is 46 years old and lives at Chbar Ampov district along the Mekong River. She has been married since 2000 and has four sons and three daughters. Three are married and two are still young. 

Toem has been a seller of furniture for two years, while her husband is a carpenter who makes many kinds of furniture with five years' experience. Now Toem would like to apply for a loan to purchase more wood to make furniture to sell.

She very much hopes that after it is sold, she can earn more money to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase wood to make tables (furniture)

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a 46-year-old married mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in hog raising for more than eight years now. 
Mercedita is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed and to pay for the repair of the pigpen. With this loan, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business as well as her income. In the future, Mercedita of expanding her piggery to make it more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed and to pay for the repair of the pigpen

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, and spices for her food-production business.

Marlyn has been in this business for three years. Marlyn earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, and spices for her food production business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a 40-year-old married mother of four children, two currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Mary Ann has a native vinegar vending business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more containers of vinegar to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more containers of vinegar to sell

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador is a 54-year old man from Baybay, Leyte. He has two grown children he raised as a single father. Dominador works hard on his farm to earn a living. He grows bananas, taro, cassava, sweet potatoes and coconuts on his farm. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer so he can expect a better harvest in the days to come.

Dominador hopes to have a bigger farm so he can have a more stable income in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Altynbek

texts.ru: Алтынбек, 32 года, разведен, живет с 2 детьми дошкольного возраста. Алтынбек в зимнее время года подрабатывает в котельной, но в основном занимается животноводством и полеводством, по наследству ему досталось 2 лошади и 20 овец. На сегодняшний день, благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Алтынбека имеется 1 корова, 2 бычка, 15 овец, 2 лошади. Также у него есть 1,11 ГА собственной земли, где посажены картофель и эспорцет. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), целью которого является покупка овец и дойной коровы. Алтынбек уже начал заготавливать корм для скота на зимний период, так как зимой он содержит его дома. Доходы от кредита Алтынбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, также планирует откладывать средства на образование его детей.
texts.en: Altynbek is 32 years old, divorced and lives with his two school-age children. Altynbek works at a heating boiler station in the winter, but is primarily involved in animal husbandry and farming. He inherited 2 horses and 20 sheep. Today, thanks to his hard work, Altynbek's business contains 1 cow, 2 bulls, 15 sheep and 2 horses. He also has 1.11 hectares of owned land, where he planted potatoes and sainfoin. In order to further develop his business, Altynbek requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy sheep and a dairy cow. Altynbek plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing his business and also to save money for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy sheep and a dairy cow in order to be more profitable and save money for his children's education

loans.name: Thao's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thao, born in 1971, is a Kinh person, and she has been joining in the program of M7-MFI since 2012. She lives with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter, in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family life is mainly dependent on her husband’s meager salary, and she sells clothes to make more money to buy daily food for the whole family. 

She spends money to cover the family’s living costs and her children’s education costs at the same time, so it becomes more difficult to cover her children’s education costs. Therefore, she needs a loan to pay for her children’s education costs and invest more in their studies.

She expects this loan will help her children to complete their education and provide opportunities to access new knowledge and have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s education costs

loans.name: Nien's Group

texts.en:
Nien, born in 1980, is Thai. She lives with her husband and her two children in Mai Son district, Son La province.
She raises livestock and cultivates on burnt-over land and gardens. She works hard to feed her children with enough food and provide them an opportunity to go to school. She now wants to borrow a loan to invest in expanding her business of raising goats and cow breeding to increase their income and improve their lives. So, she really hopes to borrow a loan from M7-MFI.
She hopes the development of the breeding business will help her family invest more effectively. Thus the income will increase, then she will have money accumulated to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: to invest in expanding business of raising goats and cow breeding

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Thoeun, 45 years old, is a married man who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland, which is located near his house. On his farmland, he grows rice and sells his agricultural product to the local dealers. So far, he has been involved in this career for around 30 years. 

Thoeun would like to keep his rice growing well by using natural fertilizer on his farmland. Because there is insufficient money, he has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer to use in his farming process. 

With the support from this loan, Thoeun hopes his rice will grow well and produce more crops for him. He would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support to poor people.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Rea

texts.en:
Rea is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rea requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock of products like toothpaste, sugar, canned goods, diapers, sanitary pads, vinegar, and salt to sell.

Rea has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of products like toothpaste, sugar, canned goods, diapers, sanitary pads, vinegar, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Modelyn

texts.en:
Modelyn is single and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Modelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Modelyn has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Modelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. Myrna is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Myrna requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Myrna has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Thuy, born in 1983, is Thai and currently lives with her husband and her two children in Mai Son district, Son La province.
She has been with the program of M7-MFI for four years. During that time, she has been financially supported to raise chickens and her business has developed quite well. At present, she wants to expand her business further, raising pigs to diversify sources of supply to the market. She wants to borrow money to buy additional breeding chickens.
She very much expects the loan will help her expand and invest effectively, and thus her family life will be improved while also enabling her children to receive a better education.

loans.use: to buy breeding chickens

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun is 57 years old and lives in the Chbar Ampov district along the Mekong River. He had been married since 1979 and has three sons and five daughters. Seven are married and the other one is a factory worker.

Saroeun has been a motorbike taxi driver for 10 years. His wife has sold fish, shrimp, and squid for 20 years. He would like to apply for a loan to buy a motorbike to transport goods to sell at the market. He said that every day he takes his wife to the market before he goes to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Leonie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Leonie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling of personal collection products and gasoline retailing. Leonie is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Leonie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rhenalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rhenalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rhenalyn is borrowing 22,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like fish, vegetables, spices, and meat for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rhenalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like fish, vegetables, spices, and meat for her business.

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette is a 32-year-old married mother of four children, all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Nanette has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Nanette requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her business.

Nanette has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Nanette would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-vending business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 51 years old and is married with 7 children, one of whom is still in school. Evangeline works very hard to provide for all of them.

Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

Evangeline has been in this business for 1 year. 

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she can provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 52 years old and has one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Virginia has an abacá weaving business in the Philippines. Abacá fiber comes from the stems of a type of banana leaf; it is also known as Manila hemp. Virginia has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase additional abacá fiber for her business.

Virginia has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional abacá fiber for her weaving business.

loans.name: Hilda Esperanza

texts.es:
Hilda de 57 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado de educación básica, tiene 27 años de casada y su esposo es comerciante, vende sal que extrae del mar. Únicamente vive con su esposo.

Hilda al igual que su esposo es comerciante, tiene 6 años de administrar una tienda con la que aprendió por iniciativa propia al ver que en su comunidad solo había una tienda y no abastecía totalmente la demanda de los clientes, además tenía cierta experiencia en comercio trabajando con so esposo.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar productos para su tienda, arroz, azúcar, frijoles,  maíz, productos de cocina y de higiene personal entre otros, esto servirá para abastecer su tienda que prácticamente es la única en la zona donde ella vive.

Hilda sueña con una tienda más grande al grado de convertirla en un “mini súper” y se vea como la tienda principal de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Hilda is 57 years old and studied to the 6th grade of basic education. She has been married for 27 years and her husband is a merchant; he sells salt that he extracts from the sea. She and her husband live by themselves.

Hilda, like her husband, is a merchant. She has 6 years experience administering a store, a business that she learned from her own initiative after noting that there was just one store in her community and it could not totally supply customer demand. Moreover, she had useful experience in commerce from working with her husband.

The loan will be used to purchase products for her store: rice, sugar, beans, corn, and kitchen and personal hygiene products, among others. This will serve to restock her store, which is now practically the only one in the zone where she lives. 

Hilda dreams of enlarging her store, converting it into a mini-super market. She envisions it becoming the main store in the community.

loans.use: to buy products for her store: rice, sugar, beans, corn, and kitchen and personal hygiene products, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok (shown in the photo) is 39 years old and lives in Chbar Ampov district along the Mekong river.

Sok had been married since 2001, and he has two sons and one daughter. One attends school and the other two are still too young.

Sok has been a blacksmith for 10 years, while his wife is housewife. He wants to apply for a loan to brick up the floor in his house, because the house is old and he wants to repair it better.

He comments that he will have a new house and comfortable life for his family.

loans.use: to brick up the floor in his house.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business in the Philippines where she sells ready-to-wear clothing.

Victoria has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers, such as pants, shorts, blouses, etc. 

Victoria has been in this business for 5 years now.

Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of ready-to-wear clothing such as pants, shorts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 38-year old married mother of four children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Norma has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional used clothing to sell to her customers.

Norma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Norma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional used clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is a 25-year-old married mother of three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Nimfa has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Nimfa requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

Nimfa has been in this business for five years. In the future, Nimfa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Roberto Alirio

texts.es: Roberto tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus  dos hijos de 5 años y 4 años de edad quienes a la fecha se encuentran estudiando. Roberto se dedica a la venta de variedad de medicamentos como: vitaminas, jarabes para tos, aspirinas, analgésicos, etc. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Tiene mucho tiempo de contar con este negocio y gracias a su carisma y buenos precios de sus productos ya cuente con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de medicina como: jarabes para la tos, aspirinas, vitaminas, pomadas, analgésicos, etc.
texts.en: Roberto is 37 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two children, aged 5 and 4, who go to school. Roberto sells a variety of medicines such as vitamins, cough syrup, aspirin, painkillers, etc. In this way he makes a living and supports his household. He has been doing this business for a long time, and thanks to his charisma and good prices, he has many customers who are increasingly loyal. He has made the decision to apply to FUSAI for this loan to invest in more medicine such as cough syrup, aspirin, vitamins, ointments, painkillers, etc.

loans.use: to buy cough syrup, aspirin, vitamins, ointments, painkillers, etc.

loans.name: Hector Abraham

texts.es: Héctor de 19 años de edad es soltero y habita en vivienda propia desde hace 8 años junto a su grupo familiar. Él es un hombre que cada día busca la forma de salir adelante apoyado en su pequeño negocio de carpintería, en el cual desde hace 3 años elabora diferentes muebles a base de madera como: roperos, gaveteros, juegos de mesa y de sala, etc. Además en las mañanas ordeña las vacas de una hacienda obteniendo un poco más de ingresos. Héctor desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que el solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Héctor, who is 19 years old, is single and has lived in his own house for 8 years with his family group. He is a man who is always looking for a way to get on in life. He supports himself with his small carpentry business where for the last 3 years he has been making wooden furniture such as wardrobes, chests of drawers, dining and living room sets etc. As well as this he milks cows on a farm every morning, which gives him a bit more income.

Héctor wants to replace the roof on his home as it is in a poor condition, and this is why he is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanised sheets, wood and nails to replace the roof of his home.

loans.use: to buy galvanised sheets, wood and nails to replace the roof of his home.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is 32 years old and single.

Victorina is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Victorina has been in pig-fattening for one year now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Victorina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Isaí Moisés

texts.es:
Isaí de 24 años de edad, y tiene 2 hijos uno de 3 años de edad y otro de 3 meses de edad. Solo pudo estudiar hasta 9° grado de educación básica debido a la situación económica de su familia, por lo que tuvo que trabajar. Su esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa y a cuidar a los niños, además de su esposa y sus hijos, con Isaí viven también sus padres pare solo su esposa e hijos dependen de él.

Isaí trabaja como vendedor para una panadería, vende pan dulce y francés y le que la comisión 30% del total de lo que vende, ya tiene cerca de 2 años trabajando de esta manera y fue un amigo que le menciono que el trabajo era bastante bueno. Todos los días trabaja de 1:00 pm hasta las 7:00 pm y recorre aproximadamente 20km porque visita todas las comunidades vecinas.

El préstamo será utilizado para pagar gastos médicos de su hermano que se encuentra muy mal de salud y y siente que debe apoyarlo por lo menos de esta manera.

El préstamo será utilizado para gastos de salud de su hermano que se encuentra bastante mal de salud, y que por ser hermano mayor le toca responder con una parte de dinero. La mejora que el préstamo ara es el poder apoyar a su familia cuando más le necesitan.

Isaí espera seguir trabajando y prepararse para cuando su hijo inicie la escuela, además cubrir los gastos del hogar y procurar tener un ahorro siempre.
texts.en:
Isaí is 24 years old, he has two children, one three year old and one three month old. He could only study until the 9th grade of basic education as he had to go out to work due to the economic situation of his family. His wife takes care of the home and looks after their children. As well as his wife and children Isai lives with his parents, but only his wife and children are dependent on him.

Isaí works selling bread for a bakery, he sells sweet and French bread and he gets a commission of 30% of the total that he sells. He has been working in this way for almost 2 years, it was a friend who told him that the work was pretty good. He works every day from 1pm until 7pm and travels approximately 20km as he visits all of the neighbouring communities.

The loan will be used to pay the medical expenses of his brother, who is in very bad health, and he feels he has to support him not least by helping him in this way with part of the money, as he is the older brother. The benefit the loan will offer is to allow him to support his family when they need it most.

Isaí hopes to continue working and prepare for when his son begins school, as well as covering the household expenses and always trying to keep some savings.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses of his brother.

loans.name: Roche

texts.en:
Roche is 32 years old and has two children. Roche is married and her two children are in school.

Roche is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Roche requested a loan of 16,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Roche has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 34 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se esfuerza para salir adelante vendiendo diversidad de productos como: tortillas, queso y verduras, estas ventas las realiza desde hace 8 años en su cantón por lo que es muy reconocida por la calidad de sus productos. Juana habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hijo, además hace algún tiempo también vive con ellos su abuela, es ese motivo el que la motiva a querer ampliar su vivienda, para tener así un lugar para ofrecerle a su abuela, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para ampliar su vivienda y poder tener un poco más de comodidad en la misma.
texts.en:
Juana is 34 years old and is a hardworking woman who strives to move ahead in life selling a variety of products such as tortillas, cheese and vegetables. She has been doing this for 8 years in her local area, and is very well known for the quality of her products.

Juana lives in her own home together with her husband and son. In addition her grandmother has been living with them for some time and this is the reason for making her want to extend her house, to be able to offer space to her grandmother. She has therefore taken the decision to ask FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanised sheet metal, wood and nails to extend her house and enable it to be a little more comfortable.

loans.use: to invest in galvanised sheet metal, wood and nails to extend her house.

loans.name: Mark Joseph

texts.en:
Mark Joseph is a fish vendor. He sells fish to the locals in his community. He uses a motorcycle, as the means of transporting his stock. He is 22 years old, a married man, and a father of a three-year-old daughter. Together with his family, he lives in Dulag, Leyte.

He has been in the same kind of business for more than five years, now. Mark Joseph has requested a loan of 23,000 PHP, which he will use to buy fuel for the motorcycle and as additional capital to buy a variety of fresh fish. This will help him cater to various customers, and will help improve his sales.

With the additional capital, Mark Joseph would like to expand his business. His goals are to uplift his way of living and to support the needs of his growing child.

loans.use: to buy fuel for the motorcycle and a variety of fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Wella

texts.en:
Wella is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a firewood business in the Philippines. Wella has been in this business for four years, and she earns more income from farming vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more firewood to sell to her customers, for her firewood business.

Wella has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mirasol is 37 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Mirasol has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft drinks, beer, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Mirasol has been in this business for three years. In the future, Mirasol would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft drinks, beer, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 58 years old and married; she has four children. Adela works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

In the future, Adela would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Hello lenders. Meet Evaline, a very industrious, honest, and hardworking woman from the Kericho area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley. 

Evaline, 34, has been farming for the past 10 years. Over this time, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She practices mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, vegetables, and other various crops, as well as some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. 

Evaline is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not doing comfortably and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. 

Kenya's Kericho area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Evaline could increase her profits by satisfying the demand. 

While accessing capital has been a challenge for Evaline, she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Evaline believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the market's demand for cereals. 

Evaline also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Evaline to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Kim, born in 1990, is a Thai ethnic person. She joined the program of M7-MFI in January 2012 and is an exemplary member who always helps other people in her group and cluster. Her family has four members, her, her husband, her elder son and her young daughter. Her family lives in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding animals. Because her children are still small, her family is faced with many difficulties. With the hope that her children will have a better life, she gets up early to work and only stops work when sunset comes. Now, she really wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for her coffee in view of the coming harvest. 

The loan borrowed from M7-MFI will help her family to settle difficulties at the beginning of the harvest. She expects the coming harvest will bring a high yield for her coffee plants, and so her income will be higher.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rafael Alberto

texts.es: Rafael de 29 años de edad es un joven trabajador y responsable que se gana la vida como albañil independiente, actividad que le ha permitido salir adelante y apoyar a su compañera de vida y su hijo, por lo que se siente muy feliz y satisfecho de poder contar con este trabajo desde hace 6 años. Rafael habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo desde hace 6 años por lo que se siente muy feliz de contar con este beneficio. La vivienda de Rafael está hecha de lámina, pero en un cuarto de esta la lámina se encuentra completamente dañada, por lo que él desea cambiarla por lámina nueva y es para ello que Rafael solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar la lámina de un cuarto de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rafael, aged 29, is a hard-working and responsible young man who earns a living as an independent bricklayer. This job has enabled him to get on in life and support his life partner and their son, and so he feels very happy and satisfied to have had this job for 6 years.

Rafael has lived in his own house with his life partner and their son for 6 years and he feels very happy to have this benefit. Rafael's home is made of sheeting, but in one of the rooms the sheeting is totally damaged and so he wants to replace it with new sheeting. This is why Rafael is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanised sheets, wood and nails to change the sheeting of one of the rooms in his home.

loans.use: to buy galvanised sheets, wood and nails to change the sheeting of one of the rooms in his home.

loans.name: Aleida

texts.es: Aleida de 35 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos en vivienda propia desde hace 16 años.
