Ella es una mujer que se esfuerza y lucha cada día para llevar el sustento a su familia, por medio de su negocio en el cual compra y vende quesos fresco en los cantones cercanos a su domicilio desde hace 15 años por lo que sus clientes siempre la esperan para comprar sus productos. La cocina de Aleida está hecha de adobe, pero esta ya tiene algún tiempo de construcción, por lo que está bastante deteriorada, es por eso que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena y grava para reparar la cocina de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Aleida is 35 years old and has lived in her own home along with her husband and their three children for 16 years.

She is a woman who strives and fights every day for the daily sustenance of her family. She does this through her business, buying and selling fresh cheeses in the areas close to where she lives. She has been doing this for 15 years, and her customers always wait for her to buy her products.

Aleida’s kitchen is made of adobe, but is already of quite old construction and is in poor condition, so she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in bricks, cement, sand and gravel to repair her kitchen.

loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, sand and gravel to repair the kitchen of her house.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: Mercedes del Socorro mayor de edad soltera con dos hijos mayores de edad originaria de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, es una microempresaria administradora y propietaria de sus propios negocios los cuales consisten en la venta de sopas de res con punche, gallina con albóndigas, mondongo todos los fines de semana, tambien la venta de mercadería en general como: calzados, cosméticos, acero, trajes de niños, blusas, maquillajes entre otros estos son por encargos que entrega a sus clientes y la elaboración y venta de cócteles de conchas y camarones los que entrega semanal y tambien de forma ambulante, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales sus ventas son al contado y la mayor parte al crédito los cuales recupera semanal, quincenal lo invertido, sus compras son al contado en mercados y acopios de mariscos, negocio el cual lo conoce muy bien ya son 17 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocios, y uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su vivienda y de incrementar aun mas su negocio ya que su demanda de cliente ha incrementado, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de zapatos, cosméticos, ropa para adultos y niños, acero, para aprovechar estos últimos meses antes de navidad que es cuando sus ventas son mayores y al compra de productos de consumo para la elaboración de sopas y compras de conchas, camarones, limones, cebollas, tomates salsas entre otros mas, Mercedes del Socorro muy agradecida con el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrecen a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Mercedes del Socorro is a single adult with two adult children. She is a native of Chinandega in the west of the country. And she is a micro-entreprenuer, administrator, and proprietor of her own businesses, consisting of selling beef soup with crab, chicken with beans, and tripe, every weekend. In addition, she sells general merchandise, such as shoes, cosmetics, adornments, children's clothing, blouses, and make up, among other things. These can be by customer orders. She also makes shrimp and shell fish cocktails weekly, for delivery and street vending. Mercedes has both casual and a fixed set of customers. She sells for cash but most use credit, which she collects weekly or bi-weekly.

Her purchases are made by cash in markets and with shell fish venders. She knows this business very well, with 17 years dedicated to this type of business. One of her dreams is to be able to improve her life and to expand business, now that her customer demand has increased. The object of this new fanancing is to invest working capital in purchasing general merchandise such as various styles of shoes, cosmetics, clothing for adults and children, and adornments, and to take advantage of these final months before Christmas when sales are greater, and to purchase products for making soups, buying shell fish, shrimp, lemons, onions, tomatoes, and salsas, among other things. 

Mercedes del Socorro is very grateful for the help Kiva investors offer to people of reduced economic resources.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to purchase general merchandise; cosmetics, lemons, shell fish, and shrimp, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: o buy a computer to search for information at home.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and three of her children are currently in school.

Rosario has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rosario has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rowena is 39 years old and all of her children are in school.

Rowena has a buy-and-sell dressed chicken business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional dressed chicken to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dressed chicken to sell.

loans.name: Ariane

texts.en:
Ariane is 31 years old, is a married woman, and has three children. One of her children is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business selling beauty products, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

Ariane requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy additional beauty products to sell.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional beauty products to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 54 years old and married, with four children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

Amelita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 37 years old, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ana Marie has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business.

Ana Marie has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. She is a married woman and has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

Cristina requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for ten years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es: Norma tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 14 años y 12 años de edad. Norma posee una pequeña tienda la cual con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que desea mantenerlo activo por mucho más tiempo. Norma solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor variedad de productos para la tienda. Con el monto comprará productos de tienda como: golosinas, cereales, aceite, condimentos, especies, etc.
texts.en:
Norma is 32 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children aged 14 and 12.

Norma has a small shop which she has managed to set up through a lot of hard work. This business is her main source of income and so she wants to keep it going for a long time in the future. 

Norma is asking FUSAI for this loan to buy a wider variety of products for the shop. She will use the sum to buy items for the shop such as sweets, cereals, oil, condiments, spices etc.

loans.use: to buy sweets, cereals, oil, condiments, spices etc.

loans.name: Santas

texts.en:
Santas is 58 years old and married with one child.

Santas works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items, such as toothpaste, cereals, coffee, chocolate drinks, milk, juice, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

Santas has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Santas aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items, such as toothpaste, cereals, coffee, chocolate drinks, milk, juice, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 62 years old and married with two children.  

Teresita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for 25 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Grupo Mujeres De Sas Group

texts.es:
Mujer emprendedora de 40 años de edad residente en Sololá, casada con un hijo de 15 años que se dedica a estudiar en la escuela de la comunidad donde viven cursando tercero básico,  ella tiene que realizar un esfuerzo enorme para poder mantener a su familia y ver la forma de cómo mejorar el sistema económica de su familia. (Alicia es la que se encuentra de 1ra de derecha a izquierda en la fotografía)

La actividad que realiza Alicia es la venta de ropa típica ya que para ella es una fuente importante de ingreso para su familia, para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida que actualmente viven  en su comunidad, ella realiza una segunda actividad que es la venta de incienso, siempre tratando la forma de cómo tener un ingreso económico extra para poder darle a su hijo el estudio que se merece y que algún día llega a ser un profesional en la vida.

El uso respectivo que Alicia le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de más ropa típica para luego venderlas en su comunidad y vecinos para tener un mejor ingreso económico  para ella y su familia.

Alicia y un grupo de mujeres más sueñan con alcanzar sus sueños en la vida que es llegar a superarse en la vida y ver por los demás que los necesitan para superarse.

Una de sus metas futuras es la compra de un local en su comunidad para que ella pueda realizar la venta de su mercadería y ver crecer a su hijo en la escuela y llegar a ser un profesional en la vida y que tenga una condición de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Alicia (on the far right of the photo) is an entrepreneurial woman of 40 years of age. She lives in Sololá and is married with a 15 year old son who is studying at the local school in 3rd basic grade. She has to make an enormous effort to be able to maintain her family and to see a way in which to improve the economic system of her family.

Alicia earns a living selling traditional clothing, which for her is an important source of income for her family. To be able to improve the living conditions that they live in within their community, she undertakes a second job, selling incense. She is always looking for a way to have an extra economic income to be able to give her son the education he deserves so that one day he can become a professional person in life.

Alicia will use the loan that she is asking for to buy more traditional clothing to sell in her community and neighbouring ones, to have a better economic income for herself and her family.

Alicia and the group of women dream of reaching their goals in life, namely to better themselves and see that others have what they need to succeed in life also.

One of her future goals is to buy a place in her community where she can sell her merchandise and also to see her son grow in school and become a professional and that he has a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise of traditional clothing.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo de 48 años de edad es un hombre emprendedor que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad en el cual además vende otros artículos como: cremas, lociones, manteles, maquillajes, etc. Y es gracias a ello que ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio. Él es un hombre de hogar que vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 16 y 12 años de edad. Alfredo se siente muy feliz con su negocio ya que gracias a él está sacando adelante a sus hijos y su vivienda, por lo que él desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI para invertir en: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, huevos, pan, golosinas, etc.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 48, is an enterprising man who earns a living from his shop selling basic everyday groceries, where he also sells other items such as creams, lotions, tablecloths, make-up etc. It is thanks to this that he has been able to make progress with his business. 

He is a home-loving man who lives with his life partner and their 2 children aged 16 and 12. Alfredo feels very happy about his business as this means he is able to bring up his children and improve his home. This is why he wants to have a loan from FUSAI to buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee, eggs, bread, sweets etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee, eggs, bread, sweets etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 55-year-old widowed woman with eight children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 
 
Victoria has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

Victoria has been in this business for ten years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cecilia is 45 years old now.

Cecilia has a welding shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Caroline, 40 years of age, a very hard-working, honest, and dedicated farmer, who lives in Kaptumo, a remote village in Nandi Hills. She is happily married and blessed with six adorable children. 

For the last ten years, Caroline has been practicing mixed farming and she has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small, personal business. 

The Nandi Hills area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. 

Caroline lacks funds to increase her poultry farming and she is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva, she feels relieved, knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. 

Through the loan, Caroline will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry business to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. 

The extra income Caroline will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions, and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Five years ago, Caren started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in Cheplangat, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of one child sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart, and she is proud to wake up every day to milk her cow. Although she makes profits by selling milk, she lacks a proper dairy unit and is seeking a loan to build one. A good dairy unit provides a place where cows can relax, and also prevents them from coming down with diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather such as rain. 

Caren believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save the money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. 

Caren thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Antonietta

texts.en:
Antonietta is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 34 years old, and both of her children are in school.

Antonietta has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and pay electric bills.

In the future, Antonietta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and pay electric bills.

loans.name: Dakan Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Dakan  sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé cercle de Kati; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de,  bois chauffe, arachides, poissons et grains de céréales. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Safiatou (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de  bois de chauffe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 chargements du bois de chauffe en gros dans les villages environnants de  Bamako. La revente se fait  au comptant Kanadjiguila et à crédits à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Safiatou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de mes enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The four women of the group called  Dakan are, for the most part, married and living in polygamous households. They are on average 32 years old  and have on average three children each. They all live in  Kanadjiguila, in the township of Mandé, Kati administrative circle. They met through being neighbors and through their income-generating activities in Kanadjiguila. The members of the group make small-scale sales of firewood, peanuts, fish, and cereals. 

Wishing to pay cash when stocking up on goods, the members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second solidarity loan. 

Madame Safiatou (the woman standing at the far right in the photo) has a good reputation for selling firewood. She intends to use her loan to buy two loads of firewood, wholesale, in the villages surrounding Bamako. She resells the wood for cash or for credit in Kanadjiguila to a clientele composed mostly of women. 

On the basis of this loan, Madame Safiatou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90,000 F CFA which will be used to reinvest in her activity and to ensure the well-being of "the children in my household".

loans.use: to buy firewood for resale so that she can ensure the well-being of the children in her household

loans.name: Graciela Amalia

texts.es: Graciela de 43 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida vendiendo productos lácteos que ella misma prepara y zapatos en un lugar de mucha afluencia de personas, por lo que ha logrado hacerse de una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre buscan sus productos. Ella es una mujer alegre que vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 16, 10 y 7 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace ya 18 años. Graciela se siente feliz con su negocio ya que este le da muy buenas ganancias, pero ha observado que cada día son más los clientes que solicitan sus productos, por lo que ella ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: zapatos y lácteos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Graciela is 43 years old. She is a cheerful woman, who has lived with her husband and their three children—aged 16, 10, and 7—at their own home over the past 18 years.

She is a hard-working woman, who makes a living selling dairy products—which she prepares herself—and shoes at a place where there is heavy foot traffic. For this reason, she has managed to attract many customers, who are always looking for her products.

Graciela is very happy with her business because it generates good profits. However, she has noticed that each day there is a growing demand for her products. For this reason, she has made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in shoes and dairy products for her business.

loans.use: to invest in shoes and dairy products.

loans.name: Edwin Francisco

texts.es: Edwin de 44 años de edad es un hombree que cada día se esfuerza por salir adelante junto a su esposa y sus 5 hijos de 18, 16, 14, 12 y 8 años de edad con los que habita en vivienda propia desde hace 15 años. Él es un hombre que siempre busca la manera de salir adelante con su trabajo como albañil independiente, el que realiza desde hace 18 años por lo que ya tiene establecida una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre buscan sus servicios. Para poder realizar bien su trabajo Edwin necesita algunas herramientas con la que no cuenta o que ya dejaron de brindar su vida útil, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pulidora, taladro, almágana, martillos, etc. Para poder realizar bien su trabajo de albañil.
texts.en: Edwin is 44 years old and is a man who works hard every day to get ahead.  He lives together with his wife and their five children ages 18, 16, 14, 12 and 8. They have lived in their own home for the past 15 years.  He is a man who always tries to improve in his work as an independent brick layer. He began this business 18 years ago so he has a well-establish client base that always seeks out his services.  In order to do his job well, Edwin needs some tools that he doesn't currently own or that are no longer usable.  For this reason he has decided to request a loan from Kiva partner FUSAI in order to invest in a polishing machine, a drill, a sledgehammer, hammers, etc. in order to continue in his work as a brick layer.

loans.use: to invest in a polishing machine, a drill, a sledgehammer, hammers, etc. in order to continue in his work as a brick layer.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Rhoda, a mother of two from Nandi Hills, a remote town in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. She has spent the past five years of her life farming. She sells eggs, tea, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in personal business to make ends meet. 

Rhoda is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her animals. She is so close with her animals that she has nicknamed one of them “Koroti,” meaning no feathers on the head. 

Rhoda wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of KES 32,000, which she will use to buy additional poultry. With your loan, Rhoda will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. She is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. 

Rhoda dreams of a secure future for her children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry to earn income for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and both of her children are in school.

Rosemarie has a buy-and-sell processed food business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Rosemarie requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of processed food to sell to restart her business activities.

Rosemarie has been in this business for three years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of processed food to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman, 53 years old, and has one child. 

Editha is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, etc.

Editha has been in this business for ten years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Editha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара, 59 лет, замужем, есть двое сыновей. У Гулсары - высшее образование, она работает преподавателем английского языка в школе. Также в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1995 году, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулсары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 4 лошади, а также имеет земельный надел размером 2,60 ГА, на котором Гулсара ежегодно выращивает ячмень под внутрихозяйственное потребление и реализацию. Ежемесячный доход Гулсары составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота. Гулсара хочет сохранить и приумножить скот, чтобы иметь возможность накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Gulsara is 59 years old, married and has two sons. Gulsara has a higher education and works as an English-language teacher at a school. Also, to provide additional income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business in 1995 with an 8,000 som (KGS) purchase of livestock. Thanks to Gulsara's hard work, today her business contains 2 cows, 4 horses, and 2.60 hectares of land, where she annually grows barley for the household consumption and sale. Gulsara's monthly income amounts to about 13,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Gulsara requested a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock feed. Gulsara wants to retain and increase her livestock headcount in order to have an ability to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mary Jane is 40 years old and has four children who are in school.

Mary Jane has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Mary Jane has been in this business for three years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other materials needed for her bicycle transport business

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 42 years old and married with three children; two of her children are in school, Nora works very hard to provide for them.

Nora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, beverages, cigarettes, etc.

Nora has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Nora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, beverages, cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Clarita is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Clarita has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. Clarita requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Clarita has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Clarita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Al- Wahda* Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Wahda*. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.

Kheria is the leader of the group. She is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of four children, living with them in a humble house in Sana'a. Kheria studied till Elementary education, but she couldn't complete her studies. Her husband works as a guard with a private hospital for a very small salary and it is not enough to cover the necessary expenses of the family. 

Kheria decided to help him through selling many kinds of accessories, door to door. Also, her income from that business is not enough to cover the main expenses of the house. The house where she lives with her family lacks a lot of furniture and she doesn't have enough money. For this reason, Kheria applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to furnish her house.

Kheria looks forward to having a good amount of working capital to run her business very well.

loans.use: to furnish her house

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Fotemogoban est composé majoritairement de femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune Mandé dans le cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, de chaussures, de mèches,  du bois de chauffe et du savon. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sali  (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 18 pièces de pagnes wax en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila  à une clientèle mixte. Madame Sali  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
This group called Fotemogoban is made up mainly of polygamous women. They have an average age of 35 years and on average four children each. They all live in  Kanadjiguila, in Mandé township, in the administrative circle of Kati, and came to know each other because they are neighbors. The members of the group make small-scale sales of clothing, shoes, hair extensions, firewood, and soap. Wishing to grow their working capital, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second solidarity loan. 

Madame Sali  (the woman standing second, right to left, in the photo) has a great reputation for selling clothing (African print cloth of the highest quality). She intends to use her loan to buy 18 lengths of "wax" print cloth, wholesale, in Bamako. She resells the cloth retail in Kanadjiguila, to a mixed clientele.

With this loan, Madame Sali  hopes to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 F CFA which will be used to reinvest in her activity. In this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso, she has the goal of buying a plot of land to build a house on.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Bernadeta

texts.en:
Bernadeta is 57 years old and married. 

Bernadeta is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Bernadeta has been in pig fattening for twenty years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Bernadeta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Catalina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

Catalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
Cora is 26 years old and single.

Cora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like shampoo, sanitary pads, diapers, toothpaste, coffee, shampoo, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Cora has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from selling bamboo.

Cora aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like shampoo, sanitary pads, diapers, toothpaste, coffee, shampoo, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa is 47 years old and has two children. Diosa is married and has one child who is still in school.

Diosa is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Diosa requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Diosa has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Diosa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rowena is 44 years old and has six children who are in school.

Rowena has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fruits to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion works hard to support her family. Consolacion is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Consolacion requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Consolacion has been in this business for 15 years.

Consolacion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is 53 years old and married with seven children, and one of her children is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Wilfreda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as, canned goods, cigarettes, groceries, etc.

Wilfreda has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future, Wilfreda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as, canned goods, cigarettes, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Agnes, a hardworking, very honest and warm-hearted farmer who hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. Agnes is the proud mother of five lovely children whom she really loves and adores and always protects. Agnes' upbringing was very challenging, and because of this, she promised herself that she would work hard to get out of poverty. That is why she started farming eight years ago. Through farming, she has been able to earn a decent income. Agnes is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her three children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life. 

Agnes is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticulture farming. Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Agnes is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change. Through the income from horticulture farming, Agnes will assure her children of a bright future and will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 62 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gertrudes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, cigarettes, beverages, etc.

Gertrudes has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Gertrudes would like to help her grandchildren to finish their studies, and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, cigarettes, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Ediza

texts.en:
Ediza is 33 years old and married with two children. With both children currently in school, Ediza works very hard to provide for them.

Ediza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Ediza has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, coffee, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc. 

In the future, Ediza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 54 years old, married, and has seven children, one of whom is still in school.

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feed, and other supplies for her business.

Elizabeth has been raising livestock for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Teresa Antonia

texts.es: Teresa de 24 años de edad es una mujer que buscando la manera de sacar adelante a su familia decidió hace 10 años colocar una venta de licuados y productos de belleza, en su vivienda, ya que ella desde muy pequeña aprendió a ganarse la vida. Ella es una mujer alegre que vive con su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 3 años por lo que se siente satisfecha de poder contar con este beneficio. Teresa ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisas, productos de belleza, etc. Para poder seguir surtiendo su negocio y mantener la clientela con la que ya cuenta.
texts.en:
Teresa is 24 years old and is a woman who is looking for a way to provide for her family. Ten years ago she began selling smoothies (drinks) and beauty products from home, as she learned how to work at a very young age.

She is a cheerful woman who lives with her partner and their small son of 5 years old. They have lived in their own home for 3 years and she is happy to have this advantage.

Theresa has decided to ask for a loan from FUSAI to invest in skirts, blouses, trousers, shirts, beauty products etc. so that she can stock her business and keep her current customers.

loans.use: to invest in skirts, blouses, trousers, shirts, beauty products etc.
